excerpts:
To start: 

- Agedashi tofu (fried tofu)
- Inari (sticky rice wrapped in sweet tofu) 

The agedashi tofu had the right batter which absorbed the sauce really well. 

The inari was delicious and pretty standard... hard to mess it up.
agedashi tofu.author: Michael T.
agedashi tofu.review:
I am so confused as to why there are so many negative reviews! 

Came here for a quick lunch with a friend, and I was thoroughly impressed. 

Upon sitting, we were asked what we wanted to drink (I think the waitress could see all the sweat dripping from my face, as we conquered a few hills to reach Kippu). We were served water promptly.

To start: 

- Agedashi tofu (fried tofu)
- Inari (sticky rice wrapped in sweet tofu) 

Both were fantastic. The agedashi tofu had the right batter which absorbed the sauce really well. 

The inari was delicious and pretty standard... hard to mess it up. 

My friend got a bento box with chicken teriyaki and tempura. I got the bento with chicken teriyaki and gyoza. 

Was it good? 

Well, with little talking in between, at the end I looked at our bento boxes. Every section of each of our bentos was cleaned out. 

It was good. 

A huge bonus and very much appreciated was the service. EFFICIENT and FRIENDLY! 

Seriously, as soon as we finished our appetizers, the empty/dirty dishes were immediately removed or replaced. Water was constantly filled up. When we finished one dish, the waitress would remind us that our next dishes were still on the way.

5/5 Stars. See you again, Kippu.

excerpts: Two stars for delicious agedashi tofu.
Yes, there is this layer of brown, umami goo caking the tofu.
agedashi tofu.author: Joy G.
agedashi tofu.review:
The sushi menu is basically a Willy Wonka wonderland for anyone who is sick of the basic California roll - if you're at all an indecisive freak like me, you will change your mind at least five times before the waitress comes to take your order and then change your mind while you are ordering. I ended up getting the double salmon roll because mercury tastes delicious, and a vegetarian bento box on the side because vegetables and fibrous materials. The miso soup is really, really salty here, and I say that as someone who always finishes her complimentary miso soup. 

We decided to be annoying and asked for a seat in the back with the comfy lounge cushions instead of the rickety wooden chairs in the front. The waitress shook her head, saying that the back tables were only for parties of 10. It was 2 o'clock on a Wednesday. A party of 10 is not going to come strolling in and demand to be crammed around two tiny tables. I said so more or less, and she signed through her nose and said, sure, but only if we agree to move if a party of 10 comes in. It felt a little bizarre playing this passive-agro tug of war over a hypothetical party of 10 stragglers, but she lit up when we ordered 5 rolls and a ton of bento boxes. 

Two stars for delicious agedashi tofu. Yes, there is this layer of brown, umami goo caking the tofu. Yes, I was eyeing my friend's nabeyaki udon a bit wistfully. Yes, I ate too much and then had to wander through the mall in the Peace Plaza across the street arguing with myself (possibly aloud) if physical agony was worth green tea soft serve or a banana and nutella crepe. Thanks for having me, Japantown!

excerpts: My first item was the $8.50 Chicken Yakitori because I felt like having a couple of skewers of poultry (photo: http://bit.ly/2Kx8QVW).
The meat alternated with scallions and red pepper, but the flavor was compromised by the gooey marinade.
yakitori.author: Ed U.
yakitori.review:
I've sat in front of this inconspicuous Japanese restaurant several times whenever I took a seat on one of the worn benches on the cobblestoned Buchanan Street plaza. I decided to give it a try one evening as I was leisurely strolling through Japantown and found it about half full of customers. I didn't have high expectations about the quality based on some of the Yelp feedback I read, and frankly that preconception helped me get through my meal without incident.

I decided on three smaller items off their menu, but to my pleasant surprise, they generously served me a miso soup and salad anyway (photo: http://bit.ly/2z8G2xR). My first item was the $8.50 Chicken Yakitori because I felt like having a couple of skewers of poultry (photo: http://bit.ly/2Kx8QVW). The meat alternated with scallions and red pepper, but the flavor was compromised by the gooey marinade. Better was the $12.50 Hamachi Kama which was yellowtail collar simply grilled with the skin left intact (photo: http://bit.ly/2KDjNVv).

The simpler, the better. That's why the kama worked for me, but sometimes simple is just too simple. That was the mistake I made with my third choice, the appropriately priced $5 Avocado Roll which was just that, avocado rolled in rice and nori (photo: http://bit.ly/2KN9afH). There wasn't enough flavor to make it interesting. I didn't find anything offensive about Kippu, it just felt interchangeable with any number of J-Town eateries offering the exact same dishes. Maybe that's good enough sometimes.

FOOD - 3 stars...middling Japanese fare with the kama the best of the plates I had
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...pretty standard decor for J-Town
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...a bit on the slow side
TOTAL - 3 stars...kinda nondescript for my taste

excerpts: I feel (though I have not checked for myself) that their sushi and bentos would be good, but I decided to order the beef donburi, edamame, yakitori, and tempura ice cream.
As a (half) Japanese-American who has visited Japan throughout her life, I would say the beef donburi was OK.
The edamame was not well mixed with the salt, but it was good.
The yakitori was good, no complaints there.
The best part, and most redeeming quality of the meal was the tempura ice cream.
yakitori.author: Rina R.
yakitori.review:
I went into Kippu having read the Yelp reviews, so I knew the meals could be a bit hit-and-miss. I feel (though I have not checked for myself) that their sushi and bentos would be good, but I decided to order the beef donburi, edamame, yakitori, and tempura ice cream. As a (half) Japanese-American who has visited Japan throughout her life, I would say the beef donburi was OK. Nothing special, though I felt it was a bit interesting, given that the beef/egg and added vegetables were about 50/50 with the rice, something I was not expecting or used to. The edamame was not well mixed with the salt, but it was good. The yakitori was good, no complaints there. The best part, and most redeeming quality of the meal was the tempura ice cream. It was a unique dessert, and I was pleasantly surprised.

I would go to Kippu again just for the desserts, and I look forward to trying a bento and some sushi there in the future.

excerpts: The nabeyaki udon and beef teriyaki bento box was just absolutely tasty.
The service is really nice too.
beef teriyaki.author: Kiara K.
beef teriyaki.review: Delicious! The nabeyaki udon and beef teriyaki bento box was just absolutely tasty. The service is really nice too.

excerpts: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.
The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).
The steak was dry and lightly sauced.
Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.
The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).
The steak was dry and lightly sauced.
Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.
beef teriyaki.author: Leonard L.
beef teriyaki.review:
Kippu Japanese
SF J-Town
3pm Thursday 16th April 2015
Three Stars

We had the dog so we couldn't eat inside so we ordered takeout.  I got the Number 9 Combination: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.  The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).    It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.  The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).  The steak was dry and lightly sauced. Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.

excerpts: I decided on the nabeyaki udon while my boyfriend ordered the beef teriyaki with mixed tempura bento box.
My nabeyaki udon was tasty, it was perfect because I was feeling a bit sick with a cold so the hot broth with the chewy noodles were great for my headache.
My boyfriend's meal was HUGE: large servings of beef teriyaki, rice, and tempura for such a low price.
beef teriyaki.author: Sam F.
beef teriyaki.review:
A great place for lunch in Japantown.

We happened upon this place while wandering around, looking at various restaurants' menus. There was barely anyone around when we walked in, probably because we arrived around 11:30, but people began to trickle in slowly after we were seated. Our waiter was very attentive and brought us water and menus without us asking. I decided on the nabeyaki udon while my boyfriend ordered the beef teriyaki with mixed tempura bento box. 

My udon came with a side salad which was super yummy and had some awesome sesame dressing. The bento came with miso soup which my boyfriend drank in a hurry so I'm not sure how it tasted lol My nabeyaki udon was tasty, it was perfect because I was feeling a bit sick with a cold so the hot broth with the chewy noodles were great for my headache. They added fish cake, veggies and a shrimp tempura in there as well. My boyfriend's meal was HUGE: large servings of beef teriyaki, rice, and tempura for such a low price. Bento boxes are definitely a steal here!

The prices are super reasonable at Kippu and they have a great selection of items so I would recommend coming here for a yummy meal when you are in Japantown!

excerpts: We also had the beef teriyaki,gyoza, tempura box
and it was very yummy.
It was better than average for sure.
Thanks Japantown!
beef teriyaki.author: Laura D.
beef teriyaki.review: Food was good and service was quick. My boyfriend ordered the Ferrari and the Sex and the City roll and loved it. He couldn't stop raving about it as we were eating. His rolls were delicious with just the right amount of spice. We also had the beef teriyaki,gyoza, tempura box and it was very yummy. It was better than average for sure. Thanks Japantown!

excerpts: Don't order the chewy beef aka beef teriyaki.
beef teriyaki.author: Regi K.
beef teriyaki.review:
Don't order the chewy beef aka beef teriyaki.   

Washington roll is good if you're in the mood for salmon

everything else is really okay... kinda typical fare.  nothing special.

excerpts: I got the beef teriyaki lunch special.
It was yummy
beef teriyaki.author: Vanessa C.
beef teriyaki.review:
I got the beef teriyaki lunch special. It was yummy and I had a good amount of food. 

The beef was little tough, so if you prefer meat not to be well done, I advise you to request it to your likings because they didn't ask how you would like to have it. 

The customer service was fast and friendly. I got the check as I was eating. Rather than take it as a hint to leave, I appreciated the gesture since I hate waiting around for the check, especially since I go to Japantown during my lunch breaks and don't have time to waste.

excerpts: I've tried both the salmon and the beef teriyaki, all of which have been pretty tasty.
I'm also a fan of the tempura.
So definitely most of the stars are for this lunch special.
As for their sushi, it's not too bad.
Just don't let the pictures fool you; I once made that mistake and was disappointed with the portion size
beef teriyaki.author: Can C.
beef teriyaki.review:
I'd say it's more of a 3.5, but it may partially be due to the fact that it's quite convenient for us.  In any case, I have to say their lunch special is a great deal - about $7 for miso soup plus a bento box filled with two entrees, salad, and rice.  I've tried both the salmon and the beef teriyaki, all of which have been pretty tasty.  I'm also a fan of the tempura.  So definitely most of the stars are for this lunch special.  As for their sushi, it's not too bad.  Just don't let the pictures fool you; I once made that mistake and was disappointed with the portion size (it looked a lot more generous in the menu).

If it weren't so convenient, I would likely not go out of my way to eat here.  But still a great lunch deal!

excerpts: we got the salmon bento box and the beef teriyaki and the incredible roll (?).
I wish we were told that roll was raw.
I still tipped them because I work in a similar field as well and rely on tips sometimes.
I hope this review and the other reviews helps them with a little service upgrade.
beef teriyaki.author: Dixie x.
beef teriyaki.review: food was alright. not too good, not too bad. ive had better. not much on their menu, which doesnt please me at all. the waitress was rushing us to order our food which is definitely a no. the other servers were not water friendly with refills. other then that, nothing good to say. we got the salmon bento box and the beef teriyaki and the incredible roll (?). I wish we were told that roll was raw. I still tipped them because I work in a similar field as well and rely on tips sometimes. I hope this review and the other reviews helps them with a little service upgrade.

excerpts: Bf ordered chicken teriyaki bento and I ordered vegetarian 3 item bento with age-dashi tofu, veggie tempura, and avocado roll.
Paid $35 after tip.
chicken teriyaki.author: Tammy P.
chicken teriyaki.review:
My go-to place for bento boxes in SF!

1. Prices for the lunch bentos are the best value.
2. We recently went for dinner. Bf ordered chicken teriyaki bento and I ordered vegetarian 3 item bento with age-dashi tofu, veggie tempura, and avocado roll. Paid $35 after tip.
3. Bentos come with rice, salad, and miso soup.
4. One of our soups had a little bug/fly in it. Told the waitress and she replaced it, but who knows what she did with it.
5. Their salad dressing is the best!

excerpts: My friend got a bento box with chicken teriyaki and tempura.
I got the bento with chicken teriyaki and gyoza.

excerpts: We ordered a bento box (chicken teriyaki, tempura, California rolls) - which was fine.
It wasn't bad at all, but was nothing special either.
chicken teriyaki.author: Judy H.
chicken teriyaki.review:
Yeah...pretty much what you'd expect eating in Japan town. It's high-priced, mediocre Japanese food geared for tourists. Whenever I come to Japan town I hardly actually eat in restaurants in or immediately surrounding the shopping center, but was particularly hungry that day. We ordered a bento box (chicken teriyaki, tempura, California rolls) - which was fine. It wasn't bad at all, but was nothing special either. I had the chirashi and for $25 it was sooo small. It only had a few slices of fish. I'm no fish expert but I saw salmon and tuna, of course, and then like maybe two other kinds. 

The place itself was a little crowded. They jammed in as many tables as they could, which I  don't mind, but it's like all the bodies in the restaurant made the place so stuffy and hot. They should really turn on the fan or something. Customer service was also fine. They were nice. 

Anyway, everything about this place is pretty average, except the prices, which is high for what you get.

excerpts: I think it's like $8 for Chicken Teriyaki bento box with tempura.
Great food, great service, cool location I can't ask for more.
I'll be back a few times this week.
Thank you Kippu!
chicken teriyaki.author: Philip O.
chicken teriyaki.review:
I love Kippu! My go to spot when I want a bento box. Customer service has always been good here and the food is great. I don't know if the guy with the highlighted hair is the owner or manager, but he's usually there every time I go by and he's always been really nice. I appreciate that. 

The tempura here is one of my favorites. I like how they include the tempura onion rings in the tempura. I don't see that too often at Japanese spots. I like how Kippu is right in the middle of Japantown. It's like you're eating a bento box in Tokyo. 

Another big plus here in the price. They have great lunch prices. I think it's like $8 for Chicken Teriyaki bento box with tempura. Great food, great service, cool location I can't ask for more. I'll be back a few times this week. Thank you Kippu!

excerpts: The $6.95 chicken teriyaki sign outside caught my eyes.
The chicken teriyaki lunch bento came with miso soup, salad, chicken teriyaki, rice, one shrimp tempura, and a potato croquet.
The portion was small but it was enough to fill me up.
The sushi chef was very observant: I needed a napkin and was looking around on my table to find a clean one
chicken teriyaki.author: Angelyn S.
chicken teriyaki.review:
The $6.95 chicken teriyaki sign outside caught my eyes. 

Came here while I was waiting to get my visa from across the street. Food took awhile to come but it was good. The chicken teriyaki lunch bento came with miso soup, salad, chicken teriyaki, rice, one shrimp tempura, and a potato croquet. The portion was small but it was enough to fill me up. The sushi chef was very observant: I needed a napkin and was looking around on my table to find a clean one but he immediately noticed and called the server to hand me one.

Food is 3 stars but because of their attentiveness, they deserve 4 stars.

excerpts: I had the Chicken teriyaki with California roll for $9.
Perfect amount of food and one of the best California rolls I've had in a while
chicken teriyaki.author: Matt M.
chicken teriyaki.review: Delicious, affordable lunch special. I had the Chicken teriyaki with California roll for $9. Perfect amount of food and one of the best California rolls I've had in a while

excerpts: Salty miso soup, heavily battered tempura, 3 pieces of salmon sashimi and chicken teriyaki.
Lots of mediocre food.
Won't be back.
chicken teriyaki.author: James P.
chicken teriyaki.review: Started with asking the waiter the same question twice and he just stared at me. Then came the food. Salty miso soup, heavily battered tempura, 3 pieces of salmon sashimi and chicken teriyaki. Lots of mediocre food. Won't be back.

excerpts:
- Chicken teriyaki was meh, rice stale.
- Gyoza was not fresh and not good.
chicken teriyaki.author: Jonathan P.
chicken teriyaki.review:
Food was not good, service was not good.

- Tonkotsu ramen was pretty bad with terrible overcooked noodles and tough meat.
- Octopus sunomono was foul.
- Chicken teriyaki was meh, rice stale.
- Gyoza was not fresh and not good.
- Edamame was not fresh and not good.
- Service was slow and poor, one item never came.

excerpts: The chicken teriyaki in their tempura box was dry.
chicken teriyaki.author: J C.
chicken teriyaki.review: The chicken teriyaki in their tempura box was dry. Surprisingly the California roll was nice and fresh. I probably would come back and try their sashimi next time. Place is not bad. Probably ordered the wrong item. Their lunch special are pretty cheap but again just beware that maybe some of the items are just okay. Overall 3 out of 5 stars.

excerpts: I had the Chicken Teriyaki + Tempura + California Roll.
The Teriyaki was pretty good, Tempura was amazing and California Roll was just a little less than perfect.
I would give it 5 stars given it's relatively affordable at such an expensive location and the food was good.
The total tab came out to be $12 for a very VERY full meal.
The Teriyaki was pretty good, Tempura was amazing and California Roll was just a little less than perfect.
I would give it 5 stars given it's relatively affordable at such an expensive location and the food was good.
The total tab came out to be $12 for a very VERY full meal.
chicken teriyaki.author: Shun Y.
chicken teriyaki.review: Pretty decent place. Thought it was expensive at first, but the dinner bentos come with LOADS of food. I had the Chicken Teriyaki + Tempura + California Roll. The Teriyaki was pretty good, Tempura was amazing and California Roll was just a little less than perfect. I would give it 5 stars given it's relatively affordable at such an expensive location and the food was good. The total tab came out to be $12 for a very VERY full meal.

excerpts: The only thing that didn't make sense here was that the chicken teriyaki plate without the tempura was more expensive than the chicken teriyaki and tempura bento box.
But other than that, good food and cheap!
chicken teriyaki.author: J L.
chicken teriyaki.review: I lunched here on a whim and I wasn't disappointed! Their chickens teriyaki and tempura bento box is extremely cheap ($6), filling, and yummy! The only thing that didn't make sense here was that the chicken teriyaki plate without the tempura was more expensive than the chicken teriyaki and tempura bento box. But other than that, good food and cheap!

excerpts: Also tried the edamame and the hamachi roll.
The edamame were over cooked but plentiful - we actually didn't finish them.
The hamachi roll was fine - nothing super memorable but it tasted good in the moment.
The hamachi roll was fine - nothing super memorable but it tasted good in the moment.
edamame.author: Amy R.
edamame.review:
I think this place is pretty accurately rated at around 3-3.5 stars. The food is run-of-the-mill Japanese American cuisine! 

The restaurant is really small - definitely not wheelchair accessible. And there are some steps out front and inside. The space to go use the restroom is also very tight and around a sharp corner. 

We got a veggie bento box and a steak teriyaki bento box late on a Friday night. Also tried the edamame and the hamachi roll. 

Bento boxes were good and just as you'd expect. It seems vegetarians have quite a few options! 
The steak teriyaki was tender and not over cooked. The portion felt fair. 

The edamame were over cooked but plentiful - we actually didn't finish them. 

The hamachi roll was fine - nothing super memorable but it tasted good in the moment.

excerpts: Case in point: asked to get new edamame - the ones we were served were cold and had clearly been sitting for a while
... they came back with our same edamame just microwaved.
edamame.author: Dan E.
edamame.review: I'd call this restaurant the epitome of a 3 star rating. The service was friendly enough, but not great. Case in point: asked to get new edamame - the ones we were served were cold and had clearly been sitting for a while... they came back with our same edamame just microwaved. The prices were standard sushi prices: $7-17 per roll. The ambiance was standard modern sushi joint: bright colors and fast paced music in the background with plenty of natural and man made light with Asian decor. The rolls themselves were good - nothing new, nothing very traditional, just, standard American sushi.

excerpts: Edamame is served cold which I prefer hot but it was ok.
edamame.author: Dana W.
edamame.review: Walking through the area on our way to a concert at the Fillmore we decided to walk into this little restaurant and give it a try. We were greeted with a complimentary bowl of miso soup which was tasty. Edamame is served cold which I prefer hot but it was ok. Ordered 49er roll, Carmen, Crunch roll which were all delicious. Volcano bowl which was the breaded fried scallops were sooo yummy the gyoza I should of asked for pan fried they were just ok have had better. Overall great service, quick very nice staff and it was a pleasant find!

excerpts: They even gave us a free plate of edamame.
The Spicy Miso Ramen   was good and different; a mix of Korean and Japanese flavor.
edamame.author: Jennifer W.
edamame.review: Yummy, large portions, nice prices, and good service. They even gave us a free plate of edamame. The Spicy Miso Ramen   was good and different; a mix of Korean and Japanese flavor.

Food was not good, service was not good.

- Tonkotsu ramen was pretty bad with terrible overcooked noodles and tough meat.
- Octopus sunomono was foul.
- Chicken teriyaki was meh, rice stale.
- Gyoza was not fresh and not good.
- Edamame was not fresh and not good.
- Service was slow and poor, one item never came.

Maybe a bad day?

excerpts: She tried to compensate by providing edamame which was a nice gesture, however, the edamame was clearly old and had been sitting out in the open for a while.
It was sour (which it should never be), and much too soft like an old banana.
edamame.author: Ben L.
edamame.review:
This is the restaurant that made me decide to start a Yelp account.  My goal of this review is for anyone that works there to never provide this kind of experience to other customers.

1. Took close to 20 minutes to get any attention from the two waitresses to take our order. Obviously, this is not the first time anyone has experienced this, but for a restaurant that is less than 300 sq ft it was not acceptable.  I was also ignored twice with clear visual eye contact.  Two other parties had their order taken before mine was; I had a party of 2, the others were of 2 and 4.  

2. After they took my order of 4 dishes - Post Roll, Washington Roll, Unagi Lover, and Ahi Tuna - we waited about 5 minutes for the miso soup which was not an issue.  However, after 30 minutes, the same waitress comes up to ask if we have ordered yet - she was ruffling through her pad to look for my order.  She ends up going back to the cashier to find my order which at that point she tells me it will take 5 minutes to come out.  

3. She tried to compensate by providing edamame which was a nice gesture, however, the edamame was clearly old and had been sitting out in the open for a while.  It was sour (which it should never be), and much too soft like an old banana.  There was no way this can be OK to serve.  

4. The orders started to come in about 5-10 more minutes, all of which was significantly smaller than the picture.  Yes, it will never look identical to the picture, but it just looked like they didn't have enough ingredients to even complete the dish - even the rice on the rolls looked barren.  

I ended up paying about 65 dollars for this meal and it will be the last that I will ever spend there.  My girlfriend and I left hungry and totally dissatisfied with the food and service.  I've had bad restaurant experiences before and I do not have exuberant expectations, but from a customer service / technical support managerial background, this was unacceptable and needs to be improved on all ends.  Even if the quality of the food does not improve, I would continue to visit only if the service was there.  

If you get the chance to visit this restaurant, I recommend that you think twice about it before spending your hard earned cash.

excerpts: I got the veggie bento box, with my choice of 3 different vegetarian dishes plus green salad and rice.
It hit the spot!
green salad.author: Aleta D.
green salad.review: Polite, prompt service, good food. They gave me a free starter of some miso soup while I looked at the menu.  I got the veggie bento box, with my choice of 3 different vegetarian dishes plus green salad and rice. It hit the spot!

excerpts: The orange blossom special roll, Cucumber salad, California roll and avocado roll.
The pieces were well sized.
cucumber salad.author: Natascha G.
cucumber salad.review:
We came on a Thursday night. Most of the tables were occupied, but due to the good size we had no trouble being seated.
The sushi is fresh and the service courteous.  
We ordered salmon, tuna and shrimp sushi. The orange blossom special roll, Cucumber salad, California roll and avocado roll.
The pieces were well sized.

excerpts: Also had Wakame Salad.
Service was a bit slow, but they were pretty busy, so I'm not slamming them much.
Sushi was pretty tasty.
I'd definitely go again!
wakame salad.author: June W.
wakame salad.review: Party of 5 went Saturday night around 7:30 pm. Pretty busy. We had 2 Flaming Dragon rolls (gotta watch, pretty impressive, and the waiters talk it up too as they're serving it), Lion Head, Cherry Blossom and 3-4 others. Also had Wakame Salad. Service was a bit slow, but they were pretty busy, so I'm not slamming them much. Sushi was pretty tasty. I'd definitely go again!

excerpts: The oyster shooter was not very warm and did not have any spice to it like I prefer.
The Portions were good size except the Pepperfin which came with only 4 pieces and was about $12.
It also had some flakes on top
I didn't like and not enough sauce.
That being said I really enjoyed the rolls and the staff was very nice and attentive.
They had over 70 rolls to choose from and some that were pretty unique.
I would go back here again when visiting.
oyster shooter.author: Francine B.
oyster shooter.review: Walked through Japan town and decided on this place out of a dozen and glad we did. Love places that give you complimentary miso and salad! The teriyaki chicken box with rice, salad, miso soup and an assortment of tempura was enough for my two kids to share.  We had the giant roll and a roll with scallops which were quite tasty. The oyster shooter was not very warm and did not have any spice to it like I prefer. The Portions were good size except the Pepperfin which came with only 4 pieces and was about $12. It also had some flakes on top I didn't like and not enough sauce. That being said I really enjoyed the rolls and the staff was very nice and attentive. They had over 70 rolls to choose from and some that were pretty unique. I would go back here again when visiting.

excerpts: boy how I've missed a good Oyster Shooter.
Their Kippu has them!
They're tricky in that it's not listed under drinks but deeply entrenched in their Appetizer section.
What's interesting is that their Oyster Shooters are of a red color.
Okay, Oyster Shooter aside
, the atmosphere was really nice, it's at a lower level
so when you look out the window you're seeing people's feet
but that has a nice feel to it.
Their service is decently fast and friendly, for the most part.
My buddy and
oyster shooter.author: James Y.
oyster shooter.review:
So my friend and I traversed Japantown in San Francisco in hopes of finding a place that served Oyster Shooters.  I mean I've had some good Oyster Shooters back in the day but most of them were from Southern California and after moving to Miami for a few years and moving back to the Bay Area, boy how I've missed a good Oyster Shooter.  Their Kippu has them!  They're tricky in that it's not listed under drinks but deeply entrenched in their Appetizer section.  What's interesting is that their Oyster Shooters are of a red color.  They do have the oyster, sake, roe and scallion but I don't know what makes it red.  Either way, it was rather disappointing.  I don't think I'd go again for their Oyster Shooters.

Okay, Oyster Shooter aside, the atmosphere was really nice, it's at a lower level so when you look out the window you're seeing people's feet but that has a nice feel to it.  Their service is decently fast and friendly, for the most part.  My buddy and I just ordered beer, sake and appetizers.  Their appetizers are pretty good, we ordered their raw oysters, seaweed, tofu and some other stuff?  I don't remember anymore. 

One note, do not order their cold tofu, it's just tofu you buy from a store cut up and served.  I added my own soy sauce :( 

Anyway, we had a good time here, maybe because we were drinking heavily, since that tend to make things "happier" for people.  Overall experience was good but all the foods we ordered came drastically short of our expectations except for the raw oysters and the beer.  But it's not like they brewed the beer, so just the raw oysters.  Their appetizers definitely need an overhaul.

excerpts: We ordered oysters, and she brought us an oyster shooter.
oyster shooter.author: J K.
oyster shooter.review:
I have given this place three tries.

Pros: Fair Japanese food, so-so sushi, have never waited for a seat in the three times I've been here.

Cons: VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. We came here Sunday afternoon for lunch and served by a hostess in training. I have tolerance for mistakes (got two of our orders wrong), and a language barrier (I could not understand much of what she was saying, and she had difficulty answering our menu questions). However,  I do NOT have tolerance for rudeness. We ordered oysters, and she brought us an oyster shooter. When we questioned the order she challenged us and said "you did NOT say 'fresh' oysters".  

We will not be returning. We hoped for a pleasant meal, and left exhausted/ticked off that we had to struggle through the entire meal. 

Bottomline: I suggest take-out.

excerpts: I love the oyster shooter and my pepper fin dish.
Yummy!!
Thank u kippu
oyster shooter.author: Kay V.
oyster shooter.review: I actually really liked this place regardless of all the bad reviews.  Most people complained about the temperature of the room and the seating. I didn't mind it. I love the oyster shooter and my pepper fin dish.  Yummy!!  Thank u kippu

excerpts: and I we had a serving of the soft shell crab, which was so-so, not too authentic.
soft shell crab.author: Jeremiah N.
soft shell crab.review:
I had my first ever dinner in the USA at Kippu. It wasn't too shabby. Food gets 3 stars and the great service adds another star to the overall rating. 

Between my partner and I we had a serving of the soft shell crab, which was so-so, not too authentic. With clam sushi which wasn't too bad too. 

We asked for recommendations for ramen and the spicy miso was suggested. It did not disappoint! Because all the other Yelpers have been going on about the Flaming Dragon, we decided to give it a try... It got a mixed reaction, my partner didn't like the smell left by the wax used to burn the outside of the foil. I thought it was okay. 

We had 2 drinks, a sprite and some hot green tea and it all came up to $45 (tip incl)

All in all, a good experience. Staff were friendly, obliging and initiative. The dude even gave me a glass of water without me asking. Good stuff!

excerpts: Soft shell crab was good after I pealed off the batter that was the thickness of an orange peal.
soft shell crab.author: Mac P.
soft shell crab.review:
I've never ordered bad food that I refuse to eat before until now. Wow!!!
Flaming dragon was flaming in all the bad ways possible. It tasted like charred salty sticky rice.
Soft shell crab was good after I pealed off the batter that was the thickness of an orange peal.
Lobster roll was decent, but the number of rolls in the picture did not depict reality.
The fried oyster also had that charred aroma lathered in the brown dipping sauce that prevented me from finishing the single piece on my plate. I have lost the battle of "Man Vs Food" and cannot raise my head high any longer.
Should have ordered a bento box.
And "yes"; the service was sssllloooooooowwww...
Two stars because I didn't throw up.

excerpts: C is having mixed tempura.
mixed tempura.author: Rose Marie J.
mixed tempura.review: I am having the bento box with salmon teriyaki, tempura, and the California roll.  C is having mixed tempura.  We also ordered the rock and roll sushi, which includes unagi, shrimp, and avocado.

excerpts: I decided on the nabeyaki udon while my boyfriend ordered the beef teriyaki with mixed tempura bento box.
My nabeyaki udon was tasty, it was perfect because I was feeling a bit sick with a cold so the hot broth with the chewy noodles were great for my headache.
My boyfriend's meal was HUGE: large servings of beef teriyaki, rice, and tempura for such a low price.
mixed tempura.author: Sam F.
mixed tempura.review:
A great place for lunch in Japantown.

We happened upon this place while wandering around, looking at various restaurants' menus. There was barely anyone around when we walked in, probably because we arrived around 11:30, but people began to trickle in slowly after we were seated. Our waiter was very attentive and brought us water and menus without us asking. I decided on the nabeyaki udon while my boyfriend ordered the beef teriyaki with mixed tempura bento box. 

My udon came with a side salad which was super yummy and had some awesome sesame dressing. The bento came with miso soup which my boyfriend drank in a hurry so I'm not sure how it tasted lol My nabeyaki udon was tasty, it was perfect because I was feeling a bit sick with a cold so the hot broth with the chewy noodles were great for my headache. They added fish cake, veggies and a shrimp tempura in there as well. My boyfriend's meal was HUGE: large servings of beef teriyaki, rice, and tempura for such a low price. Bento boxes are definitely a steal here!

The prices are super reasonable at Kippu and they have a great selection of items so I would recommend coming here for a yummy meal when you are in Japantown!

excerpts: Better was the $12.50 Hamachi Kama which was yellowtail collar
hamachi kama.author: Ed U.
hamachi kama.review:
I've sat in front of this inconspicuous Japanese restaurant several times whenever I took a seat on one of the worn benches on the cobblestoned Buchanan Street plaza. I decided to give it a try one evening as I was leisurely strolling through Japantown and found it about half full of customers. I didn't have high expectations about the quality based on some of the Yelp feedback I read, and frankly that preconception helped me get through my meal without incident.

I decided on three smaller items off their menu, but to my pleasant surprise, they generously served me a miso soup and salad anyway (photo: http://bit.ly/2z8G2xR). My first item was the $8.50 Chicken Yakitori because I felt like having a couple of skewers of poultry (photo: http://bit.ly/2Kx8QVW). The meat alternated with scallions and red pepper, but the flavor was compromised by the gooey marinade. Better was the $12.50 Hamachi Kama which was yellowtail collar simply grilled with the skin left intact (photo: http://bit.ly/2KDjNVv).

The simpler, the better. That's why the kama worked for me, but sometimes simple is just too simple. That was the mistake I made with my third choice, the appropriately priced $5 Avocado Roll which was just that, avocado rolled in rice and nori (photo: http://bit.ly/2KN9afH). There wasn't enough flavor to make it interesting. I didn't find anything offensive about Kippu, it just felt interchangeable with any number of J-Town eateries offering the exact same dishes. Maybe that's good enough sometimes.

FOOD - 3 stars...middling Japanese fare with the kama the best of the plates I had
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...pretty standard decor for J-Town
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...a bit on the slow side
TOTAL - 3 stars...kinda nondescript for my taste

excerpts: Bento box ( salmon teriyaki w/ California roll)
: This bento box included a side salad, 4pcs of California roll, white rice, a filet salmon teriyaki with ginger and wasabi.
: This bento box included a side salad, 4pcs of California roll, white rice, a filet salmon teriyaki with ginger and wasabi.
The salmon teriyaki was good, the California roll was alright and salad was okay too.
The salmon teriyaki was good, the California roll was alright and salad was okay too.
salmon teriyaki.author: Kochamon S.
salmon teriyaki.review:
The food was alright honestly..
I came here with my parents and ordered a bento box, donburi (katsu don), and their sushi ( King Kong roll).

Bento box ( salmon teriyaki w/ California roll): This bento box included a side salad, 4pcs of California roll, white rice, a filet salmon teriyaki with ginger and wasabi. The salmon teriyaki was good, the California roll was alright and salad was okay too. 

Katsu don: just your basic katsu don with a little zucchini thrown into it. 
King Kong roll- it was alright. The taste of it is fine but it just didn't necessarily impressed me. 
Overall the food was meh in my opinion. If I had to recommend something that I ate it would be the sushi. It was the best tasting out of things I've ordered. 
Service was really friendly and nice. 
Overall I don't think I will personally come here again if I am going to be completely honest.

excerpts: Average a little undercooked salmon teriyaki and expensive California roll with fake crab.
salmon teriyaki.author: Jack R.
salmon teriyaki.review:
Super slow service when we're the only ones there. Super high prices for an average bento box.

Only in Japan Town would this place survive.

No refills on tea no extra napkins.

Average a little undercooked salmon teriyaki and expensive California roll with fake crab.

Ugh, only because I was hungry.

I'm giving this place 3 stars because the salmon portion was big, but not necessarily that good to want a second helping.

excerpts: I am having the bento box with salmon teriyaki, tempura, and the California roll.
We also ordered the rock and roll sushi, which includes unagi, shrimp, and avocado.
salmon teriyaki.author: Rose Marie J.
salmon teriyaki.review: I am having the bento box with salmon teriyaki, tempura, and the California roll.  C is having mixed tempura.  We also ordered the rock and roll sushi, which includes unagi, shrimp, and avocado.

excerpts: Fresh fish in the sushi,  crispy tempura,  great sauce on the salmon teriyaki.
A must try restaurant if you're in Japan town!
salmon teriyaki.author: Megan R.
salmon teriyaki.review: Get the flaming dragon roll!  Not only does it taste amazing it comes with a show!   The service was quick and friendly. The wait staff worked together to take care of us. They were fairly busy but the food came quickly and it was all wonderful. Fresh fish in the sushi,  crispy tempura,  great sauce on the salmon teriyaki. A must try restaurant if you're in Japan town!

excerpts: I came here for lunch and ordered the lunch special bento box with sashimi and salmon teriyaki.
However, the salmon sashimi was pretty fresh and tasty; the salmon teriyaki was decent as well (a little overdone but the teriyaki sauce was flavorful and not overkill).
salmon teriyaki.author: Lillian C.
salmon teriyaki.review:
This restaurant is conveniently located in the middle of Japantown in SF. 

I came here for lunch and ordered the lunch special bento box with sashimi and salmon teriyaki. My friend ordered the tonkatsu with California roll. I did not have high hopes for this restaurant (as Japanese restaurants in Japantown don't have the best food ironically). However, the salmon sashimi was pretty fresh and tasty; the salmon teriyaki was decent as well (a little overdone but the teriyaki sauce was flavorful and not overkill). The tonkatsu (Chicken katsu) was too dry making the meat too tough. 

Overall, I'd come back but the food is just okay and not worth a trip on its own.

excerpts: My salmon teriyaki came out undercooked.
They were nice enough to make me a new plate.
However, the new plate came out with less salmon on it.
I don't even know what to say about that
salmon teriyaki.author: Alan T.
salmon teriyaki.review:
Some reviewers say the food here makes up for the bad service, but to me, neither the rolls nor the teriyaki was good enough to do that. And Yes the service was under.

My salmon teriyaki came out undercooked. They were nice enough to make me a new plate. However, the new plate came out with less salmon on it. I don't even know what to say about that

excerpts:
Vegetable Tempura/Shrimp Tempura
4.
shrimp tempura.author: Wolf B.
shrimp tempura.review:
Never had a single issue, I've come here a dozen times and the sushi is always cold, I love the service and how everyone is so polite, KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK!!! :D I will support you guys full on.

~List of dishes I've tried~
1. Four Seasons Roll
2. Seaweed Salad
3. Vegetable Tempura/Shrimp Tempura
4. Love Roll
5. Avocado Roll
6. Hamachi Lover Roll
7. Miso Soup
8. Cherry Blossom Roll/Orange Blossom Roll

All Perfection! :)

excerpts: The chicken teriyaki lunch bento came with miso soup, salad, chicken teriyaki, rice, one shrimp tempura, and a potato croquet.
The portion was small but it was enough to fill me up.
The sushi chef was very observant: I needed a napkin and was looking around on my table to find a clean one
shrimp tempura.author: Angelyn S.
shrimp tempura.review:
The $6.95 chicken teriyaki sign outside caught my eyes. 

Came here while I was waiting to get my visa from across the street. Food took awhile to come but it was good. The chicken teriyaki lunch bento came with miso soup, salad, chicken teriyaki, rice, one shrimp tempura, and a potato croquet. The portion was small but it was enough to fill me up. The sushi chef was very observant: I needed a napkin and was looking around on my table to find a clean one but he immediately noticed and called the server to hand me one.

Food is 3 stars but because of their attentiveness, they deserve 4 stars.

excerpts: They both are similar except one has shrimp tempura inside while the other has crab.
shrimp tempura.author: Eric H.
shrimp tempura.review:
We went in here and the food was decent. Rolls are big. Giving 1 star because they mixed my order up and refused to fix it. Part of my order was a dragon roll and another table behind us orderd an unagi roll. They both are similar except one has shrimp tempura inside while the other has crab.

I was given the unagi rolll and I brought it to the wait staff's attention. They told me it was a dragon roll. They came back a few seconds later and realized it wasn't and took the plate. However, the table they had given my dragon roll had already started eating it. Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.

Just remake the roll for god sakes.

excerpts: They added fish cake, veggies and a shrimp tempura in there as well.
shrimp tempura.author: Sam F.
shrimp tempura.review:

excerpts: it was just exploding with vegetables, shrimp tempura, chicken, fish cake, and egg.
so much going on there, i was really impressed with the soup.
will be back for more !!!!!!
shrimp tempura.author: Lena E.
shrimp tempura.review:
Had the King Kong sushi - just enough spiciness, and full of flavor !
A long with the Chicken Udon- Very hearty, large dish. it was enough for dinner that night, and lunch the next day !! it was just exploding with vegetables, shrimp tempura, chicken, fish cake, and egg. so much going on there, i was really impressed with the soup. will be back for more !!!!!!

excerpts: the miso soup was great, the shrimp tempura was mouth watering, and the teriyaki chicken was the best I've ever had.
shrimp tempura.author: Jasen S.
shrimp tempura.review: i really can't get in to sushi. I have tried sushi at least a dozen times, and I just can't get in to it...just not my thing. even though I will never be a sushi person, this restaurant is phenomenal. I only ordered the kotate, as far as sushi, which was so dang good, and everything else was equally as good. the miso soup was great, the shrimp tempura was mouth watering, and the teriyaki chicken was the best I've ever had. the milky sake we had complemented the meal well, and the service was impeccable. the price wasn't bad either. :)

excerpts: Ordered using soup with shrimp tempura.
Asked the waitress if I could have it without chicken listed on the menu.
She said yes.
20 minutes later she brings me the soup loaded with chicken & 1 tempura.
When I returned it she said : I thOught u wanted chicken".
Had to wait for another 20 minutes to get soup.
Almost walked out.
Had to request spoon too.
Never going back there!
shrimp tempura.author: Valerie T.
shrimp tempura.review: Very bad service.  Ordered using soup with shrimp tempura.  Asked the waitress if I could have it without chicken listed on the menu. She said yes. 20 minutes later she brings me the soup loaded with chicken & 1 tempura.   When I returned it she said : I thOught u wanted chicken". Had to wait for another 20 minutes to get soup. Almost walked out. Had to request spoon too. Never going back there!

excerpts: My food was okay; I ordered the vegetarian bento box, which came with inari, vegetable tempura, miso soup, salad, and karrokes.
The quantity of food I received for the price (around $13) was pretty good, and overall I enjoyed my dinner, with the exception of the inari tofu.
It was soggy, hardly breaded and fried at all, and just tasted bad.
vegetable tempura.author: Molly I.
vegetable tempura.review:
My boyfriend and I had dinner here last week. While the food was acceptable, the service was not. Our waitress was not very friendly, and seemed as if she wanted to be anywhere but there. We had to ask her for water, which is understandable given California's drought. However, what was not understandable or acceptable was why she gave us half-full glasses of tap water, while the tables near us had full glasses of water with ice cubes. The waitress did not offer to refill our glasses once we finished the half-full water glasses, so we kept having to repeatedly ask her for more water (which we received in a slow manner). My food was okay; I ordered the vegetarian bento box, which came with inari, vegetable tempura, miso soup, salad, and karrokes. The quantity of food I received for the price (around $13) was pretty good, and overall I enjoyed my dinner, with the exception of the inari tofu. It was soggy, hardly breaded and fried at all, and just tasted bad. My boyfriend ordered the dinner bento box special, and the California roll portion of his meal literally came with two pieces. Finally, after sitting and waiting for our check for about 10 minutes after our plates had been cleared, we had to ask the waitress to please bring us our check, which took several more minutes. When she finally arrived at our table, she brought us someone else's check, so we had to go up to the front counter and ask for our proper check. 
We wanted to try a new restaurant in Japantown that we hadn't been to yet, so we chose this one. Next time, we'll be going somewhere where we know we will receive good food AND good service.

excerpts: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.
The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).
The steak was dry and lightly sauced.
Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.
The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).
The steak was dry and lightly sauced.
Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.
vegetable tempura.author: Leonard L.
vegetable tempura.review:
Kippu Japanese
SF J-Town
3pm Thursday 16th April 2015
Three Stars

We had the dog so we couldn't eat inside so we ordered takeout.  I got the Number 9 Combination: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.  The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).    It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.  The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).  The steak was dry and lightly sauced. Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.

excerpts: Just your average Miso Soup, Tempura and Saba Shioyaki for me.
Had I known that there was a food court for the Cherry Blossom Festival
a few streets down, I probably would've saved my money and visited one of the food stands.
Sadly, this restaurant, much like many of the Japanese restaurants around Japantown, is very mediocre.
Which is a big disappointment to me, since one would expect Japantown to house the best Japanese Restaurants in the area.
My recommendation: save up your money and try Wayo Sushi, off of Van Ness Ave. in SF.
They're a bit pricy, and the restaurant is very small, but their Nigiris are the best I've had so far.
saba shioyaki.author: George T.
saba shioyaki.review:
My girlfriend, sister and I visited Kippu for Lunch during the Cherry Blossom Fest, and there was a bit of a wait, which was standard since the Festival is very popular. Upon being seated, we all ordered their Lunch Bentos. Nothing spectacular about their food. Just your average Miso Soup, Tempura and Saba Shioyaki for me. Had I known that there was a food court for the Cherry Blossom Festival a few streets down, I probably would've saved my money and visited one of the food stands.
Sadly, this restaurant, much like many of the Japanese restaurants around Japantown, is very mediocre. Which is a big disappointment to me, since one would expect Japantown to house the best Japanese Restaurants in the area. My recommendation: save up your money and try Wayo Sushi, off of Van Ness Ave. in SF. They're a bit pricy, and the restaurant is very small, but their Nigiris are the best I've had so far.

excerpts: Today I had the spicy chicken lunch.
The chicken was GOOD!
Just spicy enough to have a bite but not to the point where it tasted like burning.
spicy chicken.author: Brad H.
spicy chicken.review:
I'm no expert on Japanese food by any stretch of the imagination. But we were in Japan Town a few weeks back and went to another restaurant that was "award winning" and all that jazz. I was not impressed. The prices were too high, service was lacking and the food was just okay. The next trip we tried this place, mostly because it was a little off the path and there were no lines. So we decided to try this place and I'm glad we did! 

The first trip I had the teriyaki beef. It was very tasty! The soup was great as well, I'm usually not a fan of miso soup at all but theirs was different than most. Had to put two ice cubes in it to cool it down but the taste was great. The sushi (not a fan of sushi and I have no idea what was ordered) was good as well. The salad that came with lunch was tasty and the dressing was just right. 

Today I had the spicy chicken lunch. The chicken was GOOD! Just spicy enough to have a bite but not to the point where it tasted like burning. Service was great and food came out fast.

Pros:
Price. It's not a bargain meal but the prices are still really fair. Where else can you get a great meal like this for 6-8 bucks?  

Food. Everything I've had has been great so far!

Service. Can't really complain, friendly and efficient. 

Location. Right across from the touristy places and less tourist =D.

Cons.... Um.... having to ask for a fork! LOL yeah, I'm one of those kind of people.

We wanted to try a new restaurant in Japantown that we hadn't been to yet, so we chose this one. Next time, we'll be going somewhere where we know we will receive good food AND good service.

excerpts: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.
The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).
The steak was dry and lightly sauced.
Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.

The steak was dry and lightly sauced.
Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.
vegetarian bento.author: Leonard L.
vegetarian bento.review:
Kippu Japanese
SF J-Town
3pm Thursday 16th April 2015
Three Stars

We had the dog so we couldn't eat inside so we ordered takeout.  I got the Number 9 Combination: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.  The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).    It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.  The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).  The steak was dry and lightly sauced. Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.

excerpts: I ended up getting the double salmon roll because mercury tastes delicious, and a vegetarian bento box on the side because vegetables and fibrous materials.
vegetarian bento.author: Joy G.
vegetarian bento.review:
The sushi menu is basically a Willy Wonka wonderland for anyone who is sick of the basic California roll - if you're at all an indecisive freak like me, you will change your mind at least five times before the waitress comes to take your order and then change your mind while you are ordering. I ended up getting the double salmon roll because mercury tastes delicious, and a vegetarian bento box on the side because vegetables and fibrous materials. The miso soup is really, really salty here, and I say that as someone who always finishes her complimentary miso soup. 

We decided to be annoying and asked for a seat in the back with the comfy lounge cushions instead of the rickety wooden chairs in the front. The waitress shook her head, saying that the back tables were only for parties of 10. It was 2 o'clock on a Wednesday. A party of 10 is not going to come strolling in and demand to be crammed around two tiny tables. I said so more or less, and she signed through her nose and said, sure, but only if we agree to move if a party of 10 comes in. It felt a little bizarre playing this passive-agro tug of war over a hypothetical party of 10 stragglers, but she lit up when we ordered 5 rolls and a ton of bento boxes. 

Two stars for delicious agedashi tofu. Yes, there is this layer of brown, umami goo caking the tofu. Yes, I was eyeing my friend's nabeyaki udon a bit wistfully. Yes, I ate too much and then had to wander through the mall in the Peace Plaza across the street arguing with myself (possibly aloud) if physical agony was worth green tea soft serve or a banana and nutella crepe. Thanks for having me, Japantown!

excerpts: My husband and I love to get their hot sake and a vegetarian bento box before heading to the Sundance Theatre nearby.
vegetarian bento.author: Circadian R.
vegetarian bento.review: My husband and I love to get their hot sake and a vegetarian bento box before heading to the Sundance Theatre nearby.

excerpts: I and my friend ordered vegetarian bento box and Flaming Dragon.
Flaming Dragon is lovely and taste great!
But vegetarian bento is not great.
Croquettes is the only good item in the box.
vegetarian bento.author: Chalisa B.
vegetarian bento.review:
I and my friend ordered vegetarian bento box and Flaming Dragon. Flaming Dragon is lovely and taste great! But vegetarian bento is not great. Croquettes is the only good item in the box. Tempura vegetable is wet inside out and steak tofu is so bland. 

Other thing to add is about cleanness. It appeared that someone touched my napkin because there was a wet crease on it. When my server served ice water, I see oil on the surface. And my plate was still wet that I can see huge drop of water rolling in it. So be aware of that and be careful before start your meal. 

I still gives three star because sushi is great. Servers are nice. But too many thing they might overlook.

Bento box ( salmon teriyaki w/ California roll)

The salmon teriyaki was good, the California roll was alright and salad was okay too.
Katsu don: just your basic katsu don with a little zucchini thrown into it.
King Kong roll-
it was alright.
The taste of it is fine
but it just didn't necessarily impressed me.
Overall the food was meh in my opinion.
If I had to recommend something that I ate it would be the sushi.
It was the best tasting out of things I've ordered.
Service was really friendly and nice.
Overall I don't think I will personally come here again if I am going to be completely honest.

I came here with my parents and ordered a bento box, donburi (katsu don), and their sushi ( King Kong roll).

excerpts: Had the pork katsu don because I have been craving it ever since I got back from Japan.
It wasn't horrible
but I'm sure it could have been better.
Prices were comparable to the other restaurants.
The pork was not tender, it seemed as though it was cooked then microwaved before serving...leaving the pork pieces a little tough.
I liked that they put veggies with the egg.
Other than that, nothing great.
Service was also a little slow however they were very friendly.
I don't know why that day I went to Japantown for Japanese food when all the really delicious spots are outside of Japantown.

katsu don.review: Had the pork katsu don because I have been craving it ever since I got back from Japan.  It wasn't horrible but I'm sure it could have been better.  Prices were comparable to the other restaurants.  The pork was not tender, it seemed as though it was cooked then microwaved before serving...leaving the pork pieces a little tough.  I liked that they put veggies with the egg.  Other than that, nothing great.  Service was also a little slow however they were very friendly.  I don't know why that day I went to Japantown for Japanese food when all the really delicious spots are outside of Japantown.

excerpts: A bowl of seafood udon consisted of two medium sized prawns, one (yes, one) bay shrimp, and a tiny smattering of what they consider mussels (the tiniest they could buy and without shells).
Oh, there was one miniscule piece of squid's tentacles included with maybe two slivers of carrot.
All of this at a price of $14.95.
Robbery.
The rolls were just ok.
seafood udon.author: Luisa T.
seafood udon.review:
Why there are no good Japanese restaurants in Japantown is beyond reason.  Kippu is yet another restaurant that's not stellar.  We were looking for a place to dine on Thanksgiving Day for a late lunch; this seems to be the only other restaurant (Japanese unless you prefer Korean of which there were several in Japantown of all places) that was open in addition to Mifune.

The service was totally harried and too efficient in a bad way.  If one wanted to request something from the server she was either rushing around seating other diners or getting orders to the tables.  It was just chaotic and irritating to have to flag the server down.

Otherwise, the food was pretty substandard & portions meager for the high prices charged.

A bowl of seafood udon consisted of two medium sized prawns, one (yes, one) bay shrimp, and a tiny smattering of what they consider mussels (the tiniest they could buy and without shells).  Oh, there was one miniscule piece of squid's tentacles included with maybe two slivers of carrot. All of this at a price of $14.95.  Robbery.  The rolls were just ok.  And their bento boxes were beyond overpriced for what one got (e.g. thinnest cut of salmon).

So they were packed on Thanksgiving Day not because they're great but because nothing else except Mifune was open.

excerpts: The nabeyaki udon and beef teriyaki bento box was just absolutely tasty.
The service is really nice too.
nabeyaki udon.author: Kiara K.
nabeyaki udon.review: Delicious! The nabeyaki udon and beef teriyaki bento box was just absolutely tasty. The service is really nice too.

excerpts: I decided on the nabeyaki udon while my boyfriend ordered the beef teriyaki with mixed tempura bento box.
My nabeyaki udon was tasty, it was perfect because I was feeling a bit sick with a cold so the hot broth with the chewy noodles were great for my headache.
My boyfriend's meal was HUGE: large servings of beef teriyaki, rice, and tempura for such a low price.
nabeyaki udon.author: Sam F.
nabeyaki udon.review:
A great place for lunch in Japantown.

We happened upon this place while wandering around, looking at various restaurants' menus. There was barely anyone around when we walked in, probably because we arrived around 11:30, but people began to trickle in slowly after we were seated. Our waiter was very attentive and brought us water and menus without us asking. I decided on the nabeyaki udon while my boyfriend ordered the beef teriyaki with mixed tempura bento box. 

My udon came with a side salad which was super yummy and had some awesome sesame dressing. The bento came with miso soup which my boyfriend drank in a hurry so I'm not sure how it tasted lol My nabeyaki udon was tasty, it was perfect because I was feeling a bit sick with a cold so the hot broth with the chewy noodles were great for my headache. They added fish cake, veggies and a shrimp tempura in there as well. My boyfriend's meal was HUGE: large servings of beef teriyaki, rice, and tempura for such a low price. Bento boxes are definitely a steal here!

The prices are super reasonable at Kippu and they have a great selection of items so I would recommend coming here for a yummy meal when you are in Japantown!

excerpts: Beef udon, no good.
Super chewy meat that is not even enough amount to eat, weird veggies combination in the soup like zucchini and lots of carrots...
Sushi was so so.
beef udon.author: Yoshimi M.
beef udon.review: Beef udon, no good. Super chewy meat that is not even enough amount to eat, weird veggies combination in the soup like zucchini and lots of carrots... Sushi was so so.

excerpts: I ordered the Chicken udon soup along with some sushi.
The soup hardly had any chicken.
A few bits, perhaps 5 or 6 small bits.
The soup wasn't very flavorful & hardly had any veg.
chicken udon.author: Julian I.
chicken udon.review:
I was really disappointed by my visit to Kippu in Japan town. I ordered the Chicken udon soup along with some sushi. The soup hardly had any chicken. A few bits, perhaps 5 or 6 small bits. The soup wasn't very flavorful & hardly had any veg. The sushi roll (salmon, tuna, crab, avocado) was very standard with no detail or presentation.

The service was a rather hurried. I was not impressed. I had a look at what others were eating & I had ordered the same sushi roll as the couple I had seen. The bento boxes also didn't look like something I was keen on trying.

All in all there are many other places to try before I'd consider going back.

excerpts: I ordered the tempura udon.
I liked that they kept the tempura on the side so it doesn't get soggy in the soup.
The tempura was light and crispy.
I didn't really find anything special with the noodles or the broth.
tempura udon.author: Alexander L.
tempura udon.review:
I went here for dinner. I ordered the tempura udon. I liked that they kept the tempura on the side so it doesn't get soggy in the soup. The tempura was light and crispy. I didn't really find anything special with the noodles or the broth. The dish also came with a bowl of salad which was ok too. 

Service was a little slow. It took a long time for my food to come out but there was a lot of people in the restaurant.

excerpts: After about 30 mins, one of the guy workers asked what else am I waiting for and I told him the zaru soba with tempura.
He yells it into the kitchen.
Tempura comes out 10 minutes later.
Soba comes out another 5 minutes later.
zaru soba.author: Bern H.
zaru soba.review:
I want to like this place. It's close by and the first time I went was for lunch and the donkatsu was pretty good and service was fine.

I went again recently for dinner and the overall experience was terrible. Hey, restaurants get swamped and honest mistakes are bound to happen. The kicker was the manner in which they handled what they knew was a terrible dining experience for a customer.

1) Walked in and got a seat at the sushi bar. About 10 minutes passed when an older lady asked if I had already ordered. I told them I didn't even get a menu.

2) Ordered a spicy tuna hand roll, which came out promptly but with no wasabi. 

3) At the same time, also ordered a tempura cold soba. And waited.

4) And waited some more. After about 30 mins, one of the guy workers asked what else am I waiting for and I told him the zaru soba with tempura. He yells it into the kitchen. Tempura comes out 10 minutes later. Soba comes out another 5 minutes later.  They tasted decent.

6) Another 10 mins pass,and  an older worker (maybe the owner?) apologizes for the long wait and gives me a side salad that is supposed to come with the soba dinner set. 

7) Side salad has a jagged sharp piece of plastic over an inch long in there which did go in my mouth. I mention it to one of the waitresses who gives it to the guy at the cashier's area...who just seemed to bury the evidence without a care (throw in the trash and pretend it didn't happen). I told the waitress to give my check and inform the older lady (owner?). She does and the lady comes over and just looks kind of surprised and flustered but unapologetic.  No mention of anything to make up for the bad experience. I promptly left. 

Normally, I try to base the review mostly on food taste and minimally on service unless it's a fine restaurant. And maybe it was a one-off but it's pretty hard to be a fan of the restaurant after that experience. I certainly didn't expect to be there for almost an hour for just a cold soba with tempura and a hand roll.

excerpts: I ordered a soda, brown rice (which they ended up being out of), and some BBQ albacore to get me through to dinner, and it was mission accomplished!
However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore...
I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor.
The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own.
The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up.
The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen!
I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!
However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore...
I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor.
The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own.
The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up.
The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen!
I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!
bbq albacore.author: Danielle S.
bbq albacore.review: While shopping through japantown I needed a quick between lunch and dinner snack. Since it was an awkward time most of the places nearby were closed with the exception of Kippu. I ordered a soda, brown rice (which they ended up being out of), and some BBQ albacore to get me through to dinner, and it was mission accomplished! However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore... I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor. The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own. The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up. The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen! I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!

excerpts: " [sic], "Finding Nemo", "Forrest Gump", "Monkey Brain", and maaaany more await you.
There's even "Victoria's Secret".
But in that case, where's "Agent Provocateur"?
Or straight-up
monkey brain.author: Dan B.
monkey brain.review:
Walk over to Daiso and get a $1.50 Asian cowboy hat. Now you're ready to eat at Kippu, with its country-western music that enveloped the first 10-15 minutes of my visit before 180'ing to Kpop.

The miso soup smelled like one thing and one thing only: when I was little, I had a He-Man playset of a claw trap to catch foes and punish them with green slime pouring overhead - THAT. I didn't have to nasally investigate or reminisce either. The split-second the soup bowl hit the table, that smell came all the way back from the 80s right then and there. After deliberation, I eventually took a reluctant benefit-of-the-doubt sip. I shouldn't have.

Take time to pore over the creative and often lawsuit-inviting names of all the sushi rolls. "Chuck Noris" [sic], "Finding Nemo", "Forrest Gump", "Monkey Brain", and maaaany more await you. There's even "Victoria's Secret". But in that case, where's "Agent Provocateur"? Or straight-up "Costco" (you know who you are).

Also, get the frequent flyer miles card. Once you & your new hat have $dined$ here 10 times, you get $10 off your next meal. You'll need it if your portions are like what I got for what I paid.

I'm going with just under 3 stars.

FYI: There are beer & sake bottles on display, but this place is so new that it currently has *no alcohol license*. Don't plan to take your 21st birthday entourage here just yet. (But when you do, text me.)

excerpts: We also had gyoza, the bomb, and a couple other rolls.
All just ok, not great.
Wouldn't go back.
the bomb.author: Dustin M.
the bomb.review: The Flaming Dragon Roll tasted like lighter fluid, couldn't even eat it. We also had gyoza, the bomb, and a couple other rolls. All just ok, not great. Wouldn't go back.

excerpts: The Wasabi salad is great, we ordered a dish called The Bomb which is deep fried Jalapenos in some kind of sauce.
I had the breaded pork which came with a salad and potato salad.
The flavors and sauces that came with the food were also great.
the bomb.author: David S.
the bomb.review:
My first time here. The prices were very reasonable for the amount of food you get. My wife and I loved it. The Wasabi salad is great, we ordered a dish called The Bomb which is deep fried Jalapenos in some kind of sauce. I had the breaded pork which came with a salad and potato salad. The flavors and sauces that came with the food were also great. I also enjoyed part of my wife's dish the Teryaki chicken with California roll and deep fried veggies. Ive never seen portions this huge in a Japanese restaurant; it was like a hungry mans restaurant. The waiter was nice. It is a little pricey but it was absolutely worth it to me. Quite possibly the best Japanese food Ive ever eaten. It was really that good. I wish I knew the names of the dishes but Im not very well versed in Japanese cuisine.
You also get some really tasty Miso soup before you order.. All in all I was pleased and very full. I guess portions depend on what you order. The dinner tray dishes are packed with food though...Even Godzilla would be full from eating there !

excerpts: I love the oyster shooter and my pepper fin dish.
Yummy!!
Thank u kippu

pepper fin.review: I actually really liked this place regardless of all the bad reviews.  Most people complained about the temperature of the room and the seating. I didn't mind it. I love the oyster shooter and my pepper fin dish.  Yummy!!  Thank u kippu

excerpts: I decided on three smaller items off their menu, but to my pleasant surprise, they generously served me a miso soup and salad anyway
(photo: http://bit.ly/2z8G2xR).
salad.author: Ed U.
salad.review:
I've sat in front of this inconspicuous Japanese restaurant several times whenever I took a seat on one of the worn benches on the cobblestoned Buchanan Street plaza. I decided to give it a try one evening as I was leisurely strolling through Japantown and found it about half full of customers. I didn't have high expectations about the quality based on some of the Yelp feedback I read, and frankly that preconception helped me get through my meal without incident.

I decided on three smaller items off their menu, but to my pleasant surprise, they generously served me a miso soup and salad anyway (photo: http://bit.ly/2z8G2xR). My first item was the $8.50 Chicken Yakitori because I felt like having a couple of skewers of poultry (photo: http://bit.ly/2Kx8QVW). The meat alternated with scallions and red pepper, but the flavor was compromised by the gooey marinade. Better was the $12.50 Hamachi Kama which was yellowtail collar simply grilled with the skin left intact (photo: http://bit.ly/2KDjNVv).

The simpler, the better. That's why the kama worked for me, but sometimes simple is just too simple. That was the mistake I made with my third choice, the appropriately priced $5 Avocado Roll which was just that, avocado rolled in rice and nori (photo: http://bit.ly/2KN9afH). There wasn't enough flavor to make it interesting. I didn't find anything offensive about Kippu, it just felt interchangeable with any number of J-Town eateries offering the exact same dishes. Maybe that's good enough sometimes.

FOOD - 3 stars...middling Japanese fare with the kama the best of the plates I had
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...pretty standard decor for J-Town
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...a bit on the slow side
TOTAL - 3 stars...kinda nondescript for my taste

excerpts: Bentos come with rice, salad, and miso soup.
One of our soups had a little bug/fly in it.
Told the waitress and she replaced it, but who knows what she did with it.
Their salad dressing is the best!

salad.review:
My go-to place for bento boxes in SF!

1. Prices for the lunch bentos are the best value.
2. We recently went for dinner. Bf ordered chicken teriyaki bento and I ordered vegetarian 3 item bento with age-dashi tofu, veggie tempura, and avocado roll. Paid $35 after tip.
3. Bentos come with rice, salad, and miso soup.
4. One of our soups had a little bug/fly in it. Told the waitress and she replaced it, but who knows what she did with it.
5. Their salad dressing is the best!

excerpts: Salad is a little dry and not as fresh as it should.
Waiter took the signed pay slip prior to end of meal, it costs a star!
salad.author: Steve H.
salad.review: This place located in the heart of Japan Town. Food is normally good. Salad is a little dry and not as fresh as it should. Waiter took the signed pay slip prior to end of meal, it costs a star!

excerpts: This is the only location that gives you complimentary miso soup & salad with your entree in comparison to the other sushi spots located in Japan Town.
Prices are super reasonable & service is absolutely excellent!
My grandma kinda VIP over here
(she's here all the time lol)  too
so we always get great service here & their food is soo good.

This is the only location that gives you complimentary miso soup & salad with your entree in comparison to the other sushi spots located in Japan Town. Prices are super reasonable & service is absolutely excellent! My grandma kinda VIP over here (she's here all the time lol)  too so we always get great service here & their food is soo good.

Seaweed Salad

salad.review: Fresh and yummy sushi and the ambiance was perfect for a day date. The complementary salad and miso was yummy, too!

I definitely will come back again!
salad.author: Cameron W.
salad.review: Great sushi! The meal came with complimentary miso salad. Staff was nice and friendly and attentive. I definitely will come back again! We got the rainbow roll, Philadelphia and cherry blossom. All were great and had very reasonable pricing.

excerpts: The chicken teriyaki lunch bento came with miso soup, salad, chicken teriyaki, rice, one shrimp tempura, and a potato croquet.
The portion was small but it was enough to fill me up.
The sushi chef was very observant: I needed a napkin and was looking around on my table to find a clean one
salad.author: Angelyn S.
salad.review:
The $6.95 chicken teriyaki sign outside caught my eyes. 

Came here while I was waiting to get my visa from across the street. Food took awhile to come but it was good. The chicken teriyaki lunch bento came with miso soup, salad, chicken teriyaki, rice, one shrimp tempura, and a potato croquet. The portion was small but it was enough to fill me up. The sushi chef was very observant: I needed a napkin and was looking around on my table to find a clean one but he immediately noticed and called the server to hand me one.

Food is 3 stars but because of their attentiveness, they deserve 4 stars.

excerpts: Love places that give you complimentary miso and salad!
The teriyaki chicken box with rice, salad, miso soup and an assortment of tempura was enough for my two kids to share.
salad.author: Francine B.
salad.review: Walked through Japan town and decided on this place out of a dozen and glad we did. Love places that give you complimentary miso and salad! The teriyaki chicken box with rice, salad, miso soup and an assortment of tempura was enough for my two kids to share.  We had the giant roll and a roll with scallops which were quite tasty.
