The oyster shooter was not very warm and did not have any spice to it like I prefer. The Portions were good size except the Pepperfin which came with only 4 pieces and was about $12. It also had some flakes on top I didn't like and not enough sauce. That being said I really enjoyed the rolls and the staff was very nice and attentive. They had over 70 rolls to choose from and some that were pretty unique. I would go back here again when visiting.

excerpts: I ordered their Daily Special A which comes with miso soup, salad, five pieces of nigiri, and california roll.
salad.author: Joshua M.
salad.review: I went to Kippu Japanese Cuisine on a Wednesday night to eat some good sushi. The service was great and friendly throughout the entire meal. I ordered their Daily Special A which comes with miso soup, salad, five pieces of nigiri, and california roll. The nigiri was great in that there was a high sashimi to rice ratio. The hamachi also tasted exceptionally well. For the affordable price, I enjoyed the meal very much with the wonderful hot tea as well.

excerpts: They offer a complimentary miso soup and salad to start your meal.
Don't go looking for a spoon either, we eat our soup
just like they do in Japan haha.
salad.author: Brittany W.
salad.review:
When I heard that they have a Japantown in the city I had to get me some sushi!  My friend brought me here and the food wasn't that bad.  I got the usual, California roll and pretty much another California roll with salmon and yellow tail on top.  They offer a complimentary miso soup and salad to start your meal.  Don't go looking for a spoon either, we eat our soup just like they do in Japan haha.  Drink up!

The food is where the authentic culture ends.  The music selection was great but very American.  They did offer a lot is specialty rolls, my friend got their fried golden gate roll. It looked delicious!

excerpts: My food was okay; I ordered the vegetarian bento box, which came with inari, vegetable tempura, miso soup, salad, and karrokes.
The quantity of food I received for the price (around $13) was pretty good, and overall I enjoyed my dinner, with the exception of the inari tofu.
It was soggy, hardly breaded and fried at all, and just tasted bad.
salad.author: Molly I.
salad.review:
My boyfriend and I had dinner here last week. While the food was acceptable, the service was not. Our waitress was not very friendly, and seemed as if she wanted to be anywhere but there. We had to ask her for water, which is understandable given California's drought. However, what was not understandable or acceptable was why she gave us half-full glasses of tap water, while the tables near us had full glasses of water with ice cubes. The waitress did not offer to refill our glasses once we finished the half-full water glasses, so we kept having to repeatedly ask her for more water (which we received in a slow manner). My food was okay; I ordered the vegetarian bento box, which came with inari, vegetable tempura, miso soup, salad, and karrokes. The quantity of food I received for the price (around $13) was pretty good, and overall I enjoyed my dinner, with the exception of the inari tofu. It was soggy, hardly breaded and fried at all, and just tasted bad. My boyfriend ordered the dinner bento box special, and the California roll portion of his meal literally came with two pieces. Finally, after sitting and waiting for our check for about 10 minutes after our plates had been cleared, we had to ask the waitress to please bring us our check, which took several more minutes. When she finally arrived at our table, she brought us someone else's check, so we had to go up to the front counter and ask for our proper check. 
We wanted to try a new restaurant in Japantown that we hadn't been to yet, so we chose this one. Next time, we'll be going somewhere where we know we will receive good food AND good service.

excerpts: I got the veggie bento box, with my choice of 3 different vegetarian dishes plus green salad and rice.
It hit the spot!
salad.author: Aleta D.
salad.review: Polite, prompt service, good food. They gave me a free starter of some miso soup while I looked at the menu.  I got the veggie bento box, with my choice of 3 different vegetarian dishes plus green salad and rice. It hit the spot!

excerpts: Meals come with miso soup (this was kind of bland...) and a side salad with sesame dressing (dressing is good).

I'll admit the food in general had pretty good seasoning and flavor (however the seafood tasted slightly fishy, meaning it wasn't super fresh), but I was just a little upset that the portions of the rolls were smaller than advertised.
salad.author: Matthew L.
salad.review:
Looks can be deceiving is a common saying that usually describes people, but in this case describes Kippu. A few days ago, my friend and I were hungry and were craving sushi rolls. And since we were in Japantown, we popped by here and saw what looked mighty big sushi rolls as displayed by the pictures in the window. But in actuality the sushi rolls were pretty tiny - definitely not as big as how they were advertised on the window pictures! How disappointing. 

We ordered the Java roll, Dragon Roll and the Incredible roll... As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream. Meals come with miso soup (this was kind of bland...) and a side salad with sesame dressing (dressing is good).  I'll admit the food in general had pretty good seasoning and flavor (however the seafood tasted slightly fishy, meaning it wasn't super fresh), but I was just a little upset that the portions of the rolls were smaller than advertised.  Each roll came with 8 small sushi pieces, kind of a lot of dough given the high $11-$13/roll price tag.  OK, $11-$13/roll is pretty standard at most Japanese joints, but usually sushi rolls come with 10-12 pieces, not a measly 8. Meh, whatever.

Don't come here hungry and with very little money because you won't get full unless you order a lot.

excerpts: The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).
It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.
salad.author: Leonard L.
salad.review:
Kippu Japanese
SF J-Town
3pm Thursday 16th April 2015
Three Stars

We had the dog so we couldn't eat inside so we ordered takeout.  I got the Number 9 Combination: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.  The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).    It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.  The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).  The steak was dry and lightly sauced. Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.

excerpts: The "bento" was veiled as a thinly sliced salmon patty with minimum rice, seaweed salad and iceberg lettuce (Forgot a picture).
With so many good Japanese restaurants in SF I hate to rip on local business but guys charge more and put more on the plate, your bento was pitiful.
salad.author: Justin F.
salad.review: I just really didn't like this place. The service was okay, but the salmon bento that they advertise for $10.50 should've been more like $4.50. The "bento" was veiled as a thinly sliced salmon patty with minimum rice, seaweed salad and iceberg lettuce (Forgot a picture). With so many good Japanese restaurants in SF I hate to rip on local business but guys charge more and put more on the plate, your bento was pitiful.

excerpts:
the waitstaff was very attentive in getting our orders, refilling our waters, and bringing us the food on time

Food: They bring you complimentary miso soup as soon as you sit down, and then house salad once you order your sushi!
salad.author: Jenna G.
salad.review:
Great inexpensive sushi restaurant. I went here with my parents and we got 5 rolls for 3 people (I could have been fine with 4 but my dad wanted another). We went at 5pm on a Sunday (Fathers Day) and it was pretty empty and we got great service.

Atmosphere: right in japantown, very authentic. the waitstaff was very attentive in getting our orders, refilling our waters, and bringing us the food on time

Food: They bring you complimentary miso soup as soon as you sit down, and then house salad once you order your sushi! It was so great!! For our rolls, we got the carmen, delicious, double salmon, (another one I forgot) and then the flaming dragon. The fish was very fresh, and the only roll we didn't really like was the Flaming Dragon. It's apparently one of the most popular rolls, but I think that's only because it comes out in flames. The flames cook the fish, which makes it weird and not that good.

Overall: I would definitely come here again. I would love to try the bay scallop and lion king rolls (their other two most popular rolls).

excerpts: I really really like how they give free miso soup and a salad in the beginning too.
Its like a full course meal.
salad.author: Pu B.
salad.review: When i walked into the restaurant i was wondering why it was so hot in there. We just ate some burgers so we were already full but we took a stroll through japan town and we stumbled upon this restaurant and my girlfriend and i will never ever say no to some sushi! I really really like how they give free miso soup and a salad in the beginning too. Its like a full course meal. We ended up eating just two rolls the Washington and the mountain roll... They were just alright they left the seeds in the lemon toppings. Their service was really quick! Thumbs up

excerpts: It was nice that we each got a salad and soup even though we just ordered a few rolls to share.
The fish on the rolls were of varying quality, but overall it was not bad.
The problem was the portions for the sushi rolls were a pretty small - even though there were plenty of pieces, each piece was like the size of a quarter.
Sushi for ants, as my friend said.
salad.author: Wayne H.
salad.review: Not great, not terrible, just average. The service was pretty fast, but also felt a little rushed. It was nice that we each got a salad and soup even though we just ordered a few rolls to share. The fish on the rolls were of varying quality, but overall it was not bad. The problem was the portions for the sushi rolls were a pretty small - even though there were plenty of pieces, each piece was like the size of a quarter. Sushi for ants, as my friend said. We did see someone order the flaming dragon roll, which looked pretty impressive, but other than that, we'd probably opt for something different the next time we're in Japantown.

excerpts: My udon came with a side salad which was super yummy and had some awesome sesame dressing.
salad.author: Sam F.
salad.review:
A great place for lunch in Japantown.

We happened upon this place while wandering around, looking at various restaurants' menus. There was barely anyone around when we walked in, probably because we arrived around 11:30, but people began to trickle in slowly after we were seated. Our waiter was very attentive and brought us water and menus without us asking. I decided on the nabeyaki udon while my boyfriend ordered the beef teriyaki with mixed tempura bento box. 

My udon came with a side salad which was super yummy and had some awesome sesame dressing. The bento came with miso soup which my boyfriend drank in a hurry so I'm not sure how it tasted lol My nabeyaki udon was tasty, it was perfect because I was feeling a bit sick with a cold so the hot broth with the chewy noodles were great for my headache. They added fish cake, veggies and a shrimp tempura in there as well. My boyfriend's meal was HUGE: large servings of beef teriyaki, rice, and tempura for such a low price. Bento boxes are definitely a steal here!

The prices are super reasonable at Kippu and they have a great selection of items so I would recommend coming here for a yummy meal when you are in Japantown!

excerpts: The waitress failed toe toon that everything comes with miso soup and salad.
salad.author: Kiki I.
salad.review:
I had an awful experience here with my friend.  The food literally made me sick.

My friend I arrived at 9:20pm, which seemed like plenty of time given that the restaurant allegedly closes at 10:00pm.  With in two seconds of seating we were told to order within the next five minutes because the kitchen was closing.  Ok.  A minute later the waitress was back demanding our order.  It is a large menu and we did not even have time to read it.

Then we ordered.  The waitress talked my friend into ordering two rolls that basically were fried California rolls.  I had not even read half the menu, so I asked the waitress for a recommendation.  At her suggestion, I ordered one roll, something with spicy tuna.  And, of course the waitress pushed me to order more.  Based upon the photos and high price, I thought one roll was sufficient.  But, the waitress insisted otherwise and further pressured that the kitchen was now closed -- it was only 9:22pm.  So, I also ordered a spicy tuna hand roll and croquets. 

Well they must have had items pre-made because the next thing we knew they were throwing food on the table and taking it away faster than we could eat it.  The waitress failed toe toon that everything comes with miso soup and salad.  When they both unexpectedly arrived, we officially knew we were swindled into ordering too much food.  

The spicy tuna hand roll was nothing to write home about and a bit fishy.  The moment I took the last bite the waitress, knowing I had another roll coming, swiped my plate, ginger, wasabi, and soy sauce.  Then set down the croquets which were average.  As soon as the croquets cooled they were disgusting and they got cold fast.  

Then the rolls came.  My friend's rolls were average fried and expensive California rolls that were made with fake crab at real crab prices.  She was upset because the waitress clearly pushed her to over order as well and the once the rolls cooled off they were gross.  Again, my roll had fake crab and spicy tuna. It tasted worse than a cheap roll from the grocery store and cost $16.  It was not fresh or worth the price charged.  In fact, I asked for a beer to wash it down and didn't finish it.

The service was so rude.  They started putting chairs up on tables around us at 9:30pm.  This is inappropriate because the restaurant is open until 10:00pm and, more importantly, there were guests still waiting for food.  We left well before 10:00pm and the lights were off and the staff was walking out too -- seriously change your hours to reflect the restaurants actual closing time.   If the rushed service, bad service, and fact that the restaurant closed before completing its food service wasn't bad enough, our waitress was not friendly and purposely oversold us on food.  Maybe that works with tourists, but we live here and expect a more honest approach.

To make matters worse, by the time I got home, I was violently ill.  I think it was the fishy tuna.  Let's just say it was a long and unpleasant night of my body physically ejecting what I ate there.  Miserable.  I think it had to be the fishy tuna because my friend did not feel well, but was not violently ill.

Maybe it was an off night for this place, but either way they got me really sick and that is really not ok.

excerpts: We were welcome with a bowl of soup and salad and our appetizers of seared tuna and dumplings were on point.
We shared a flaming dragon and it was AMAZING!
I'm shocked it has 3 stars.
Our favorite places are unexpected surprises and this was one of them!
This place is well beyond average.
salad.author: Joseph G.
salad.review: Originally went to the restaurant next door and got a weird vibe so we came here. First let me tell you that the service is unbelievable. We were welcome with a bowl of soup and salad and our appetizers of seared tuna and dumplings were on point. We shared a flaming dragon and it was AMAZING! I'm shocked it has 3 stars. Our favorite places are unexpected surprises and this was one of them! This place is well beyond average.

excerpts: The dish also came with a bowl of salad which was ok too.
salad.author: Alexander L.
salad.review:
I went here for dinner. I ordered the tempura udon. I liked that they kept the tempura on the side so it doesn't get soggy in the soup. The tempura was light and crispy. I didn't really find anything special with the noodles or the broth. The dish also came with a bowl of salad which was ok too. 

Service was a little slow. It took a long time for my food to come out but there was a lot of people in the restaurant.

excerpts: We also received complimentary miso soup and salad, which was nice and tasty as well.
Would definitely recommend Kippu if you are in Japantown.
salad.author: Shee X.
salad.review: Sushi was delicious, flavorful, and fresh! We ordered the Flaming Dragon Roll ($15) and the Mountain Roll ($11). We also received complimentary miso soup and salad, which was nice and tasty as well. Would definitely recommend Kippu if you are in Japantown.

excerpts: The portions for the entrees (w/ miso soup, salad, potato salad & rice) were reasonable.
Everything was tasty especially the chicken was tender and the tempura was very crunchy.
The only thing I would complain would be the exclusion of the lunch special on weekends.
Other than that my friends and I enjoyed this place and we would love to come back again.
salad.author: Gene A.
salad.review: My friends and I came here on a Saturday afternoon and our cravings for Japanese food were satisfied. The waiters were very welcoming and I'm impressed we got our food in less than ten minutes! The portions for the entrees (w/ miso soup, salad, potato salad & rice) were reasonable. Everything was tasty especially the chicken was tender and the tempura was very crunchy. The only thing I would complain would be the exclusion of the lunch special on weekends. Other than that my friends and I enjoyed this place and we would love to come back again.

excerpts:
Starters
Seaweed salad was excellent -  not too salty/sweet
salad.author: Elizabeth L.
salad.review:
3.5-star food
2.8-star service

FOOD

Nigiri
Ono (super white tuna) was fantastic - thrilled to find it here as many sushi bars often don't have ono. Also enjoyed the hirame (halibut), sake (salmon) and unagi (eel). While the fish was fresh, the construction was sub-par - the fish kept separating from the rice. 

Skip the uni and roe (term) - these were mediocre.

Starters
Seaweed salad was excellent -  not too salty/sweet
Kaki fried (oysters): panko-breaded, tasty and plump

SERVICE
Sushi chef was pleasant, but otherwise service was non-existent. Server didn't check on us until nearly the end of our meal, which almost seemed like an afterthought. 

Pricing is reasonable.

excerpts: The orange blossom special roll, Cucumber salad, California roll and avocado roll.
The pieces were well sized.
salad.author: Natascha G.
salad.review:
We came on a Thursday night. Most of the tables were occupied, but due to the good size we had no trouble being seated.
The sushi is fresh and the service courteous.  
We ordered salmon, tuna and shrimp sushi. The orange blossom special roll, Cucumber salad, California roll and avocado roll.
The pieces were well sized.

excerpts: Salad dressing is the Chef's Secret which I could not get out of my server, but I can say "I wanted the recipe".
salad.author: Marla B.
salad.review: Killing time around Japantown and feeling a bit peckish... I came across this little gem.  Even though the lunch hour was "over", their "specials sign" drew me in.  Chicken Bento Box for $6.50... I was pleasantly greeted by the server.  The restaurant is small and tidy but immaculate.  Only one other diner when I arrived, but i did hear them "oohing and aahhing" over their meal.  I was immediately given water and Miso soup, which I love.  The server explained the difference between the $6.50 BB special and the regular $8.50 BB, I went with the special and was very pleased.  Food was "Hot" and "Plentiful".  Great flavors.  Salad dressing is the Chef's Secret which I could not get out of my server, but I can say "I wanted the recipe". Shrimp and Fried Potato cooked perfectly, rice dusted with black sesame seeds, and Teriyaki Sauce not to sweet.  Just what I needed and just what I wanted and now I must return to try other specials on their menu. Great location for "before a movie @ Kabuki" or "after a movie".

excerpts: The other surprise - was that we each received a miso soup and a salad in spite of only ordering ~$10 worth of sushi each.
salad.author: Margot D.
salad.review:
Stumbled on this place while being a tourist and wandering through Japantown.

Atmosphere was great - not too big, pretty private areas for seating in spite of being one big room.

Menu was great - lots of Nigiri Sushi options, special rolls and basic ones too. 

Great quality and volume of food for the prices.

Quality and volume of food was excellent - rolls were decent in size, very evenly diced tiny vegetables in vegetarian rolls, and extremely fresh. We only ordered a few small rolls and a hand roll and they were chock full of fresh, delicious fish, and my unagi hand roll had 4 big pieces of bbq eel in it. The other surprise - was that we each received a miso soup and a salad in spite of only ordering ~$10 worth of sushi each.

Service was excellent and fast - rolls came out quickly, servers were attentive and answered questions about the different rolls.

excerpts: The salad was delicious too.
I keep on saying I want to go back just for that udon again
salad.author: Krystal C.
salad.review:
I came here a while back with my sister for the heck of it. I remember she ordered sushi, which was ok, nothing spectacular if my memory serves me right.

I had udon, the beef one I believe. It's probably the best udon I've had ever in my life. Everything about it was just perfect! The salad was delicious too. I keep on saying I want to go back just for that udon again and unfortunately I haven't been back since for whatever reasons.

The service was ok. We were seated fairly quickly, but the servers never really checked on us. They kept on checking the other customers. They probably only came to check on us once. I didn't really mind though since we got to eat in peace.

Not a good place to talk loudly though as I remember it was pretty quiet in there.

excerpts: 2-Their side salad was very fresh and tasty.
3-Their server seems nice,but they don't clean your table special when going back to their kitchen with
their hand empty
and they don't know how to run the floor.
4-My wife got
her food and mine dish came 25 minute after she eat half hers....
salad.author: Pedro D.
salad.review:
I agree all the negative reviews about this place.. I have been a loyal customer for a long time and I want to point something very dangerous about their food serving lately..
As I was eating my food my wife noticed the chicken surfaced half pink and God knows what could happen if she didn't tell me..  
1- The California roll was very good.
2-Their side salad was very fresh and tasty.
3-Their server seems nice,but they don't clean your table special when going back to their kitchen with  their hand empty and they don't know how to run the floor.
4-My wife got her food and mine dish came 25 minute after she eat half hers....

excerpts: Always a plus to get complimentary soup and salad with a maki order.
salad.author: Dave N.
salad.review:
Warm, lively greeting by the sushi chefs.  Great, kind, attentive service.  I absolutely loved the variety of specialty rolls.  We ordered the Washington, Crazy, and Love rolls and all were great, but the Crazy was a little bland (yellowtail, tuna AND salmon overpowered the veggies).  Always a plus to get complimentary soup and salad with a maki order.  The tea was nice, but luke-warm, not piping hot.

Over all, a solid choice for sushi in Japantown.

excerpts: And lastly, we were given a complimentary salad from one of the chefs.
but of course the salad alone didn't do it.
With the fresh, inexpensive food and the caring, entertaining chefs-
(one almost stabbed the other and a hilarious conversation between them
ensued)-
salad.author: Jordan T.
salad.review:
It's always an adventure when I travel to the city. When ever I go, I either get lost trying to go somewhere or try a new place with good ratings on yelp. This time it was both.

Not knowing where we were, my friend and I decided to park near what we hoped was Japantown to find a place to eat. This was the very first place we stumbled upon and after a short hesitation we decided to give 'er a try (I lived in OK, sorry). 

Anyway, we walked in and it wasn't hard to tell they were swamped with customers. Loud screams and shouts telling us where to sit came from what seemed to be the owner of the restaurant. (which didn't really bother me)

But we sat at the bar and looked through the menu while an older, drunk Japanese couple left the bar and dumped a $60 tip into the chefs jar. With that, my expectations rose.

We ordered an Orange Blossom, Victoria Secret roll, a bento and an 18 piece shashimi combo- which all was individually cheap compared to other sushi restaurants I've been to.

Sadly the food took over 30 minutes to get to us- and I was afraid the waiter who tended us was swamped and forgot to give the chefs our order. But after maintaining some patience we finally received our food which made up for it's wait.

Everything was incredibly fresh which surprised me being that all of it was so cheap.

The rolls were very tasty- and I was sad when it was over.

The tempura on the bento was cooked to near perfection (some of the best tempura I've had in a while). And the noodles were awesome.

And lastly, we were given a complimentary salad from one of the chefs. I don't know if this was for the wait, just something the bar got, or just for a good tip. 

Well if it was for a tip, it worked- but of course the salad alone didn't do it. With the fresh, inexpensive food and the caring, entertaining chefs- (one almost stabbed the other and a hilarious conversation between them ensued)- I left this place full and satisfied. 

Maybe again some day when you guys aren't so busy!

3/5

excerpts: They start you off with complementary miso soup and a salad.
Been here a few times and have left sated and happy each time!
salad.author: Dan F.
salad.review: Great sushi. Amazing selection (dozens and dozens of roll options). They even have a good veggie section! Super fast service. They start you off with complementary miso soup and a salad. Been here a few times and have left sated and happy each time!

excerpts: It's only about 8 dollars which also come with soup and salad.
salad.author: Dom G.
salad.review:
We came here yesterday for lunch  and enjoyed it.

   We order lunch Box  .  Fish and Tempura which not bad at all.

    It's only about 8 dollars which also come with soup and salad.

   Great value .  But the service could be slow when they get busy.

excerpts: + salad
+ my bento combo.
Big portions, I totally recommend it, I was full after that, good quality/price !
no wifi / the staff is not japanese but much more like korean or chinese, one of the chef was mexican, Mario
salad.author: Julien F.
salad.review: I got the «chicken teriyaky + tempura + gyoza» combo for only 10,50$ it comes with a miso soup + salad + my bento combo. Big portions, I totally recommend it, I was full after that, good quality/price ! *no wifi / the staff is not japanese but much more like korean or chinese, one of the chef was mexican, Mario

excerpts: They served us complimentary miso soup and salad.
I'm not sure if it's always like that
but they said it was free so yay for us!
My friend got the Flaming Dragon and I got the 49ers.
Didn't really like the smokey taste of the Flaming Dragon
salad.author: Lesley M.
salad.review: Me and my friend came here the day before Valentine's day and we were seated right away. It was about 8pm at that time. They served us complimentary miso soup and salad. I'm not sure if it's always like that but they said it was free so yay for us! My friend got the Flaming Dragon and I got the 49ers. Didn't really like the smokey taste of the Flaming Dragon but you can never go wrong with a 49er roll. Service was great and will definitely be coming back here.

excerpts: We also received miso soup and salad which are the usual tasting fare
but I was happy to receive it in any case.
salad.author: Guisela L.
salad.review: First official review for me...awesome. Ok so let me start with my family is friends with the owner here but that won't stop me from writing an honest review. The location is conveniently right off the street and its nestled in a cute corner like location. The place is clean and the staff greeted us with a warm welcome even before they knew that we knew the owner. Overall the food was pretty good and everything tasted fresh. We ordered everything from nigiri, sashimi, hwe dub bap (Korean style sushi bowl) and dessert. Because we knew the owner he surprised us with the flaming dragon roll which comes on out on a plate on fire and even though we tend to not like cooked sushi this roll was delicious, I recommend it to everyone. We also received miso soup and salad which are the usual tasting fare but I was happy to receive it in any case. We also got hot and cold sake, the hot sake went down really smooth and the cold sake had these interesting gold flakes in it, but both were good. The staff were quick to remove plates and to refill all of our drinks. Overall a wonderful experience, the only reason why I couldn't give 5 stars is that this isn't the BEST sushi I've ever had but this business is certainly deserving of 4 solid stars. I will return.

excerpts: The miso soup was great and the salad was fantastic!
Two of our party had sushi and both enjoyed their dishes.
The rest of us had tempura and teriyaki.
The portions were large and the meals tasted just right.
I just took off one star because we all thought our martinis were weak.
salad.author: C A.
salad.review: We were given a friendly greeting and our party was seated right away. Our appetizers were fresh and came out quickly. The miso soup was great and the salad was fantastic! Two of our party had sushi and both enjoyed their dishes. The rest of us had tempura and teriyaki.  The portions were large and the meals tasted just right. I just took off one star because we all thought our martinis were weak.

excerpts: The Wasabi salad is great, we ordered a dish called The Bomb which is deep fried Jalapenos in some kind of sauce.
I had the breaded pork which came with a salad and potato salad.
The flavors and sauces that came with the food were also great.
salad.author: David S.
salad.review:
My first time here. The prices were very reasonable for the amount of food you get. My wife and I loved it. The Wasabi salad is great, we ordered a dish called The Bomb which is deep fried Jalapenos in some kind of sauce. I had the breaded pork which came with a salad and potato salad. The flavors and sauces that came with the food were also great. I also enjoyed part of my wife's dish the Teryaki chicken with California roll and deep fried veggies. Ive never seen portions this huge in a Japanese restaurant; it was like a hungry mans restaurant. The waiter was nice. It is a little pricey but it was absolutely worth it to me. Quite possibly the best Japanese food Ive ever eaten. It was really that good. I wish I knew the names of the dishes but Im not very well versed in Japanese cuisine.
You also get some really tasty Miso soup before you order.. All in all I was pleased and very full. I guess portions depend on what you order. The dinner tray dishes are packed with food though...Even Godzilla would be full from eating there !

excerpts: The salad that came with lunch was tasty and the dressing was just right.
salad.author: Brad H.
salad.review:
I'm no expert on Japanese food by any stretch of the imagination. But we were in Japan Town a few weeks back and went to another restaurant that was "award winning" and all that jazz. I was not impressed. The prices were too high, service was lacking and the food was just okay. The next trip we tried this place, mostly because it was a little off the path and there were no lines. So we decided to try this place and I'm glad we did! 

The first trip I had the teriyaki beef. It was very tasty! The soup was great as well, I'm usually not a fan of miso soup at all but theirs was different than most. Had to put two ice cubes in it to cool it down but the taste was great. The sushi (not a fan of sushi and I have no idea what was ordered) was good as well. The salad that came with lunch was tasty and the dressing was just right. 

Today I had the spicy chicken lunch. The chicken was GOOD! Just spicy enough to have a bite but not to the point where it tasted like burning. Service was great and food came out fast.

Pros:
Price. It's not a bargain meal but the prices are still really fair. Where else can you get a great meal like this for 6-8 bucks?  

Food. Everything I've had has been great so far!

Service. Can't really complain, friendly and efficient. 

Location. Right across from the touristy places and less tourist =D.

Cons.... Um.... having to ask for a fork! LOL yeah, I'm one of those kind of people.

excerpts: apologizes for the long wait and gives me a side salad that is supposed to come with the soba dinner set.
Side salad has a jagged sharp piece of plastic over an inch long in there which did go in my mouth.
I mention it to one of the waitresses who gives it to the guy at the cashier's area...who just seemed to bury the evidence without a care (throw in the trash and pretend it didn't happen).
I told the waitress to give my check and inform the older lady (owner?).
She does and the lady comes over and just looks kind of surprised and flustered but unapologetic.
No mention of anything to make up for the bad experience.
salad.author: Bern H.
salad.review:
I want to like this place. It's close by and the first time I went was for lunch and the donkatsu was pretty good and service was fine.

I went again recently for dinner and the overall experience was terrible. Hey, restaurants get swamped and honest mistakes are bound to happen. The kicker was the manner in which they handled what they knew was a terrible dining experience for a customer.

1) Walked in and got a seat at the sushi bar. About 10 minutes passed when an older lady asked if I had already ordered. I told them I didn't even get a menu.

2) Ordered a spicy tuna hand roll, which came out promptly but with no wasabi. 

3) At the same time, also ordered a tempura cold soba. And waited.

4) And waited some more. After about 30 mins, one of the guy workers asked what else am I waiting for and I told him the zaru soba with tempura. He yells it into the kitchen. Tempura comes out 10 minutes later. Soba comes out another 5 minutes later.  They tasted decent.

6) Another 10 mins pass,and  an older worker (maybe the owner?) apologizes for the long wait and gives me a side salad that is supposed to come with the soba dinner set. 

7) Side salad has a jagged sharp piece of plastic over an inch long in there which did go in my mouth. I mention it to one of the waitresses who gives it to the guy at the cashier's area...who just seemed to bury the evidence without a care (throw in the trash and pretend it didn't happen). I told the waitress to give my check and inform the older lady (owner?). She does and the lady comes over and just looks kind of surprised and flustered but unapologetic.  No mention of anything to make up for the bad experience. I promptly left. 

Normally, I try to base the review mostly on food taste and minimally on service unless it's a fine restaurant. And maybe it was a one-off but it's pretty hard to be a fan of the restaurant after that experience. I certainly didn't expect to be there for almost an hour for just a cold soba with tempura and a hand roll.

excerpts:
I ordered Bento box with Tempura which very good and not too oily, it came with miso, salad and avocado maki, inarizushi and rice, it was huge! 
My date got the pork bone ramen (i think thats what it was called)  and liked the broth very much but thought it could have had more veggies and meat, it came with salad and miso. 
For drinks we Kirin and Sapporo beer.
It was about $27 for the two of us including tip and drinks.
salad.author: Diana C.
salad.review:
I really liked this restaurant! It was small and cozy, although it was a little too busy at the time we went, (we got there during the dinner rush hour.) The wait staff were quick and friendly but it did seem like they *almost* couldn't keep up with the tables, almost. I think it would have been perfect had we gone at a less busy time.
I ordered Bento box with Tempura which very good and not too oily, it came with miso, salad and avocado maki, inarizushi and rice, it was huge! 
My date got the pork bone ramen (i think thats what it was called)  and liked the broth very much but thought it could have had more veggies and meat, it came with salad and miso. 
For drinks we Kirin and Sapporo beer.
It was about $27 for the two of us including tip and drinks.

excerpts: In any case, I have to say their lunch special is a great deal - about $7 for miso soup plus a bento box filled with two entrees, salad, and rice.
salad.author: Can C.
salad.review:
I'd say it's more of a 3.5, but it may partially be due to the fact that it's quite convenient for us.  In any case, I have to say their lunch special is a great deal - about $7 for miso soup plus a bento box filled with two entrees, salad, and rice.  I've tried both the salmon and the beef teriyaki, all of which have been pretty tasty.  I'm also a fan of the tempura.  So definitely most of the stars are for this lunch special.  As for their sushi, it's not too bad.  Just don't let the pictures fool you; I once made that mistake and was disappointed with the portion size (it looked a lot more generous in the menu).

If it weren't so convenient, I would likely not go out of my way to eat here.  But still a great lunch deal!

excerpts: Standard mix and match basics with soup, salad and rice.
salad.author: Steph T.
salad.review:
Lunch deals are amazing here.  For two, the bill came out to just over 15.  Standard mix and match basics with soup, salad and rice.  I had sashimi and california roll; my dining partner went with the california roll and tempura.  Simple, yet good - and excellent for the price!

Tuna sashimi was very fresh and sliced into three decent pieces.  California roll was typical, made with imitation crab.  Miso soup was also the common soup that you find at restaurants in this price range, but I did find more than few, small pieces of tofu!  Even the green tea was pretty good, although I did spill it all over the place because of the chewed-up plastic covered teapot spout.  Careful. 

I didn't attempt any of the rolls, but would definitely find my way back for a nice lunch under 10 dollars when I'm around Japantown.  That said, this is definitely not worth the trek or parking charges for a cheap lunch, unless you are already in the area.

excerpts: and salad I will round up and not down for 2 stars.
salad.author: Ally V.
salad.review:
I wanted to give it 1.5 stars for the quality of sushi, but because we got complimentary miso soup and salad I will round up and not down for 2 stars. 

We asked what fish was good today and he said salmon so we tried it. Salmon was very good. Other than that, all the fish was blah and not very fresh. If you go here just stick with the recommendation of the chef and don't order anything else. We ended up getting a few salmon sashimi to ensure we had something edible. Just to be clear, I am probably a sushi snob so try the place if you'd like and maybe you'll enjoy it. I try not to totally bash restaurants on yelp!.

excerpts: The sushi was mediocre, only plus was rolls came with miso soup and salad-but not all.
Go into the restaurants in the mall for a mug better meal!!!!!
Service was SO bad!!!!!!!
salad.author: foodlubber v.
salad.review: Don't bother! Bad service and rolls much smaller than photos in menu! Had to ask for everything! Water, more water, the rest of our order, the bill, everything! The sushi was mediocre, only plus was rolls came with miso soup and salad-but not all. Go into the restaurants in the mall for a mug better meal!!!!! Service was SO bad!!!!!!!

excerpts: The sushi rolls here are delicious, and so is the seaweed salad.
The fish used in my sushi was definitely fresh, and being very keen on sushi freshness, this is a big deal.
salad.author: Samantha M.
salad.review:
The sushi rolls here are delicious, and so is the seaweed salad. The fish used in my sushi was definitely fresh, and being very keen on sushi freshness, this is a big deal. The prices were also very reasonable, which is great seeing that sushi is normally expensive for good quality. 

The one complaint I have is that it is very cramped in the restaurant.

excerpts: Also had Wakame Salad.
Service was a bit slow, but they were pretty busy, so I'm not slamming them much.
Sushi was pretty tasty.
I'd definitely go again!
salad.author: June W.
salad.review: Party of 5 went Saturday night around 7:30 pm. Pretty busy. We had 2 Flaming Dragon rolls (gotta watch, pretty impressive, and the waiters talk it up too as they're serving it), Lion Head, Cherry Blossom and 3-4 others. Also had Wakame Salad. Service was a bit slow, but they were pretty busy, so I'm not slamming them much. Sushi was pretty tasty. I'd definitely go again!

excerpts: we liked the miso soup and even salad with yum dressing.
only, the size of the portion is really big.
it's like 130 percent of american size, if compared with a sort of standard japanese restaurant lunch size, it can be twice more.
i usually dont waste food, but i can't finish.
salad.author: Chiemi K.
salad.review: we enjoyed veggie lunch twice, both experience were very good. tempura and coroque are crispy, yet very fluffy yum stuff inside. sushi rolls are good in tinier size with softly cooked rice. we liked the miso soup and even salad with yum dressing. only, the size of the portion is really big. it's like 130 percent of american size, if compared with a sort of standard japanese restaurant lunch size, it can be twice more. i usually dont waste food, but i can't finish.

excerpts: Pre meal, you get miso soup and a salad.
Soup was ok.
Salad had a small bug in it.
Major bummer.
When returning the salad, we didn't even get an apology, instead we got a "oh hahaha" kind of like woopsy thing w/o any remorse.
salad.author: Deon C.
salad.review:
Seemed like a good idea, new place in Japantown and looked semi-busy.

Small place, but nice.  Things starting off good.

New waitress knew nothing of the menu.  I wasn't asking for explanation of the menu, she just didn't know what I was saying when I ordered the rolls.  Kind of a bummer, she had to look at the menu to know what to write down.  

Pre meal, you get miso soup and a salad.  Soup was ok.  Salad had a small bug in it.  Major bummer.  When returning the salad, we didn't even get an apology, instead we got a "oh hahaha" kind of like woopsy thing w/o any remorse.

Got the happy hour beer.  Forgot the name of it, but it was fizzy, just as it said on the btl.  Best thing so far.

Got 3 rolls.  To start off, they were all very tiny for the price.  I was then expecting great quality.  Wow, disappointed.  I basically felt they lacked any flavor.  Tuna was blah blah, fried tempura was cold, and I could go on and on.  It basically felt like I was just feeding hunger vs enjoying sushi.

Unfortunately, for a new place, I do not know if they will survive.  You're in Japantown, you should make at least good sushi.  

Overall, will not go back.  Hope they improve on all aspects from service to quality of food.

excerpts: The salad wasn't as good as I've had it at other Japanese restaurants, but it's a pretty basic salad, so it can't get that bad or good.
Oh, and they have cool cocktails!
I got the Purple Gecko, my fiance got the Mojito Affair and my cousin got the Plumtini.
All very good.
Tasted like Jolly Ranchers!
For the three of us and all that food it cost about $64.
salad.author: Erin A.
salad.review: We liked this place. The sushi is good. We ordered the Candy Cane, the Incredible and the something with the word Mexican in it. I can't remember the full name of the last one. They were all really good! They were all under the Special Roll section of the menu. The servers were interesting - there were several girls and one guy that seemed to be serving us, and the guy seemed to be the only one who really knew what was going on. The girls didn't seem to know what they were serving us and couldn't really answer questions. They were friendly though :) The miso soup was good. The salad wasn't as good as I've had it at other Japanese restaurants, but it's a pretty basic salad, so it can't get that bad or good. Oh, and they have cool cocktails! I got the Purple Gecko, my fiance got the Mojito Affair and my cousin got the Plumtini. All very good. Tasted like Jolly Ranchers! :) For the three of us and all that food it cost about $64.

excerpts: : This bento box included a side salad, 4pcs of California roll, white rice, a filet salmon teriyaki with ginger and wasabi.
The salmon teriyaki was good, the California roll was alright and salad was okay too.
rice.author: Kochamon S.
rice.review:
The food was alright honestly..
I came here with my parents and ordered a bento box, donburi (katsu don), and their sushi ( King Kong roll).

Bento box ( salmon teriyaki w/ California roll): This bento box included a side salad, 4pcs of California roll, white rice, a filet salmon teriyaki with ginger and wasabi. The salmon teriyaki was good, the California roll was alright and salad was okay too. 

Katsu don: just your basic katsu don with a little zucchini thrown into it. 
King Kong roll- it was alright. The taste of it is fine but it just didn't necessarily impressed me. 
Overall the food was meh in my opinion. If I had to recommend something that I ate it would be the sushi. It was the best tasting out of things I've ordered. 
Service was really friendly and nice. 
Overall I don't think I will personally come here again if I am going to be completely honest.

excerpts: That was the mistake I made with my third choice, the appropriately priced $5 Avocado Roll which was just that, avocado rolled in rice and nori (photo: http://bit.ly/2KN9afH).
There wasn't enough flavor to make it interesting.
I didn't find anything offensive about Kippu, it just felt interchangeable with any number of J-Town eateries offering the exact same dishes.
rice.author: Ed U.
rice.review:
I've sat in front of this inconspicuous Japanese restaurant several times whenever I took a seat on one of the worn benches on the cobblestoned Buchanan Street plaza. I decided to give it a try one evening as I was leisurely strolling through Japantown and found it about half full of customers. I didn't have high expectations about the quality based on some of the Yelp feedback I read, and frankly that preconception helped me get through my meal without incident.

I decided on three smaller items off their menu, but to my pleasant surprise, they generously served me a miso soup and salad anyway (photo: http://bit.ly/2z8G2xR). My first item was the $8.50 Chicken Yakitori because I felt like having a couple of skewers of poultry (photo: http://bit.ly/2Kx8QVW). The meat alternated with scallions and red pepper, but the flavor was compromised by the gooey marinade. Better was the $12.50 Hamachi Kama which was yellowtail collar simply grilled with the skin left intact (photo: http://bit.ly/2KDjNVv).

The simpler, the better. That's why the kama worked for me, but sometimes simple is just too simple. That was the mistake I made with my third choice, the appropriately priced $5 Avocado Roll which was just that, avocado rolled in rice and nori (photo: http://bit.ly/2KN9afH). There wasn't enough flavor to make it interesting. I didn't find anything offensive about Kippu, it just felt interchangeable with any number of J-Town eateries offering the exact same dishes. Maybe that's good enough sometimes.

FOOD - 3 stars...middling Japanese fare with the kama the best of the plates I had
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...pretty standard decor for J-Town
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...a bit on the slow side
TOTAL - 3 stars...kinda nondescript for my taste

excerpts: Bentos come with rice, salad, and miso soup.
One of our soups had a little bug/fly in it.
Told the waitress and she replaced it, but who knows what she did with it.
Their salad dressing is the best!
rice.author: Tammy P.
rice.review:
My go-to place for bento boxes in SF!

1. Prices for the lunch bentos are the best value.
2. We recently went for dinner. Bf ordered chicken teriyaki bento and I ordered vegetarian 3 item bento with age-dashi tofu, veggie tempura, and avocado roll. Paid $35 after tip.
3. Bentos come with rice, salad, and miso soup.
4. One of our soups had a little bug/fly in it. Told the waitress and she replaced it, but who knows what she did with it.
5. Their salad dressing is the best!

excerpts:
To start: 

- Agedashi tofu (fried tofu)
- Inari (sticky rice wrapped in sweet tofu) 

The agedashi tofu had the right batter which absorbed the sauce really well. 

The inari was delicious and pretty standard... hard to mess it up.
rice.author: Michael T.
rice.review:
I am so confused as to why there are so many negative reviews! 

Came here for a quick lunch with a friend, and I was thoroughly impressed. 

Upon sitting, we were asked what we wanted to drink (I think the waitress could see all the sweat dripping from my face, as we conquered a few hills to reach Kippu). We were served water promptly.

To start: 

- Agedashi tofu (fried tofu)
- Inari (sticky rice wrapped in sweet tofu) 

Both were fantastic. The agedashi tofu had the right batter which absorbed the sauce really well. 

The inari was delicious and pretty standard... hard to mess it up. 

My friend got a bento box with chicken teriyaki and tempura. I got the bento with chicken teriyaki and gyoza. 

Was it good? 

Well, with little talking in between, at the end I looked at our bento boxes. Every section of each of our bentos was cleaned out. 

It was good. 

A huge bonus and very much appreciated was the service. EFFICIENT and FRIENDLY! 

Seriously, as soon as we finished our appetizers, the empty/dirty dishes were immediately removed or replaced. Water was constantly filled up. When we finished one dish, the waitress would remind us that our next dishes were still on the way.

5/5 Stars. See you again, Kippu.

excerpts: More importantly the sushi rice was a really well done: vinegar with just a touch of sweet, very similar to my own recipe.
rice.author: Jason G.
rice.review:
We sat at the sushi bar and were happily surprised. Kippu was the only open restaurant later in the evening that seemed more dedicated to sushi (with an actual sushi bar). We ordered hirame, sake, unagi, tobiko and a una-q roll (might have been called "caterpiller roll", unagi with cucumber, topped with avocado).   We weren't expecting much from a Japanese restaurant right on the tourist strip, but Kippu's fish was really good. Nice temperature, good texture and larger pieces than I would've expected. More importantly the sushi rice was a really well done: vinegar with just a touch of sweet, very similar to my own recipe. I'm pretty sure the place was Korean owned, which isn't a surprise these days in J-town.  

The service was a bit sparse, as it was two hosts/servers/bussers for maybe 15 tables and you could not order anything, even sushi, via the sushi bar.  So ordering, paying, etc., often had a bit more wait than expected. 

Overall, I was really happy with Kippu and would definitely stop in again.

excerpts: We ate the chicken and rice.
rice.author: Rachel D.
rice.review:
They were the only spot open on New Year's Day. I know it's hard to be open on New Year's day BUT the service and food were both pretty bad. We were ignored at the hostess stand for a good 10 minutes. Finally we were acknowledged after I said something to the hostess. 

My husband ordered the sashimi lunch box and I got the teriyaki chicken (afraid to eat the sushi based on other reviews). His salmon sashimi was inedible. The sushi was so slimy and warm. He had me look at it and it looked pretty bad. He ate a little bit and confirmed it wasn't fit to eat. We ate the chicken and rice. I had my california roll (which was grocery store quality). 

When we were done I had to flag down the waiter for the bill. Once I got the bill from him, he never asked me if I needed a box. The bill was set to pay and he was still MIA. I went up to the hostess stand and had to ask for a box which took much longer. 

I know they were busy and it's a hard day to be open but this was a pretty bad experience. I didn't mention the sushi to the server but because they seemed so busy and kept ignoring us, I figured it wasn't even worth mentioning to them anyway.. or they would ignore me. 

I'm from the east coast so I probably won't ever be back here but I wanted to let folks know regardless. If there are other options, try elsewhere!

excerpts: We were a big group of 11 and from the time we started placing our orders to the time we're almost done with our meal, the servers couldn't bring enough small plates coz they're out of it, and it took them so long to bring us a bowl of rice, which they ended up charging us 2 bowls instead, and most importantly, one of the staffs had the worst attitude.
I politely asked if they do parking validation and he just snapped at me and gave me a very rude "NO" even before I could finish my sentence.
My husband went to pay the bill and a few minutes later, one server brought us the check
(that's how I found out they charged us for 2 bowls of rice instead of one).
I told the guy about it but we already paid and instead of issuing us a refund, he just changed the check and put it back at our table.
My husband said it's ok
and we're just gonna leave.
That's when the bad attitude staff pointed to us and told us the check is on the table, like as if we hadn't paid yet.
We told him the bill has been paid and he wasn't happy at all.
I'm from L.A.
and I've been to so many sushi places but never yet experience this kind of service and ill mannered attitude from servers or staff in a restaurant.
I will never go back to this restaurant nor recommend it to my friends.
rice.author: Evelyn C.
rice.review:
Food was so so. I would say maybe 2.5 stars. But service was just lousy. We were a big group of 11 and from the time we started placing our orders to the time we're almost done with our meal, the servers couldn't bring enough small plates coz they're out of it, and it took them so long to bring us a bowl of rice, which they ended up charging us 2 bowls instead, and most importantly, one of the staffs had the worst attitude. I politely asked if they do parking validation and he just snapped at me and gave me a very rude "NO" even before I could finish my sentence. My husband went to pay the bill and a few minutes later, one server brought us the check (that's how I found out they charged us for 2 bowls of rice instead of one). I told the guy about it but we already paid and instead of issuing us a refund, he just changed the check and put it back at our table. My husband said it's ok and we're just gonna leave. That's when the bad attitude staff pointed to us and told us the check is on the table, like as if we hadn't paid yet. We told him the bill has been paid and he wasn't happy at all. 
I'm from L.A. and I've been to so many sushi places but never yet experience this kind of service and ill mannered attitude from servers or staff in a restaurant. I will never go back to this restaurant nor recommend it to my friends.

excerpts: Negative: On our visit the staff wasn't firing on all cylinders; it was a *very* busy day during the 2017 holiday break, but ... they forgot an item, mistakenly delivered - and removed - two different bento boxes, some of the sashimi was still frozen, the rice was "al dente" and the beef was raw in the middle.
Perhaps this wasn't the regular staff?
rice.author: Mark W.
rice.review:
Positive: Excellent selection of specialty rolls.
Negative: On our visit the staff wasn't firing on all cylinders; it was a *very* busy day during the 2017 holiday break, but ... they forgot an item, mistakenly delivered - and removed - two different bento boxes, some of the sashimi was still frozen, the rice was "al dente" and the beef was raw in the middle. Perhaps this wasn't the regular staff?

excerpts: The nigiri rice was well cooked, just too much vinegar for my tastes.
I appreciate this as a lunch place.
Cheap sushi, but nothing impressive here.
3.5 is my official review.
rice.author: JWest M.
rice.review: Enjoyed my meal here. Sushi and sashimi serving and a y'all beer. The staff were all terrific. The fish just didn't have very much flavor. The nigiri rice was well cooked, just too much vinegar for my tastes. I appreciate this as a lunch place. Cheap sushi, but nothing impressive here. 3.5 is my official review.

excerpts: i was initial drawn to their wide selection of sushi rolls, which is terrific, but while it did come to the table quickly, the sushi rice has too much vinegar and overpowered the rolls.
plus, my gf's udon took a long time to come; although the sushi did come quick, we finished the sushi well before it arrived.
the service was not good; while the young female was working her tail off (as well as the sushi chefs), the middle-aged woman was a little rude.
with the wide selection of sushi restaurants so close by, i have other restaurants to try and doubt i'll return.
rice.author: Mike C.
rice.review: i've been wanting to try this place for awhile, and sadly, it was disappointing. i was initial drawn to their wide selection of sushi rolls, which is terrific, but while it did come to the table quickly, the sushi rice has too much vinegar and overpowered the rolls. plus, my gf's udon took a long time to come; although the sushi did come quick, we finished the sushi well before it arrived. the service was not good; while the young female was working her tail off (as well as the sushi chefs), the middle-aged woman was a little rude. with the wide selection of sushi restaurants so close by, i have other restaurants to try and doubt i'll return.

excerpts: The chicken teriyaki lunch bento came with miso soup, salad, chicken teriyaki, rice, one shrimp tempura, and a potato croquet.
The portion was small but it was enough to fill me up.
The sushi chef was very observant: I needed a napkin and was looking around on my table to find a clean one
rice.author: Angelyn S.
rice.review:
The $6.95 chicken teriyaki sign outside caught my eyes. 

Came here while I was waiting to get my visa from across the street. Food took awhile to come but it was good. The chicken teriyaki lunch bento came with miso soup, salad, chicken teriyaki, rice, one shrimp tempura, and a potato croquet. The portion was small but it was enough to fill me up. The sushi chef was very observant: I needed a napkin and was looking around on my table to find a clean one but he immediately noticed and called the server to hand me one.

Food is 3 stars but because of their attentiveness, they deserve 4 stars.

excerpts: The teriyaki chicken box with rice, salad, miso soup and an assortment of tempura was enough for my two kids to share.
rice.author: Francine B.
rice.review: Walked through Japan town and decided on this place out of a dozen and glad we did. Love places that give you complimentary miso and salad! The teriyaki chicken box with rice, salad, miso soup and an assortment of tempura was enough for my two kids to share.  We had the giant roll and a roll with scallops which were quite tasty. The oyster shooter was not very warm and did not have any spice to it like I prefer. The Portions were good size except the Pepperfin which came with only 4 pieces and was about $12. It also had some flakes on top I didn't like and not enough sauce. That being said I really enjoyed the rolls and the staff was very nice and attentive. They had over 70 rolls to choose from and some that were pretty unique. I would go back here again when visiting.

excerpts: The nigiri was great in that there was a high sashimi to rice ratio.
rice.author: Joshua M.
rice.review: I went to Kippu Japanese Cuisine on a Wednesday night to eat some good sushi. The service was great and friendly throughout the entire meal. I ordered their Daily Special A which comes with miso soup, salad, five pieces of nigiri, and california roll. The nigiri was great in that there was a high sashimi to rice ratio. The hamachi also tasted exceptionally well. For the affordable price, I enjoyed the meal very much with the wonderful hot tea as well.

excerpts: I got the veggie bento box, with my choice of 3 different vegetarian dishes plus green salad and rice.
It hit the spot!
rice.author: Aleta D.
rice.review: Polite, prompt service, good food. They gave me a free starter of some miso soup while I looked at the menu.  I got the veggie bento box, with my choice of 3 different vegetarian dishes plus green salad and rice. It hit the spot!

excerpts: The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).
It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.
rice.author: Leonard L.
rice.review:
Kippu Japanese
SF J-Town
3pm Thursday 16th April 2015
Three Stars

We had the dog so we couldn't eat inside so we ordered takeout.  I got the Number 9 Combination: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.  The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).    It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.  The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).  The steak was dry and lightly sauced. Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.

excerpts: The "bento" was veiled as a thinly sliced salmon patty with minimum rice, seaweed salad and iceberg lettuce (Forgot a picture).
With so many good Japanese restaurants in SF I hate to rip on local business but guys charge more and put more on the plate, your bento was pitiful.
rice.author: Justin F.
rice.review: I just really didn't like this place. The service was okay, but the salmon bento that they advertise for $10.50 should've been more like $4.50. The "bento" was veiled as a thinly sliced salmon patty with minimum rice, seaweed salad and iceberg lettuce (Forgot a picture). With so many good Japanese restaurants in SF I hate to rip on local business but guys charge more and put more on the plate, your bento was pitiful.

excerpts: My boyfriend's meal was HUGE: large servings of beef teriyaki, rice, and tempura for such a low price.
rice.author: Sam F.
rice.review:
A great place for lunch in Japantown.

We happened upon this place while wandering around, looking at various restaurants' menus. There was barely anyone around when we walked in, probably because we arrived around 11:30, but people began to trickle in slowly after we were seated. Our waiter was very attentive and brought us water and menus without us asking. I decided on the nabeyaki udon while my boyfriend ordered the beef teriyaki with mixed tempura bento box. 

My udon came with a side salad which was super yummy and had some awesome sesame dressing. The bento came with miso soup which my boyfriend drank in a hurry so I'm not sure how it tasted lol My nabeyaki udon was tasty, it was perfect because I was feeling a bit sick with a cold so the hot broth with the chewy noodles were great for my headache. They added fish cake, veggies and a shrimp tempura in there as well. My boyfriend's meal was HUGE: large servings of beef teriyaki, rice, and tempura for such a low price. Bento boxes are definitely a steal here!

The prices are super reasonable at Kippu and they have a great selection of items so I would recommend coming here for a yummy meal when you are in Japantown!

excerpts: It's just rice and meat!
rice.author: Gonzalo S.
rice.review:
Very underwhelming overall. 7 of us take a while looking through the menu and not once does the waitstaff inform us they are out of half the menu. As my friend said, how are you out of Donburi at a Japanese restaurant?? It's just rice and meat!

The nigiri was pretty ordinary although the bento boxes were pretty huge so there's that at least.

Another fiasco was splitting the check, they refused to spit the check and let us each add gratuity individually then brought back the check with gratuity added. Why not just add it to begin with? Not impressed.

excerpts: The portions for the entrees (w/ miso soup, salad, potato salad & rice) were reasonable.
Everything was tasty especially the chicken was tender and the tempura was very crunchy.
The only thing I would complain would be the exclusion of the lunch special on weekends.
Other than that my friends and I enjoyed this place and we would love to come back again.
rice.author: Gene A.
rice.review: My friends and I came here on a Saturday afternoon and our cravings for Japanese food were satisfied. The waiters were very welcoming and I'm impressed we got our food in less than ten minutes! The portions for the entrees (w/ miso soup, salad, potato salad & rice) were reasonable. Everything was tasty especially the chicken was tender and the tempura was very crunchy. The only thing I would complain would be the exclusion of the lunch special on weekends. Other than that my friends and I enjoyed this place and we would love to come back again.

excerpts: While the fish was fresh, the construction was sub-par - the fish kept separating from the rice.
rice.author: Elizabeth L.
rice.review:
3.5-star food
2.8-star service

FOOD

Nigiri
Ono (super white tuna) was fantastic - thrilled to find it here as many sushi bars often don't have ono. Also enjoyed the hirame (halibut), sake (salmon) and unagi (eel). While the fish was fresh, the construction was sub-par - the fish kept separating from the rice. 

Skip the uni and roe (term) - these were mediocre.

Starters
Seaweed salad was excellent -  not too salty/sweet
Kaki fried (oysters): panko-breaded, tasty and plump

SERVICE
Sushi chef was pleasant, but otherwise service was non-existent. Server didn't check on us until nearly the end of our meal, which almost seemed like an afterthought. 

Pricing is reasonable.

excerpts: Shrimp and Fried Potato cooked perfectly, rice dusted with black sesame seeds, and Teriyaki Sauce not to sweet.
Just what I needed and just what I wanted
and now I must return to try other specials on their menu.
Great location for "before a movie @ Kabuki" or "after a movie".
rice.author: Marla B.
rice.review: Killing time around Japantown and feeling a bit peckish... I came across this little gem.  Even though the lunch hour was "over", their "specials sign" drew me in.  Chicken Bento Box for $6.50... I was pleasantly greeted by the server.  The restaurant is small and tidy but immaculate.  Only one other diner when I arrived, but i did hear them "oohing and aahhing" over their meal.  I was immediately given water and Miso soup, which I love.  The server explained the difference between the $6.50 BB special and the regular $8.50 BB, I went with the special and was very pleased.  Food was "Hot" and "Plentiful".  Great flavors.  Salad dressing is the Chef's Secret which I could not get out of my server, but I can say "I wanted the recipe". Shrimp and Fried Potato cooked perfectly, rice dusted with black sesame seeds, and Teriyaki Sauce not to sweet.  Just what I needed and just what I wanted and now I must return to try other specials on their menu. Great location for "before a movie @ Kabuki" or "after a movie".

excerpts: The water content from the eggs and onions leaked and made my rice soggy.
The flavor was alright, but nothing spectacular.
The saving grace was the cheap drink prices.
rice.author: Josh S.
rice.review: When I moved to SF (from LA) I thought the J-Town here would kick LA's Little Tokyo's butt!  Sadly, I was mistaken and left to choose from a sea of restaurants with mostly 3 star ratings.  I ordered the katsudon which was dried out and chewy. The water content from the eggs and onions leaked and made my rice soggy.  The flavor was alright, but nothing spectacular.  The saving grace was the cheap drink prices.  Although, the sake was kind of weak in flavor. Given some of the other options in J-Town, I think I'd come back for some cheap sake bombs and light snacks, but that's it.

excerpts: Come before 3pm and after 6pm I think the sushi chef is on break in between I came at 4pm and child the rice was loose like a goose....
not fr 40 bucks not at all....
but lunch is really good and the bento boxes are pretty tasty too.
rice.author: Joi M.
rice.review:
Pretty god sushi really smooth taste, the spicy tuna and lower priced rolls are really cheap so stick with the higher rolls. They have some funky names and trendy stuff. For me I know what I want so just read what it is before you dive in. 

Come before 3pm and after 6pm I think the sushi chef is on break in between I came at 4pm and child the rice was loose like a goose....not fr 40 bucks not at all....but lunch is really good and the bento boxes are pretty tasty too.

excerpts: Now, I'd say this could be my new go-to destination if I crave for ordering sashimi combo in Japantown (versus regular sushi over rice for which I will still go to Isobune).
Their sashimi combo plate was good for the price, and the fish was quite good in taste and quality in my opinion.
Also, this is the one place I'm aware of in Japantown that serves a plate of raw oyster with the ponzu sauce that I enjoy, at the price of four pieces for $6.99 as i recall.
rice.author: H K.
rice.review:
This place seemed to have changed hands at least twice in recent years. Now, I'd say this could be my new go-to destination if I crave for ordering sashimi combo in Japantown (versus regular sushi over rice for which I will still go to Isobune). Their sashimi combo plate was good for the price, and the fish was quite good in taste and quality in my opinion. Also, this is the one place I'm aware of in Japantown that serves a plate of raw oyster with the ponzu sauce that I enjoy, at the price of four pieces for $6.99 as i recall. It's about higher than, say, some restaurants in the Sunset but still price is satisfactory for fulfilling the crave for oysters.

Service is overall good. They show signs of potentially being disorganized when busy. For example, the waitress forgot to bring me a new napkin after promising to do so after seeing mine fell on the floor. No big deal. In fact, I'd say I like admiring one of the ladies to me was cute, the one that's more petite that was working there this past Monday night when I ate there. ;)

excerpts: Sushi rice had excellent flavor (rice wine vinegar) and temperature.
rice.author: Jeanne L.
rice.review:
Terrible service. I had to ask for a menu several times. I ended up getting up to look around the cashier's desk for menus, but apparently they had run out of menus.  Later on, I definitely kept getting attitude from one of the waitresses. Lots of curt responses. I almost felt like I was being scolded. Maybe it is an accent thing.

I ordered the Chirashi, which wasn't that fresh, but it did have very generous large cuts of fish.  (They chose quantity over quality.)  Sushi rice had excellent flavor (rice wine vinegar) and temperature.

excerpts:
I ordered Bento box with Tempura which very good and not too oily, it came with miso, salad and avocado maki, inarizushi and rice, it was huge! 
My date got the pork bone ramen (i think thats what it was called)  and liked the broth very much but thought it could have had more veggies and meat, it came with salad and miso. 
For drinks we Kirin and Sapporo beer.
It was about $27 for the two of us including tip and drinks.
rice.author: Diana C.
rice.review:
I really liked this restaurant! It was small and cozy, although it was a little too busy at the time we went, (we got there during the dinner rush hour.) The wait staff were quick and friendly but it did seem like they *almost* couldn't keep up with the tables, almost. I think it would have been perfect had we gone at a less busy time.
I ordered Bento box with Tempura which very good and not too oily, it came with miso, salad and avocado maki, inarizushi and rice, it was huge! 
My date got the pork bone ramen (i think thats what it was called)  and liked the broth very much but thought it could have had more veggies and meat, it came with salad and miso. 
For drinks we Kirin and Sapporo beer.
It was about $27 for the two of us including tip and drinks.

excerpts: In any case, I have to say their lunch special is a great deal - about $7 for miso soup plus a bento box filled with two entrees, salad, and rice.
rice.author: Can C.
rice.review:
I'd say it's more of a 3.5, but it may partially be due to the fact that it's quite convenient for us.  In any case, I have to say their lunch special is a great deal - about $7 for miso soup plus a bento box filled with two entrees, salad, and rice.  I've tried both the salmon and the beef teriyaki, all of which have been pretty tasty.  I'm also a fan of the tempura.  So definitely most of the stars are for this lunch special.  As for their sushi, it's not too bad.  Just don't let the pictures fool you; I once made that mistake and was disappointed with the portion size (it looked a lot more generous in the menu).

If it weren't so convenient, I would likely not go out of my way to eat here.  But still a great lunch deal!

excerpts: Standard mix and match basics with soup, salad and rice.
rice.author: Steph T.
rice.review:
Lunch deals are amazing here.  For two, the bill came out to just over 15.  Standard mix and match basics with soup, salad and rice.  I had sashimi and california roll; my dining partner went with the california roll and tempura.  Simple, yet good - and excellent for the price!

Tuna sashimi was very fresh and sliced into three decent pieces.  California roll was typical, made with imitation crab.  Miso soup was also the common soup that you find at restaurants in this price range, but I did find more than few, small pieces of tofu!  Even the green tea was pretty good, although I did spill it all over the place because of the chewed-up plastic covered teapot spout.  Careful. 

I didn't attempt any of the rolls, but would definitely find my way back for a nice lunch under 10 dollars when I'm around Japantown.  That said, this is definitely not worth the trek or parking charges for a cheap lunch, unless you are already in the area.

excerpts: Nothing special, though I felt it was a bit interesting, given that the beef/egg and added vegetables were about 50/50 with the rice, something I was not expecting or used to.
rice.author: Rina R.
rice.review:
I went into Kippu having read the Yelp reviews, so I knew the meals could be a bit hit-and-miss. I feel (though I have not checked for myself) that their sushi and bentos would be good, but I decided to order the beef donburi, edamame, yakitori, and tempura ice cream. As a (half) Japanese-American who has visited Japan throughout her life, I would say the beef donburi was OK. Nothing special, though I felt it was a bit interesting, given that the beef/egg and added vegetables were about 50/50 with the rice, something I was not expecting or used to. The edamame was not well mixed with the salt, but it was good. The yakitori was good, no complaints there. The best part, and most redeeming quality of the meal was the tempura ice cream. It was a unique dessert, and I was pleasantly surprised.

I would go to Kippu again just for the desserts, and I look forward to trying a bento and some sushi there in the future.

excerpts: It tasted like charred salty sticky rice.
rice.author: Mac P.
rice.review:
I've never ordered bad food that I refuse to eat before until now. Wow!!!
Flaming dragon was flaming in all the bad ways possible. It tasted like charred salty sticky rice.
Soft shell crab was good after I pealed off the batter that was the thickness of an orange peal.
Lobster roll was decent, but the number of rolls in the picture did not depict reality.
The fried oyster also had that charred aroma lathered in the brown dipping sauce that prevented me from finishing the single piece on my plate. I have lost the battle of "Man Vs Food" and cannot raise my head high any longer.
Should have ordered a bento box.
And "yes"; the service was sssllloooooooowwww...
Two stars because I didn't throw up.

excerpts: I ordered a soda, brown rice (which they ended up being out of), and some BBQ albacore to get me through to dinner, and it was mission accomplished!
However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore...
I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor.
The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own.
The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up.
The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen!
I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!
However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore...
I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor.
The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own.
The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up.
The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen!
I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!
rice.author: Danielle S.
rice.review: While shopping through japantown I needed a quick between lunch and dinner snack. Since it was an awkward time most of the places nearby were closed with the exception of Kippu. I ordered a soda, brown rice (which they ended up being out of), and some BBQ albacore to get me through to dinner, and it was mission accomplished! However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore... I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor. The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own. The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up. The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen! I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!

excerpts:
- Chicken teriyaki was meh, rice stale.
- Gyoza was not fresh and not good.
rice.author: Jonathan P.
rice.review:
Food was not good, service was not good.

- Tonkotsu ramen was pretty bad with terrible overcooked noodles and tough meat.
- Octopus sunomono was foul.
- Chicken teriyaki was meh, rice stale.
- Gyoza was not fresh and not good.
- Edamame was not fresh and not good.
- Service was slow and poor, one item never came.

Maybe a bad day?

excerpts: sushi rolls are good in tinier size with softly cooked rice.
rice.author: Chiemi K.
