rice.review: we enjoyed veggie lunch twice, both experience were very good. tempura and coroque are crispy, yet very fluffy yum stuff inside. sushi rolls are good in tinier size with softly cooked rice. we liked the miso soup and even salad with yum dressing. only, the size of the portion is really big. it's like 130 percent of american size, if compared with a sort of standard japanese restaurant lunch size, it can be twice more. i usually dont waste food, but i can't finish.

excerpts: The rice was a little rough and didn't taste fresh.
The katsu seemed over cooked and had been sitting out for a while.
The food was mediocre and their prices do not correspond to their level of precision they put into their sushi.
To be very blunt, this sushi was one of the worst yet.
And I would not come back unless their sushi has risen to the prices they charge here.
rice.author: Michelle T.
rice.review:
After roaming around SF, my friends and I wanted some sushi so we decided to go eat somewhere around Japan Town. After walking around for a while, we went to Kippu because we saw their wide variety of sushi rolls. The waiter and chefs greeted us upon our entrance and received a complimentary miso soup right after we got our table. 
The miso soup was average, can't go wrong with that. We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl. 
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush. The rice was a little rough and didn't taste fresh. The katsu seemed over cooked and had been sitting out for a while. The food was mediocre and their prices do not correspond to their level of precision they put into their sushi. To be very blunt, this sushi was one of the worst yet. And I would not come back unless their sushi has risen to the prices they charge here.

excerpts: even the rice on the rolls looked barren.
rice.author: Ben L.
rice.review:
This is the restaurant that made me decide to start a Yelp account.  My goal of this review is for anyone that works there to never provide this kind of experience to other customers.

1. Took close to 20 minutes to get any attention from the two waitresses to take our order. Obviously, this is not the first time anyone has experienced this, but for a restaurant that is less than 300 sq ft it was not acceptable.  I was also ignored twice with clear visual eye contact.  Two other parties had their order taken before mine was; I had a party of 2, the others were of 2 and 4.  

2. After they took my order of 4 dishes - Post Roll, Washington Roll, Unagi Lover, and Ahi Tuna - we waited about 5 minutes for the miso soup which was not an issue.  However, after 30 minutes, the same waitress comes up to ask if we have ordered yet - she was ruffling through her pad to look for my order.  She ends up going back to the cashier to find my order which at that point she tells me it will take 5 minutes to come out.  

3. She tried to compensate by providing edamame which was a nice gesture, however, the edamame was clearly old and had been sitting out in the open for a while.  It was sour (which it should never be), and much too soft like an old banana.  There was no way this can be OK to serve.  

4. The orders started to come in about 5-10 more minutes, all of which was significantly smaller than the picture.  Yes, it will never look identical to the picture, but it just looked like they didn't have enough ingredients to even complete the dish - even the rice on the rolls looked barren.  

I ended up paying about 65 dollars for this meal and it will be the last that I will ever spend there.  My girlfriend and I left hungry and totally dissatisfied with the food and service.  I've had bad restaurant experiences before and I do not have exuberant expectations, but from a customer service / technical support managerial background, this was unacceptable and needs to be improved on all ends.  Even if the quality of the food does not improve, I would continue to visit only if the service was there.  

If you get the chance to visit this restaurant, I recommend that you think twice about it before spending your hard earned cash.

excerpts: I decided on three smaller items off their menu, but to my pleasant surprise, they generously served me a miso soup and salad anyway
(photo: http://bit.ly/2z8G2xR).
miso soup.author: Ed U.
miso soup.review:
I've sat in front of this inconspicuous Japanese restaurant several times whenever I took a seat on one of the worn benches on the cobblestoned Buchanan Street plaza. I decided to give it a try one evening as I was leisurely strolling through Japantown and found it about half full of customers. I didn't have high expectations about the quality based on some of the Yelp feedback I read, and frankly that preconception helped me get through my meal without incident.

I decided on three smaller items off their menu, but to my pleasant surprise, they generously served me a miso soup and salad anyway (photo: http://bit.ly/2z8G2xR). My first item was the $8.50 Chicken Yakitori because I felt like having a couple of skewers of poultry (photo: http://bit.ly/2Kx8QVW). The meat alternated with scallions and red pepper, but the flavor was compromised by the gooey marinade. Better was the $12.50 Hamachi Kama which was yellowtail collar simply grilled with the skin left intact (photo: http://bit.ly/2KDjNVv).

The simpler, the better. That's why the kama worked for me, but sometimes simple is just too simple. That was the mistake I made with my third choice, the appropriately priced $5 Avocado Roll which was just that, avocado rolled in rice and nori (photo: http://bit.ly/2KN9afH). There wasn't enough flavor to make it interesting. I didn't find anything offensive about Kippu, it just felt interchangeable with any number of J-Town eateries offering the exact same dishes. Maybe that's good enough sometimes.

FOOD - 3 stars...middling Japanese fare with the kama the best of the plates I had
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...pretty standard decor for J-Town
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...a bit on the slow side
TOTAL - 3 stars...kinda nondescript for my taste

excerpts: Bentos come with rice, salad, and miso soup.
One of our soups had a little bug/fly in it.
Told the waitress and she replaced it, but who knows what she did with it.
Their salad dressing is the best!
miso soup.author: Tammy P.
miso soup.review:
My go-to place for bento boxes in SF!

1. Prices for the lunch bentos are the best value.
2. We recently went for dinner. Bf ordered chicken teriyaki bento and I ordered vegetarian 3 item bento with age-dashi tofu, veggie tempura, and avocado roll. Paid $35 after tip.
3. Bentos come with rice, salad, and miso soup.
4. One of our soups had a little bug/fly in it. Told the waitress and she replaced it, but who knows what she did with it.
5. Their salad dressing is the best!

excerpts: This is the only location that gives you complimentary miso soup & salad with your entree in comparison to the other sushi spots located in Japan Town.
Prices are super reasonable & service is absolutely excellent!
My grandma kinda VIP over here
(she's here all the time lol)  too
so we always get great service here & their food is soo good.
miso soup.author: Lisa S.
miso soup.review: Pages of rolls to choose from with your regular added Japanese food selections as well. This is the only location that gives you complimentary miso soup & salad with your entree in comparison to the other sushi spots located in Japan Town. Prices are super reasonable & service is absolutely excellent! My grandma kinda VIP over here (she's here all the time lol)  too so we always get great service here & their food is soo good.

excerpts:
Pros:
- complimentary starter Miso Soup
- open on Christmas Day
- complimentary starter salad to share
- reasonable prices

Cons:
- our waters were never refilled 
- the starter salads are apparently to share..?
So for the 4 of us they only brought out 2 small salad bowls.
I was coming down with a cold so my family didn't want to share a bowl with me and risk getting sick, so

I didn't get any salad :( 
- kind of small portion sizes
- veggie spring rolls were pretty bland and unauthentic
miso soup.author: Birgen D.
miso soup.review:
Pros:
- complimentary starter Miso Soup
- open on Christmas Day
- complimentary starter salad to share
- reasonable prices

Cons:
- our waters were never refilled 
- the starter salads are apparently to share..? So for the 4 of us they only brought out 2 small salad bowls. I was coming down with a cold so my family didn't want to share a bowl with me and risk getting sick, so I didn't get any salad :( 
- kind of small portion sizes
- veggie spring rolls were pretty bland and unauthentic

Overall this place was pretty average. I didn't dislike any of it and considering it was one of the only places I could find that was open on Christmas, it was perfectly fine. However I do wish I could have gotten a water refill and maybe the salads could be individual rather than shared.

excerpts:
Miso Soup
8.
miso soup.author: Wolf B.
miso soup.review:
Never had a single issue, I've come here a dozen times and the sushi is always cold, I love the service and how everyone is so polite, KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK!!! :D I will support you guys full on.

~List of dishes I've tried~
1. Four Seasons Roll
2. Seaweed Salad
3. Vegetable Tempura/Shrimp Tempura
4. Love Roll
5. Avocado Roll
6. Hamachi Lover Roll
7. Miso Soup
8. Cherry Blossom Roll/Orange Blossom Roll

All Perfection! :)

excerpts: Miso soup was hot and lots of tofu.
Hubby ordered poke bowl
and I had shrimp & vegetables tempura.
Both meals look very appetizing when placed in front of us.
The taste was average.
miso soup.author: Rika W.
miso soup.review:
Small Japanese restaurant in Japantown. Miso soup was hot and lots of tofu. Hubby ordered poke bowl and I had shrimp & vegetables tempura. Both meals look very appetizing when placed in front of us. The taste was average. I was a little disappointed with my tempura because there was so much batter that I had to pick some of it off before eating. 

I guess I had higher expectations for a Japanese restaurant in Japantown... not terrible, however, not fantastic either. Just OK.

excerpts: The chicken teriyaki lunch bento came with miso soup, salad, chicken teriyaki, rice, one shrimp tempura, and a potato croquet.
The portion was small but it was enough to fill me up.
The sushi chef was very observant: I needed a napkin and was looking around on my table to find a clean one
miso soup.author: Angelyn S.
miso soup.review:
The $6.95 chicken teriyaki sign outside caught my eyes. 

Came here while I was waiting to get my visa from across the street. Food took awhile to come but it was good. The chicken teriyaki lunch bento came with miso soup, salad, chicken teriyaki, rice, one shrimp tempura, and a potato croquet. The portion was small but it was enough to fill me up. The sushi chef was very observant: I needed a napkin and was looking around on my table to find a clean one but he immediately noticed and called the server to hand me one.

Food is 3 stars but because of their attentiveness, they deserve 4 stars.

excerpts: The teriyaki chicken box with rice, salad, miso soup and an assortment of tempura was enough for my two kids to share.
miso soup.author: Francine B.
miso soup.review: Walked through Japan town and decided on this place out of a dozen and glad we did. Love places that give you complimentary miso and salad! The teriyaki chicken box with rice, salad, miso soup and an assortment of tempura was enough for my two kids to share.  We had the giant roll and a roll with scallops which were quite tasty. The oyster shooter was not very warm and did not have any spice to it like I prefer. The Portions were good size except the Pepperfin which came with only 4 pieces and was about $12. It also had some flakes on top I didn't like and not enough sauce. That being said I really enjoyed the rolls and the staff was very nice and attentive. They had over 70 rolls to choose from and some that were pretty unique. I would go back here again when visiting.

excerpts: I ordered their Daily Special A which comes with miso soup, salad, five pieces of nigiri, and california roll.
miso soup.author: Joshua M.
miso soup.review: I went to Kippu Japanese Cuisine on a Wednesday night to eat some good sushi. The service was great and friendly throughout the entire meal. I ordered their Daily Special A which comes with miso soup, salad, five pieces of nigiri, and california roll. The nigiri was great in that there was a high sashimi to rice ratio. The hamachi also tasted exceptionally well. For the affordable price, I enjoyed the meal very much with the wonderful hot tea as well.

excerpts: These were reasonably priced , but they never brought either of us miso soup.
My Bento Box came with 3 pieces of sashimi.
The sashimi was dangerous looking.
It was warm, slimey, smelled and was,falling apart.
I tested a small bit and decided it was unsafe to eat.
No one asked us how our meal was or checked in on us.
Wish I had checked yelp reviews before going.
The owner, or manager was nice, but was not a great experience in food or service.
2 stars because the teriyaki chicken and tempura were decent.
Rest of the meal was unpleasant.
miso soup.author: Oliver B.
miso soup.review: We stopped here on our visit to SF. Went to Japan Town. Was moderately busy. We aat down before looking at reviews. Service was poor. No one said hello to us for 5 minutes. We then got promptly seated. I ordered a hot tea which was good, but never got refilled and was probably a 3oz cup. Both my wife and I got Bento Boxes. These were reasonably priced , but they never brought either of us miso soup. My Bento Box came with 3 pieces of sashimi. The sashimi was dangerous looking. It was warm, slimey, smelled and was,falling apart. I tested a small bit and decided it was unsafe to eat. No one asked us how our meal was or checked in on us. Wish I had checked yelp reviews before going. The owner, or manager was nice, but was not a great experience in food or service. 2 stars because the teriyaki chicken and tempura were decent. Rest of the meal was unpleasant.

excerpts: They didnt bring us the miso soup because they were still cooking,  which is fine.
However,  they delivered to other tables miso soup first while we have been waiting for 10 mins.
miso soup.author: Yilam M.
miso soup.review: Horrible customer service.  They forgot one of the five orders.  They didnt bring us the miso soup because they were still cooking,  which is fine.  However,  they delivered to other tables miso soup first while we have been waiting for 10 mins.

excerpts: They offer a complimentary miso soup and salad to start your meal.
Don't go looking for a spoon either, we eat our soup
just like they do in Japan haha.
miso soup.author: Brittany W.
miso soup.review:
When I heard that they have a Japantown in the city I had to get me some sushi!  My friend brought me here and the food wasn't that bad.  I got the usual, California roll and pretty much another California roll with salmon and yellow tail on top.  They offer a complimentary miso soup and salad to start your meal.  Don't go looking for a spoon either, we eat our soup just like they do in Japan haha.  Drink up!

The food is where the authentic culture ends.  The music selection was great but very American.  They did offer a lot is specialty rolls, my friend got their fried golden gate roll. It looked delicious!

excerpts: My food was okay; I ordered the vegetarian bento box, which came with inari, vegetable tempura, miso soup, salad, and karrokes.
The quantity of food I received for the price (around $13) was pretty good, and overall I enjoyed my dinner, with the exception of the inari tofu.
It was soggy, hardly breaded and fried at all, and just tasted bad.
miso soup.author: Molly I.
miso soup.review:
My boyfriend and I had dinner here last week. While the food was acceptable, the service was not. Our waitress was not very friendly, and seemed as if she wanted to be anywhere but there. We had to ask her for water, which is understandable given California's drought. However, what was not understandable or acceptable was why she gave us half-full glasses of tap water, while the tables near us had full glasses of water with ice cubes. The waitress did not offer to refill our glasses once we finished the half-full water glasses, so we kept having to repeatedly ask her for more water (which we received in a slow manner). My food was okay; I ordered the vegetarian bento box, which came with inari, vegetable tempura, miso soup, salad, and karrokes. The quantity of food I received for the price (around $13) was pretty good, and overall I enjoyed my dinner, with the exception of the inari tofu. It was soggy, hardly breaded and fried at all, and just tasted bad. My boyfriend ordered the dinner bento box special, and the California roll portion of his meal literally came with two pieces. Finally, after sitting and waiting for our check for about 10 minutes after our plates had been cleared, we had to ask the waitress to please bring us our check, which took several more minutes. When she finally arrived at our table, she brought us someone else's check, so we had to go up to the front counter and ask for our proper check. 
We wanted to try a new restaurant in Japantown that we hadn't been to yet, so we chose this one. Next time, we'll be going somewhere where we know we will receive good food AND good service.

excerpts: They gave me a free starter of some miso soup while I looked at the menu.
miso soup.author: Aleta D.
miso soup.review: Polite, prompt service, good food. They gave me a free starter of some miso soup while I looked at the menu.  I got the veggie bento box, with my choice of 3 different vegetarian dishes plus green salad and rice. It hit the spot!

excerpts: Meals come with miso soup (this was kind of bland...) and a side salad with sesame dressing (dressing is good).

I'll admit the food in general had pretty good seasoning and flavor (however the seafood tasted slightly fishy, meaning it wasn't super fresh), but I was just a little upset that the portions of the rolls were smaller than advertised.
miso soup.author: Matthew L.
miso soup.review:
Looks can be deceiving is a common saying that usually describes people, but in this case describes Kippu. A few days ago, my friend and I were hungry and were craving sushi rolls. And since we were in Japantown, we popped by here and saw what looked mighty big sushi rolls as displayed by the pictures in the window. But in actuality the sushi rolls were pretty tiny - definitely not as big as how they were advertised on the window pictures! How disappointing. 

We ordered the Java roll, Dragon Roll and the Incredible roll... As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream. Meals come with miso soup (this was kind of bland...) and a side salad with sesame dressing (dressing is good).  I'll admit the food in general had pretty good seasoning and flavor (however the seafood tasted slightly fishy, meaning it wasn't super fresh), but I was just a little upset that the portions of the rolls were smaller than advertised.  Each roll came with 8 small sushi pieces, kind of a lot of dough given the high $11-$13/roll price tag.  OK, $11-$13/roll is pretty standard at most Japanese joints, but usually sushi rolls come with 10-12 pieces, not a measly 8. Meh, whatever.

Don't come here hungry and with very little money because you won't get full unless you order a lot.

excerpts: The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).
It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.
miso soup.author: Leonard L.
miso soup.review:
Kippu Japanese
SF J-Town
3pm Thursday 16th April 2015
Three Stars

We had the dog so we couldn't eat inside so we ordered takeout.  I got the Number 9 Combination: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.  The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).    It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.  The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).  The steak was dry and lightly sauced. Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.

excerpts:
the waitstaff was very attentive in getting our orders, refilling our waters, and bringing us the food on time

Food: They bring you complimentary miso soup as soon as you sit down, and then house salad once you order your sushi!
miso soup.author: Jenna G.
miso soup.review:
Great inexpensive sushi restaurant. I went here with my parents and we got 5 rolls for 3 people (I could have been fine with 4 but my dad wanted another). We went at 5pm on a Sunday (Fathers Day) and it was pretty empty and we got great service.

Atmosphere: right in japantown, very authentic. the waitstaff was very attentive in getting our orders, refilling our waters, and bringing us the food on time

Food: They bring you complimentary miso soup as soon as you sit down, and then house salad once you order your sushi! It was so great!! For our rolls, we got the carmen, delicious, double salmon, (another one I forgot) and then the flaming dragon. The fish was very fresh, and the only roll we didn't really like was the Flaming Dragon. It's apparently one of the most popular rolls, but I think that's only because it comes out in flames. The flames cook the fish, which makes it weird and not that good.

Overall: I would definitely come here again. I would love to try the bay scallop and lion king rolls (their other two most popular rolls).

excerpts: I really really like how they give free miso soup and a salad in the beginning too.
Its like a full course meal.
miso soup.author: Pu B.
miso soup.review: When i walked into the restaurant i was wondering why it was so hot in there. We just ate some burgers so we were already full but we took a stroll through japan town and we stumbled upon this restaurant and my girlfriend and i will never ever say no to some sushi! I really really like how they give free miso soup and a salad in the beginning too. Its like a full course meal. We ended up eating just two rolls the Washington and the mountain roll... They were just alright they left the seeds in the lemon toppings. Their service was really quick! Thumbs up

excerpts: The miso soup is really, really salty here, and I say that as someone who always finishes her complimentary miso soup.
miso soup.author: Joy G.
miso soup.review:
The sushi menu is basically a Willy Wonka wonderland for anyone who is sick of the basic California roll - if you're at all an indecisive freak like me, you will change your mind at least five times before the waitress comes to take your order and then change your mind while you are ordering. I ended up getting the double salmon roll because mercury tastes delicious, and a vegetarian bento box on the side because vegetables and fibrous materials. The miso soup is really, really salty here, and I say that as someone who always finishes her complimentary miso soup. 

We decided to be annoying and asked for a seat in the back with the comfy lounge cushions instead of the rickety wooden chairs in the front. The waitress shook her head, saying that the back tables were only for parties of 10. It was 2 o'clock on a Wednesday. A party of 10 is not going to come strolling in and demand to be crammed around two tiny tables. I said so more or less, and she signed through her nose and said, sure, but only if we agree to move if a party of 10 comes in. It felt a little bizarre playing this passive-agro tug of war over a hypothetical party of 10 stragglers, but she lit up when we ordered 5 rolls and a ton of bento boxes. 

Two stars for delicious agedashi tofu. Yes, there is this layer of brown, umami goo caking the tofu. Yes, I was eyeing my friend's nabeyaki udon a bit wistfully. Yes, I ate too much and then had to wander through the mall in the Peace Plaza across the street arguing with myself (possibly aloud) if physical agony was worth green tea soft serve or a banana and nutella crepe. Thanks for having me, Japantown!

excerpts: The miso soup smelled like one thing and one thing only: when I was little, I had a He-Man playset of a claw trap to catch foes and punish them with green slime pouring overhead - THAT.
I didn't have to nasally investigate or reminisce either.
The split-second the soup bowl hit the table, that smell came all the way back from the 80s
right then and there.
After deliberation, I eventually took a reluctant benefit-of-the-doubt sip.
miso soup.author: Dan B.
miso soup.review:
Walk over to Daiso and get a $1.50 Asian cowboy hat. Now you're ready to eat at Kippu, with its country-western music that enveloped the first 10-15 minutes of my visit before 180'ing to Kpop.

The miso soup smelled like one thing and one thing only: when I was little, I had a He-Man playset of a claw trap to catch foes and punish them with green slime pouring overhead - THAT. I didn't have to nasally investigate or reminisce either. The split-second the soup bowl hit the table, that smell came all the way back from the 80s right then and there. After deliberation, I eventually took a reluctant benefit-of-the-doubt sip. I shouldn't have.

Take time to pore over the creative and often lawsuit-inviting names of all the sushi rolls. "Chuck Noris" [sic], "Finding Nemo", "Forrest Gump", "Monkey Brain", and maaaany more await you. There's even "Victoria's Secret". But in that case, where's "Agent Provocateur"? Or straight-up "Costco" (you know who you are).

Also, get the frequent flyer miles card. Once you & your new hat have $dined$ here 10 times, you get $10 off your next meal. You'll need it if your portions are like what I got for what I paid.

I'm going with just under 3 stars.

FYI: There are beer & sake bottles on display, but this place is so new that it currently has *no alcohol license*. Don't plan to take your 21st birthday entourage here just yet. (But when you do, text me.)

excerpts: The bento came with miso soup which my boyfriend drank in a hurry
so I'm not sure how it tasted
lol
miso soup.author: Sam F.
miso soup.review:
A great place for lunch in Japantown.

We happened upon this place while wandering around, looking at various restaurants' menus. There was barely anyone around when we walked in, probably because we arrived around 11:30, but people began to trickle in slowly after we were seated. Our waiter was very attentive and brought us water and menus without us asking. I decided on the nabeyaki udon while my boyfriend ordered the beef teriyaki with mixed tempura bento box. 

My udon came with a side salad which was super yummy and had some awesome sesame dressing. The bento came with miso soup which my boyfriend drank in a hurry so I'm not sure how it tasted lol My nabeyaki udon was tasty, it was perfect because I was feeling a bit sick with a cold so the hot broth with the chewy noodles were great for my headache. They added fish cake, veggies and a shrimp tempura in there as well. My boyfriend's meal was HUGE: large servings of beef teriyaki, rice, and tempura for such a low price. Bento boxes are definitely a steal here!

The prices are super reasonable at Kippu and they have a great selection of items so I would recommend coming here for a yummy meal when you are in Japantown!

excerpts: Drinks came very quickly when ordered, and once we ordered, miso soup followed immediately and the food came quickly soon after.
The food was FABULOUS!
Most of us ordered sushi rolls of different types, including two of the famous flaming dragon rolls (which truly were as delicious as they were exciting!).
miso soup.author: Chantal F.
miso soup.review:
Had a great meal with a group of nine that included five children.  We were attended to quickly and with a smile.  Drinks came very quickly when ordered, and once we ordered, miso soup followed immediately and the food came quickly soon after.
The food was FABULOUS!  Most of us ordered sushi rolls of different types, including two of the famous flaming dragon rolls (which truly were as delicious as they were exciting!).  Two in our party got dinner bento boxes which were extremely generous in portion size.

We'd highly recommend this small unassuming restaurant in Japantown!
--Girl Scout Troop 111, in town for the Golden Gate bridging ceremony during the first weekend of May.

excerpts: The waitress failed toe toon that everything comes with miso soup and salad.
miso soup.author: Kiki I.
miso soup.review:
I had an awful experience here with my friend.  The food literally made me sick.

My friend I arrived at 9:20pm, which seemed like plenty of time given that the restaurant allegedly closes at 10:00pm.  With in two seconds of seating we were told to order within the next five minutes because the kitchen was closing.  Ok.  A minute later the waitress was back demanding our order.  It is a large menu and we did not even have time to read it.

Then we ordered.  The waitress talked my friend into ordering two rolls that basically were fried California rolls.  I had not even read half the menu, so I asked the waitress for a recommendation.  At her suggestion, I ordered one roll, something with spicy tuna.  And, of course the waitress pushed me to order more.  Based upon the photos and high price, I thought one roll was sufficient.  But, the waitress insisted otherwise and further pressured that the kitchen was now closed -- it was only 9:22pm.  So, I also ordered a spicy tuna hand roll and croquets. 

Well they must have had items pre-made because the next thing we knew they were throwing food on the table and taking it away faster than we could eat it.  The waitress failed toe toon that everything comes with miso soup and salad.  When they both unexpectedly arrived, we officially knew we were swindled into ordering too much food.  

The spicy tuna hand roll was nothing to write home about and a bit fishy.  The moment I took the last bite the waitress, knowing I had another roll coming, swiped my plate, ginger, wasabi, and soy sauce.  Then set down the croquets which were average.  As soon as the croquets cooled they were disgusting and they got cold fast.  

Then the rolls came.  My friend's rolls were average fried and expensive California rolls that were made with fake crab at real crab prices.  She was upset because the waitress clearly pushed her to over order as well and the once the rolls cooled off they were gross.  Again, my roll had fake crab and spicy tuna. It tasted worse than a cheap roll from the grocery store and cost $16.  It was not fresh or worth the price charged.  In fact, I asked for a beer to wash it down and didn't finish it.

The service was so rude.  They started putting chairs up on tables around us at 9:30pm.  This is inappropriate because the restaurant is open until 10:00pm and, more importantly, there were guests still waiting for food.  We left well before 10:00pm and the lights were off and the staff was walking out too -- seriously change your hours to reflect the restaurants actual closing time.   If the rushed service, bad service, and fact that the restaurant closed before completing its food service wasn't bad enough, our waitress was not friendly and purposely oversold us on food.  Maybe that works with tourists, but we live here and expect a more honest approach.

To make matters worse, by the time I got home, I was violently ill.  I think it was the fishy tuna.  Let's just say it was a long and unpleasant night of my body physically ejecting what I ate there.  Miserable.  I think it had to be the fishy tuna because my friend did not feel well, but was not violently ill.

Maybe it was an off night for this place, but either way they got me really sick and that is really not ok.

excerpts: We also received complimentary miso soup and salad, which was nice and tasty as well.
Would definitely recommend Kippu if you are in Japantown.
miso soup.author: Shee X.
miso soup.review: Sushi was delicious, flavorful, and fresh! We ordered the Flaming Dragon Roll ($15) and the Mountain Roll ($11). We also received complimentary miso soup and salad, which was nice and tasty as well. Would definitely recommend Kippu if you are in Japantown.

excerpts: The portions for the entrees (w/ miso soup, salad, potato salad & rice) were reasonable.
Everything was tasty especially the chicken was tender and the tempura was very crunchy.
The only thing I would complain would be the exclusion of the lunch special on weekends.
Other than that my friends and I enjoyed this place and we would love to come back again.
miso soup.author: Gene A.
miso soup.review: My friends and I came here on a Saturday afternoon and our cravings for Japanese food were satisfied. The waiters were very welcoming and I'm impressed we got our food in less than ten minutes! The portions for the entrees (w/ miso soup, salad, potato salad & rice) were reasonable. Everything was tasty especially the chicken was tender and the tempura was very crunchy. The only thing I would complain would be the exclusion of the lunch special on weekends. Other than that my friends and I enjoyed this place and we would love to come back again.

excerpts: I was immediately given water and Miso soup, which I love.
The server explained the difference between the $6.50 BB special and the regular $8.50 BB, I went with the special and was very pleased.
Food was "Hot" and "Plentiful".
Great flavors.
miso soup.author: Marla B.
miso soup.review: Killing time around Japantown and feeling a bit peckish... I came across this little gem.  Even though the lunch hour was "over", their "specials sign" drew me in.  Chicken Bento Box for $6.50... I was pleasantly greeted by the server.  The restaurant is small and tidy but immaculate.  Only one other diner when I arrived, but i did hear them "oohing and aahhing" over their meal.  I was immediately given water and Miso soup, which I love.  The server explained the difference between the $6.50 BB special and the regular $8.50 BB, I went with the special and was very pleased.  Food was "Hot" and "Plentiful".  Great flavors.  Salad dressing is the Chef's Secret which I could not get out of my server, but I can say "I wanted the recipe". Shrimp and Fried Potato cooked perfectly, rice dusted with black sesame seeds, and Teriyaki Sauce not to sweet.  Just what I needed and just what I wanted and now I must return to try other specials on their menu. Great location for "before a movie @ Kabuki" or "after a movie".

excerpts: The other surprise - was that we each received a miso soup and a salad in spite of only ordering ~$10 worth of sushi each.
miso soup.author: Margot D.
miso soup.review:
Stumbled on this place while being a tourist and wandering through Japantown.

Atmosphere was great - not too big, pretty private areas for seating in spite of being one big room.

Menu was great - lots of Nigiri Sushi options, special rolls and basic ones too. 

Great quality and volume of food for the prices.

Quality and volume of food was excellent - rolls were decent in size, very evenly diced tiny vegetables in vegetarian rolls, and extremely fresh. We only ordered a few small rolls and a hand roll and they were chock full of fresh, delicious fish, and my unagi hand roll had 4 big pieces of bbq eel in it. The other surprise - was that we each received a miso soup and a salad in spite of only ordering ~$10 worth of sushi each.

Service was excellent and fast - rolls came out quickly, servers were attentive and answered questions about the different rolls.

excerpts: The miso soup didn't come with spoons, and we had to ask twice before they finally got us spoons, by the soup was already lukewarm.
Then there was no soy sauce on the table
so we had to ask for that.
The food was good although average quality for the price.
But then the waitress started walking to us asking if we wanted to order more food (what was the rush?
I was literally 5 min into my entree), and when we said no, gave us the bill.
Here's when the service went from meh to bad: the bill got in just 7 min into my entree (I was 40% done) and the waitress starting pressuring us to pay.
What in the world?
Then we reluctantly handed our credit card.
They billed it and threw the signing tray on or table.
Literally threw the bill with a *slap* onto the table.
We were polite, reasonably dressed customers!!
Uncalled for.
And of course I was still only 75% into my entree, and the waitress rudely tapped on the bill and said "sign please".
To which I replied "can you please wait for me to eat?".
This is seriously the first time in years that I HAD to leave a bad tip.
Disappointed.
Regular service is really not that hard.
miso soup.author: Crystal Y.
miso soup.review: Good food bad service. Ive never had such bad service in a Japanese restaurant before. Keep in mind I do not have very high standards for service at all, I don't even mind if I have to ask for have my water glass to be refilled and such. But this was just abysmal. The miso soup didn't come with spoons, and we had to ask twice before they finally got us spoons, by the soup was already lukewarm. Then there was no soy sauce on the table so we had to ask for that. The food was good although average quality for the price. But then the waitress started walking to us asking if we wanted to order more food (what was the rush? I was literally 5 min into my entree), and when we said no, gave us the bill. Here's when the service went from meh to bad: the bill got in just 7 min into my entree (I was 40% done) and the waitress starting pressuring us to pay. What in the world? Then we reluctantly handed our credit card. They billed it and threw the signing tray on or table. Literally threw the bill with a *slap* onto the table. We were polite, reasonably dressed customers!! Uncalled for. And of course I was still only 75% into my entree, and the waitress rudely tapped on the bill and said "sign please". To which I replied "can you please wait for me to eat?". This is seriously the first time in years that I HAD to leave a bad tip. Disappointed. Regular service is really not that hard.

excerpts: They start you off with complementary miso soup and a salad.
Been here a few times and have left sated and happy each time!
miso soup.author: Dan F.
miso soup.review: Great sushi. Amazing selection (dozens and dozens of roll options). They even have a good veggie section! Super fast service. They start you off with complementary miso soup and a salad. Been here a few times and have left sated and happy each time!

excerpts: it comes with a miso soup
miso soup.author: Julien F.
miso soup.review: I got the «chicken teriyaky + tempura + gyoza» combo for only 10,50$ it comes with a miso soup + salad + my bento combo. Big portions, I totally recommend it, I was full after that, good quality/price ! *no wifi / the staff is not japanese but much more like korean or chinese, one of the chef was mexican, Mario

excerpts: They served us complimentary miso soup and salad.
I'm not sure if it's always like that
but they said it was free so yay for us!
My friend got the Flaming Dragon and I got the 49ers.
Didn't really like the smokey taste of the Flaming Dragon
miso soup.author: Lesley M.
miso soup.review: Me and my friend came here the day before Valentine's day and we were seated right away. It was about 8pm at that time. They served us complimentary miso soup and salad. I'm not sure if it's always like that but they said it was free so yay for us! My friend got the Flaming Dragon and I got the 49ers. Didn't really like the smokey taste of the Flaming Dragon but you can never go wrong with a 49er roll. Service was great and will definitely be coming back here.

excerpts: We also received miso soup and salad which are the usual tasting fare
but I was happy to receive it in any case.
miso soup.author: Guisela L.
miso soup.review: First official review for me...awesome. Ok so let me start with my family is friends with the owner here but that won't stop me from writing an honest review. The location is conveniently right off the street and its nestled in a cute corner like location. The place is clean and the staff greeted us with a warm welcome even before they knew that we knew the owner. Overall the food was pretty good and everything tasted fresh. We ordered everything from nigiri, sashimi, hwe dub bap (Korean style sushi bowl) and dessert. Because we knew the owner he surprised us with the flaming dragon roll which comes on out on a plate on fire and even though we tend to not like cooked sushi this roll was delicious, I recommend it to everyone. We also received miso soup and salad which are the usual tasting fare but I was happy to receive it in any case. We also got hot and cold sake, the hot sake went down really smooth and the cold sake had these interesting gold flakes in it, but both were good. The staff were quick to remove plates and to refill all of our drinks. Overall a wonderful experience, the only reason why I couldn't give 5 stars is that this isn't the BEST sushi I've ever had but this business is certainly deserving of 4 solid stars. I will return.

excerpts: The miso soup was great and the salad was fantastic!
Two of our party had sushi and both enjoyed their dishes.
The rest of us had tempura and teriyaki.
The portions were large and the meals tasted just right.
I just took off one star because we all thought our martinis were weak.
miso soup.author: C A.
miso soup.review: We were given a friendly greeting and our party was seated right away. Our appetizers were fresh and came out quickly. The miso soup was great and the salad was fantastic! Two of our party had sushi and both enjoyed their dishes. The rest of us had tempura and teriyaki.  The portions were large and the meals tasted just right. I just took off one star because we all thought our martinis were weak.

excerpts: You also get some really tasty Miso soup before you order..
All in all I was pleased and very full.
I guess portions depend on what you order.
The dinner tray dishes are packed with food though...
Even Godzilla would be full from eating there !
miso soup.author: David S.
miso soup.review:
My first time here. The prices were very reasonable for the amount of food you get. My wife and I loved it. The Wasabi salad is great, we ordered a dish called The Bomb which is deep fried Jalapenos in some kind of sauce. I had the breaded pork which came with a salad and potato salad. The flavors and sauces that came with the food were also great. I also enjoyed part of my wife's dish the Teryaki chicken with California roll and deep fried veggies. Ive never seen portions this huge in a Japanese restaurant; it was like a hungry mans restaurant. The waiter was nice. It is a little pricey but it was absolutely worth it to me. Quite possibly the best Japanese food Ive ever eaten. It was really that good. I wish I knew the names of the dishes but Im not very well versed in Japanese cuisine.
You also get some really tasty Miso soup before you order.. All in all I was pleased and very full. I guess portions depend on what you order. The dinner tray dishes are packed with food though...Even Godzilla would be full from eating there !

excerpts: We were greeted with a complimentary bowl of miso soup which was tasty.
miso soup.author: Dana W.
miso soup.review: Walking through the area on our way to a concert at the Fillmore we decided to walk into this little restaurant and give it a try. We were greeted with a complimentary bowl of miso soup which was tasty. Edamame is served cold which I prefer hot but it was ok. Ordered 49er roll, Carmen, Crunch roll which were all delicious. Volcano bowl which was the breaded fried scallops were sooo yummy the gyoza I should of asked for pan fried they were just ok have had better. Overall great service, quick very nice staff and it was a pleasant find!

excerpts: Only good here is the MISO soup then everything go downhill.
This is the worst Japanese restaurant I ate in the city.
Hope this review can help out other people to save their money in wallet.
And hope I don't have diarrhea tonight
miso soup.author: Kevin K.
miso soup.review: Ordered the sashimi combo 22pc & 9pc nigiri combo and etc ... Omfg ... It's  not FRESH !! Tuna look brown color another fish look oily and soften ....after I ate this nasty meal And I decided to check out on yelp. They all are right . Only good here is the MISO soup then everything go downhill. This is the worst Japanese restaurant I ate in the city. Hope this review can help out other people to save their money in wallet. And hope I don't have diarrhea tonight

excerpts: Salty miso soup, heavily battered tempura, 3 pieces of salmon sashimi and chicken teriyaki.
Lots of mediocre food.
Won't be back.
miso soup.author: James P.
miso soup.review: Started with asking the waiter the same question twice and he just stared at me. Then came the food. Salty miso soup, heavily battered tempura, 3 pieces of salmon sashimi and chicken teriyaki. Lots of mediocre food. Won't be back.

excerpts: , I'm usually not a fan of miso soup at all but theirs was different than most.
Had to put two ice cubes in it to cool it down
but the taste was great.
The sushi (not a fan of sushi
and I have no idea what was ordered) was good as well.
miso soup.author: Brad H.
miso soup.review:
I'm no expert on Japanese food by any stretch of the imagination. But we were in Japan Town a few weeks back and went to another restaurant that was "award winning" and all that jazz. I was not impressed. The prices were too high, service was lacking and the food was just okay. The next trip we tried this place, mostly because it was a little off the path and there were no lines. So we decided to try this place and I'm glad we did! 

The first trip I had the teriyaki beef. It was very tasty! The soup was great as well, I'm usually not a fan of miso soup at all but theirs was different than most. Had to put two ice cubes in it to cool it down but the taste was great. The sushi (not a fan of sushi and I have no idea what was ordered) was good as well. The salad that came with lunch was tasty and the dressing was just right. 

Today I had the spicy chicken lunch. The chicken was GOOD! Just spicy enough to have a bite but not to the point where it tasted like burning. Service was great and food came out fast.

Pros:
Price. It's not a bargain meal but the prices are still really fair. Where else can you get a great meal like this for 6-8 bucks?  

Food. Everything I've had has been great so far!

Service. Can't really complain, friendly and efficient. 

Location. Right across from the touristy places and less tourist =D.

Cons.... Um.... having to ask for a fork! LOL yeah, I'm one of those kind of people.

excerpts: Miso soup was good too.
miso soup.author: Carla L.
miso soup.review: Cherry blossom roll was perfect!  The food came out quick and it tasted fresh.  Miso soup was good too.  Everyone in my party loved their food: tea, California roll, Bento box, teriyaki...

excerpts: Just your average Miso Soup, Tempura and Saba Shioyaki for me.
Had I known that there was a food court for the Cherry Blossom Festival
a few streets down, I probably would've saved my money and visited one of the food stands.
Sadly, this restaurant, much like many of the Japanese restaurants around Japantown, is very mediocre.
Which is a big disappointment to me, since one would expect Japantown to house the best Japanese Restaurants in the area.
My recommendation: save up your money and try Wayo Sushi, off of Van Ness Ave. in SF.
They're a bit pricy, and the restaurant is very small, but their Nigiris are the best I've had so far.
miso soup.author: George T.
miso soup.review:
My girlfriend, sister and I visited Kippu for Lunch during the Cherry Blossom Fest, and there was a bit of a wait, which was standard since the Festival is very popular. Upon being seated, we all ordered their Lunch Bentos. Nothing spectacular about their food. Just your average Miso Soup, Tempura and Saba Shioyaki for me. Had I known that there was a food court for the Cherry Blossom Festival a few streets down, I probably would've saved my money and visited one of the food stands.
Sadly, this restaurant, much like many of the Japanese restaurants around Japantown, is very mediocre. Which is a big disappointment to me, since one would expect Japantown to house the best Japanese Restaurants in the area. My recommendation: save up your money and try Wayo Sushi, off of Van Ness Ave. in SF. They're a bit pricy, and the restaurant is very small, but their Nigiris are the best I've had so far.

excerpts: In any case, I have to say their lunch special is a great deal - about $7 for miso soup plus a bento box filled with two entrees, salad, and rice.
miso soup.author: Can C.
miso soup.review:
I'd say it's more of a 3.5, but it may partially be due to the fact that it's quite convenient for us.  In any case, I have to say their lunch special is a great deal - about $7 for miso soup plus a bento box filled with two entrees, salad, and rice.  I've tried both the salmon and the beef teriyaki, all of which have been pretty tasty.  I'm also a fan of the tempura.  So definitely most of the stars are for this lunch special.  As for their sushi, it's not too bad.  Just don't let the pictures fool you; I once made that mistake and was disappointed with the portion size (it looked a lot more generous in the menu).

If it weren't so convenient, I would likely not go out of my way to eat here.  But still a great lunch deal!

excerpts: Miso soup was also the common soup that you find at restaurants in this price range, but I did find more than few, small pieces of tofu!
Even the green tea was pretty good, although I did spill it all over the place because of the chewed-up plastic covered teapot spout.
miso soup.author: Steph T.
miso soup.review:
Lunch deals are amazing here.  For two, the bill came out to just over 15.  Standard mix and match basics with soup, salad and rice.  I had sashimi and california roll; my dining partner went with the california roll and tempura.  Simple, yet good - and excellent for the price!

Tuna sashimi was very fresh and sliced into three decent pieces.  California roll was typical, made with imitation crab.  Miso soup was also the common soup that you find at restaurants in this price range, but I did find more than few, small pieces of tofu!  Even the green tea was pretty good, although I did spill it all over the place because of the chewed-up plastic covered teapot spout.  Careful. 

I didn't attempt any of the rolls, but would definitely find my way back for a nice lunch under 10 dollars when I'm around Japantown.  That said, this is definitely not worth the trek or parking charges for a cheap lunch, unless you are already in the area.

excerpts: I must say, I think the complimentary miso soup was the best part of the meal, as the soup came piping hot and was extremely flavorful, then it just all went downhill from there.
There was absolutely nothing special about any of the rolls, and as hungry as I was, I literally only ate at most 3 pieces.
miso soup.author: Luby H.
miso soup.review:
I am sorry, but definitely one of the worst sushi I have ever ate. I admit, it's hard to eat sushi in the lower price points and expect the same quality as places like Maruya in the city, but sometimes you just cant help but think, I rather pay more and get a little more in terms of satisfaction.

We ordered a few rolls (Double Salmon, Spicy Juno, Golden Gate, King's roll) and the agadashi tofu. I must say, I think the complimentary miso soup was the best part of the meal, as the soup came piping hot and was extremely flavorful, then it just all went downhill from there. There was absolutely nothing special about any of the rolls, and as hungry as I was, I literally only ate at most 3 pieces. The sushi was missing the fish quality and taste, but rather, each roll was just masked by either the flavor of spicy tuna and other sauces imbedded within. The rolls were fine, but the worst part of the entire meal was that agadashi tofu. WORST I've ever had and I didn't even know that was even possible? First of all, I was so disgusted by the texture, since to create that fried and soft exterior, Kippu used some type of starch that creates a thin clear layer of slime. Second of all, other than the nasty film of stuff, the taste was just not there and the tofu was more of a medium softness tofu rather than soft, which is what agadashi tofu is really supposed to be.

I was really disappointed, considering the fact that one of one co-workers suggested Kippu as one of her usual date night spots.

Although the service was spectacular, and the waiters were extremely attentive, I would surely not want to ever return here for another meal again. Apparently she told me that there's never a wait here though, and now I can completely understand why.

excerpts: After I got comfortable and was served a small bowl of miso soup
I was told that they wouldn't make it for me.
Hmmm?
You've made it for me once before," I say.
The waiter goes back to try again.
There is some heated conversation and he comes out and says, "He doesn't want to make it.
You can only have cold soba, that's it.
He doesn't like to put soba in the soup."
Ha!
miso soup.author: Johnnie R.
miso soup.review:
I wanted to substitute soba noodles for the ramen in the veggie soup (I'm trying to go with whole grains).  After I got comfortable and was served a small bowl of miso soup I was told that they wouldn't make it for me.  Hmmm?  "You've made it for me once before," I say.  The waiter goes back to try again.  There is some heated conversation and he comes out and says, "He doesn't want to make it. You can only have cold soba, that's it.  He doesn't like to put soba in the soup."  Ha!  No soba soup for you!

I'm not sure what the big fuss was, but it was clear that they would rather see a customer walk, than serve something off menu!  Very odd.  As it turns out I did walk -- a half block down the street to a lovely place called Toraya.  And right there on their menu is soba veggie soup -- before long I had a big steaming hot bowl of soba, fresh veggies and tofu in a flavorful broth.  Perfect!  And Toraya's atmosphere is so much more friendly and down to earth compared to the snooty vibe of Kippu.  

Forget Kippu -- take a walk and visit Toraya!

excerpts: I wanted to give it 1.5 stars for the quality of sushi, but because we got complimentary miso soup
miso soup.author: Ally V.
miso soup.review:
I wanted to give it 1.5 stars for the quality of sushi, but because we got complimentary miso soup and salad I will round up and not down for 2 stars. 

We asked what fish was good today and he said salmon so we tried it. Salmon was very good. Other than that, all the fish was blah and not very fresh. If you go here just stick with the recommendation of the chef and don't order anything else. We ended up getting a few salmon sashimi to ensure we had something edible. Just to be clear, I am probably a sushi snob so try the place if you'd like and maybe you'll enjoy it. I try not to totally bash restaurants on yelp!.

excerpts: After sitting for 45 minutes, we finally were served cold Miso soup which tasted horrible.
When we were told the lunch entrees were "ready" in the kitchen, it was still another 15 minutes before they were brought to the table.
At this point, we had been sitting for an hour.
We decided at this point that we could no longer tolerate the extreme lack of service.
We all three got up to leave.
The manager came over and spoke to us very rudely saying that we should stay to eat the food ordered.
We said we would not, and that we would not pay for it either.
This got the manager very angry, and he screamed at us.
miso soup.author: Sarah S.
miso soup.review:
I would NOT recommend this restaurant to anyone!!  I had the extreme displeasure of dining here this afternoon with my daughter and a close friend.  We had a terrible experience, a terrible lunch, and terrible service.  

After close to an hour of complete and utter disappointment, we all got up and left.  We were disgusted by the experience and the poor service.  

I ordered 2 sushi rolls and I was served quickly.  The rolls were mediocre, and the fish did not taste fresh.  My daughter and my friend ordered Bento Boxes for lunch.  The wait for their lunch was endless - over 45 minutes!!  Unacceptable!! 

From the start, the service was completely lacking - - our water and hot tea did not arrive for over 30 minutes.  After sitting for 45 minutes, we finally were served cold Miso soup which tasted horrible.  When we were told the lunch entrees were "ready" in the kitchen, it was still another 15 minutes before they were brought to the table.  At this point, we had been sitting for an hour.  We decided at this point that we could no longer tolerate the extreme lack of service.  We all three got up to leave.  The manager came over and spoke to us very rudely saying that we should stay to eat the food ordered.  We said we would not, and that we would not pay for it either.  This got the manager very angry, and he screamed at us.  I paid for the Sushi rolls which I had eaten an hour earlier, while my daughter and my friend sat waiting and waiting for the food, which would finally arrive an hour later.  

San Francisco is filled with amazing restaurants - THIS IS NOT ONE OF THEM!! I would never return the restaurant Kippu, and I will tell my family and friends about the awful experience I had today.  I had wanted to take my young daughter out to a nice lunch in the city, which would normally have been a memorable treat for both of us.  Instead, we had a really bad experience, and it was extremely disappointing.

excerpts: good selection, conveniently located in japantown, and also yummy miso soup!
miso soup.author: Thach N.
miso soup.review:
it is really surprising that considering how much of a foodie heaven SF is that sushi is not that good. ive been told by people that because of SF's geographic location it is not a great place for fresh sushi. but nonetheless:

this is a pretty good spot for sushi given sf. la is definitely better but they have a good amount of rolls. good selection, conveniently located in japantown, and also yummy miso soup!

i had a couple of the lunch specials, my favorite one was the salmon lunch special. i would highly recommend it!

excerpts: The sushi was mediocre, only plus was rolls came with miso soup and salad-but not all.
Go into the restaurants in the mall for a mug better meal!!!!!
Service was SO bad!!!!!!!
miso soup.author: foodlubber v.
miso soup.review: Don't bother! Bad service and rolls much smaller than photos in menu! Had to ask for everything! Water, more water, the rest of our order, the bill, everything! The sushi was mediocre, only plus was rolls came with miso soup and salad-but not all. Go into the restaurants in the mall for a mug better meal!!!!! Service was SO bad!!!!!!!

excerpts: She immediately brought me hot green tea and miso soup.
I realized I accidentally left my purse in my car, she lent me a large umbrella and said no problem to go and look for it.
I walked in the rain to my car and sadly couldn't find it!
It was in another purse back home...
I came back and told them I couldn't find my wallet and sadly couldn't pay, very embarrasses of course.
The sushi chef was very kind and immediately told me to stay and eat, the meal was on him this time.
Such generosity and very sweet of him.
I will definitely be back for sushi again and promise to give him an extra big tip for his generosity.
Wonderful restaurant and really good sushi.
Kind hearted staff.
miso soup.author: Emmy L.
miso soup.review: Wonderful place, I came here for lunch during a work break between patients. It was pouring rain out, I ordered a bento box with grilled teriyaki salmon. The waitress was very sweet and the sushi chef very welcoming. She immediately brought me hot green tea and miso soup. I realized I accidentally left my purse in my car, she lent me a large umbrella and said no problem to go and look for it. I walked in the rain to my car and sadly couldn't find it! It was in another purse back home...I came back and told them I couldn't find my wallet and sadly couldn't pay, very embarrasses of course. The sushi chef was very kind and immediately told me to stay and eat, the meal was on him this time. Such generosity and very sweet of him. I will definitely be back for sushi again and promise to give him an extra big tip for his generosity. Wonderful restaurant and really good sushi. Kind hearted staff.

excerpts: The food alone is 4.5/5 (the miso soup felt like it's salt water taken out of the ocean.
Too "salty".
The paint on the bowl of the miso soup was all gone on the brim.
The bottom of the bento box looked like it was all scratched up.
miso soup.author: Musica Z.
miso soup.review:
The first time I went there was a 5/5. (It's probably because we're sitting near the front with the bright sunlight etc and we had a different waitress.) 

However, the second time was kind of a bad experience. 
The food alone is 4.5/5 (the miso soup felt like it's salt water taken out of the ocean. Too "salty". But everything else was so good.)

Although I still love the good, I am hesitating to go back or not because:

1) The waitress who served us this time seems to have an attitude. I asked for a soy sauce plate but she just pointed to the small space where the wasabi was placed in the middle of the bento and said this was it. But that part of the bento box was DISGUSTINGLY HORRIBLE. The paint of that part of the box seems to be all scratched up! I don't want to put soy sauce in there to dip. Also I asked her for a soysauce plate because the last time I went to to eat, the other waitress just gave me one without asking so I assumed that I will get one this time as well. I just dislike the attitude of the waitress this time. She always seems to look pissed. She only had one expression throughout the whole meal time: semi-angry look.

2) I really wonder about if they do cleaning or not. If you sit near the end half of the restaurant, there are so much bugs flying! My friend and I were basically "accompanied" by 5 or more of those bug flying around out food. I would be better off eating a take out outside in the streets than sitting inside. 

3) Old dishware. The paint on the bowl of the miso soup was all gone on the brim. The bottom of the bento box looked like it was all scratched up. It all just looks dangerous to eat on. 

4) Slow service. My friend and I ordered food earlier than 2 other customers who came in. However, they all got their food and was eating for a good amount of time already before we got or food. We just ordered simply bento boxes like them, nothing special.

excerpts: we liked the miso soup and even salad with yum dressing.
only, the size of the portion is really big.
it's like 130 percent of american size, if compared with a sort of standard japanese restaurant lunch size, it can be twice more.
i usually dont waste food, but i can't finish.
miso soup.author: Chiemi K.
miso soup.review: we enjoyed veggie lunch twice, both experience were very good. tempura and coroque are crispy, yet very fluffy yum stuff inside. sushi rolls are good in tinier size with softly cooked rice. we liked the miso soup and even salad with yum dressing. only, the size of the portion is really big. it's like 130 percent of american size, if compared with a sort of standard japanese restaurant lunch size, it can be twice more. i usually dont waste food, but i can't finish.

excerpts: Plus, huge selection of special rolls and welcome miso soup.
Will stop by again!
miso soup.author: Den M.
miso soup.review: Quick, friendly, fresh and tasty - best rolls experience in Japantown so far. Plus, huge selection of special rolls and welcome miso soup. Will stop by again!

excerpts: The waiter and chefs greeted us upon our entrance and received a complimentary miso soup right after we got our table.
The miso soup was average, can't go wrong with that.
miso soup.author: Michelle T.
miso soup.review:
After roaming around SF, my friends and I wanted some sushi so we decided to go eat somewhere around Japan Town. After walking around for a while, we went to Kippu because we saw their wide variety of sushi rolls. The waiter and chefs greeted us upon our entrance and received a complimentary miso soup right after we got our table. 
The miso soup was average, can't go wrong with that. We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl. 
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush. The rice was a little rough and didn't taste fresh. The katsu seemed over cooked and had been sitting out for a while. The food was mediocre and their prices do not correspond to their level of precision they put into their sushi. To be very blunt, this sushi was one of the worst yet. And I would not come back unless their sushi has risen to the prices they charge here.

excerpts: After they took my order of 4 dishes - Post Roll, Washington Roll, Unagi Lover, and Ahi Tuna - we waited about 5 minutes for the miso soup which was not an issue.
However, after 30 minutes, the same waitress comes up to ask if we have ordered yet - she was ruffling through her pad to look for my order.
miso soup.author: Ben L.
miso soup.review:
This is the restaurant that made me decide to start a Yelp account.  My goal of this review is for anyone that works there to never provide this kind of experience to other customers.

1. Took close to 20 minutes to get any attention from the two waitresses to take our order. Obviously, this is not the first time anyone has experienced this, but for a restaurant that is less than 300 sq ft it was not acceptable.  I was also ignored twice with clear visual eye contact.  Two other parties had their order taken before mine was; I had a party of 2, the others were of 2 and 4.  

2. After they took my order of 4 dishes - Post Roll, Washington Roll, Unagi Lover, and Ahi Tuna - we waited about 5 minutes for the miso soup which was not an issue.  However, after 30 minutes, the same waitress comes up to ask if we have ordered yet - she was ruffling through her pad to look for my order.  She ends up going back to the cashier to find my order which at that point she tells me it will take 5 minutes to come out.  

3. She tried to compensate by providing edamame which was a nice gesture, however, the edamame was clearly old and had been sitting out in the open for a while.  It was sour (which it should never be), and much too soft like an old banana.  There was no way this can be OK to serve.  

4. The orders started to come in about 5-10 more minutes, all of which was significantly smaller than the picture.  Yes, it will never look identical to the picture, but it just looked like they didn't have enough ingredients to even complete the dish - even the rice on the rolls looked barren.  

I ended up paying about 65 dollars for this meal and it will be the last that I will ever spend there.  My girlfriend and I left hungry and totally dissatisfied with the food and service.  I've had bad restaurant experiences before and I do not have exuberant expectations, but from a customer service / technical support managerial background, this was unacceptable and needs to be improved on all ends.  Even if the quality of the food does not improve, I would continue to visit only if the service was there.  

If you get the chance to visit this restaurant, I recommend that you think twice about it before spending your hard earned cash.

excerpts: the miso soup was great, the shrimp tempura was mouth watering, and the teriyaki chicken was the best I've ever had.
miso soup.author: Jasen S.
miso soup.review: i really can't get in to sushi. I have tried sushi at least a dozen times, and I just can't get in to it...just not my thing. even though I will never be a sushi person, this restaurant is phenomenal. I only ordered the kotate, as far as sushi, which was so dang good, and everything else was equally as good. the miso soup was great, the shrimp tempura was mouth watering, and the teriyaki chicken was the best I've ever had. the milky sake we had complemented the meal well, and the service was impeccable. the price wasn't bad either. :)

excerpts: Pre meal, you get miso soup and a salad.
Soup was ok.
Salad had a small bug in it.
Major bummer.
When returning the salad, we didn't even get an apology, instead we got a "oh hahaha" kind of like woopsy thing w/o any remorse.
miso soup.author: Deon C.
miso soup.review:
Seemed like a good idea, new place in Japantown and looked semi-busy.

Small place, but nice.  Things starting off good.

New waitress knew nothing of the menu.  I wasn't asking for explanation of the menu, she just didn't know what I was saying when I ordered the rolls.  Kind of a bummer, she had to look at the menu to know what to write down.  

Pre meal, you get miso soup and a salad.  Soup was ok.  Salad had a small bug in it.  Major bummer.  When returning the salad, we didn't even get an apology, instead we got a "oh hahaha" kind of like woopsy thing w/o any remorse.

Got the happy hour beer.  Forgot the name of it, but it was fizzy, just as it said on the btl.  Best thing so far.

Got 3 rolls.  To start off, they were all very tiny for the price.  I was then expecting great quality.  Wow, disappointed.  I basically felt they lacked any flavor.  Tuna was blah blah, fried tempura was cold, and I could go on and on.  It basically felt like I was just feeding hunger vs enjoying sushi.

Unfortunately, for a new place, I do not know if they will survive.  You're in Japantown, you should make at least good sushi.  

Overall, will not go back.  Hope they improve on all aspects from service to quality of food.

excerpts: The miso soup was good.
miso soup.author: Erin A.
miso soup.review: We liked this place. The sushi is good. We ordered the Candy Cane, the Incredible and the something with the word Mexican in it. I can't remember the full name of the last one. They were all really good! They were all under the Special Roll section of the menu. The servers were interesting - there were several girls and one guy that seemed to be serving us, and the guy seemed to be the only one who really knew what was going on. The girls didn't seem to know what they were serving us and couldn't really answer questions. They were friendly though :) The miso soup was good. The salad wasn't as good as I've had it at other Japanese restaurants, but it's a pretty basic salad, so it can't get that bad or good. Oh, and they have cool cocktails! I got the Purple Gecko, my fiance got the Mojito Affair and my cousin got the Plumtini. All very good. Tasted like Jolly Ranchers! :) For the three of us and all that food it cost about $64.

excerpts: I ordered a soda, brown rice (which they ended up being out of), and some BBQ albacore to get me through to dinner, and it was mission accomplished!
However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore...
I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor.
The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own.
The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up.
The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen!
I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!
However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore...
I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor.
The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own.
The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up.
The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen!
I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!
brown rice.author: Danielle S.
brown rice.review: While shopping through japantown I needed a quick between lunch and dinner snack. Since it was an awkward time most of the places nearby were closed with the exception of Kippu. I ordered a soda, brown rice (which they ended up being out of), and some BBQ albacore to get me through to dinner, and it was mission accomplished! However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore... I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor. The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own. The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up. The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen! I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!

excerpts: As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream.
green tea ice cream.author: Matthew L.
green tea ice cream.review:
Looks can be deceiving is a common saying that usually describes people, but in this case describes Kippu. A few days ago, my friend and I were hungry and were craving sushi rolls. And since we were in Japantown, we popped by here and saw what looked mighty big sushi rolls as displayed by the pictures in the window. But in actuality the sushi rolls were pretty tiny - definitely not as big as how they were advertised on the window pictures! How disappointing. 

We ordered the Java roll, Dragon Roll and the Incredible roll... As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream. Meals come with miso soup (this was kind of bland...) and a side salad with sesame dressing (dressing is good).  I'll admit the food in general had pretty good seasoning and flavor (however the seafood tasted slightly fishy, meaning it wasn't super fresh), but I was just a little upset that the portions of the rolls were smaller than advertised.  Each roll came with 8 small sushi pieces, kind of a lot of dough given the high $11-$13/roll price tag.  OK, $11-$13/roll is pretty standard at most Japanese joints, but usually sushi rolls come with 10-12 pieces, not a measly 8. Meh, whatever.

Don't come here hungry and with very little money because you won't get full unless you order a lot.

excerpts: My fam got the green tea ice cream and they enjoyed that as well.
Overall, it was great start to our SF dining experiences!
green tea ice cream.author: Angelique D.
green tea ice cream.review: My fam and I found ourselves in Japantown looking for a non-touristy, yummy sushi spot. We tried a well-reviewed-on-Yelp spot inside Peace Plaza but they had a minimum of $20 a person and we just didn't think we could pull that off (plus, I don't like being told what to spend). So we tried Kippu, even though the reviews were mixed on Yelp. For starters, the restaurant was pretty empty except for table right next to us that looked like it was the owner or something. Our waiter greeted us and promptly spilled water right next to me. No harm done and we weren't bothered by the spill at all. Next thing we know, the owner makes sure we ok and a few minutes later, brings us this fancy dish, "The Flaming Dragon." He tries to tell us what we're supposed it to with it...something about smelling and waiting a minute after the flames die out before we open it...but then just tells us he'll be back to help us. IT was this cool looking thing--something long wrapped in foil with flames literally coming from the bottom. So after it's not on fire he comes over and opens it up...it was a super yummy roll with a bunch of fish I can't remember and some of that delicious crab filling. It was delicious and really cool of him to bring it out to us juts because of a little spill. We ended up getting 3 rolls (The Lion King, The American, and a basic unagi roll) and the chef's choice nigiri and everything was pretty good. I would give the food 3 1/2 stars, but the service bumped my review up to 4! My fam got the green tea ice cream and they enjoyed that as well. Overall, it was great start to our SF dining experiences!

excerpts: Delicious sushi and mochi ice cream.
Kinda small
but it has a great atmosphere.
Definitely recommend this place.
mochi ice cream.author: Angel M.
mochi ice cream.review: This place is great! Delicious sushi and mochi ice cream. Kinda small but it has a great atmosphere.  Definitely recommend this place.

excerpts: I feel (though I have not checked for myself) that their sushi and bentos would be good, but I decided to order the beef donburi, edamame, yakitori, and tempura ice cream.
As a (half) Japanese-American who has visited Japan throughout her life, I would say the beef donburi was OK.
The edamame was not well mixed with the salt, but it was good.
The yakitori was good, no complaints there.
The best part, and most redeeming quality of the meal was the tempura ice cream.
tempura ice cream.author: Rina R.
tempura ice cream.review:
I went into Kippu having read the Yelp reviews, so I knew the meals could be a bit hit-and-miss. I feel (though I have not checked for myself) that their sushi and bentos would be good, but I decided to order the beef donburi, edamame, yakitori, and tempura ice cream. As a (half) Japanese-American who has visited Japan throughout her life, I would say the beef donburi was OK. Nothing special, though I felt it was a bit interesting, given that the beef/egg and added vegetables were about 50/50 with the rice, something I was not expecting or used to. The edamame was not well mixed with the salt, but it was good. The yakitori was good, no complaints there. The best part, and most redeeming quality of the meal was the tempura ice cream. It was a unique dessert, and I was pleasantly surprised.

I would go to Kippu again just for the desserts, and I look forward to trying a bento and some sushi there in the future.

excerpts: $12.5 caterpillar roll only had really tiny pieces of unagi in there...
Double salmon roll's salmon didn't taste fresh...
Gyoza tasted bad...
caterpillar roll.author: Jessie K.
caterpillar roll.review: Super small portion for not so cheap prices. Paid $35 for two tiny rolls with small pieces of fish, and six pieces of Gyoza. Really disappointing. Food tasted meh... $12.5 caterpillar roll only had really tiny pieces of unagi in there... Double salmon roll's salmon didn't taste fresh... Gyoza tasted bad...

excerpts: I ordered the cherry blossom roll and was not disappointed.
I loved the salmon as it was fresh, soft, and nicely cut.
cherry blossom roll.author: Manuela R.
cherry blossom roll.review:
Incredible sushi, terrible service. I ordered the cherry blossom roll and was not disappointed. I loved the salmon as it was fresh, soft, and nicely cut. However, the staff was on the rude side and things took a while to come out. 

If you're not in a rush and don't mind bad service, this is the spot for you.

excerpts: Cherry Blossom Roll/Orange Blossom Roll
cherry blossom roll.author: Wolf B.
cherry blossom roll.review:
Never had a single issue, I've come here a dozen times and the sushi is always cold, I love the service and how everyone is so polite, KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK!!! :D I will support you guys full on.

~List of dishes I've tried~
1. Four Seasons Roll
2. Seaweed Salad
3. Vegetable Tempura/Shrimp Tempura
4. Love Roll
5. Avocado Roll
