6. Hamachi Lover Roll
7. Miso Soup
8. Cherry Blossom Roll/Orange Blossom Roll

All Perfection! :)

excerpts: Cherry blossom roll was perfect!
The food came out quick and it tasted fresh.
Everyone in my party loved their food: tea, California roll, Bento box, teriyaki...
cherry blossom roll.author: Carla L.
cherry blossom roll.review: Cherry blossom roll was perfect!  The food came out quick and it tasted fresh.  Miso soup was good too.  Everyone in my party loved their food: tea, California roll, Bento box, teriyaki...

excerpts: Ordered 49er roll, Carmen, Crunch roll which were all delicious.
Volcano bowl which was the breaded fried scallops were sooo yummy the gyoza I should of asked for pan fried they were just ok have had better.
Overall great service, quick very nice staff
and it was a pleasant find!
crunch roll.author: Dana W.
crunch roll.review: Walking through the area on our way to a concert at the Fillmore we decided to walk into this little restaurant and give it a try. We were greeted with a complimentary bowl of miso soup which was tasty. Edamame is served cold which I prefer hot but it was ok. Ordered 49er roll, Carmen, Crunch roll which were all delicious. Volcano bowl which was the breaded fried scallops were sooo yummy the gyoza I should of asked for pan fried they were just ok have had better. Overall great service, quick very nice staff and it was a pleasant find!

excerpts: Double salmon roll's salmon didn't taste fresh...
Gyoza tasted bad...
double salmon roll.author: Jessie K.
double salmon roll.review: Super small portion for not so cheap prices. Paid $35 for two tiny rolls with small pieces of fish, and six pieces of Gyoza. Really disappointing. Food tasted meh... $12.5 caterpillar roll only had really tiny pieces of unagi in there... Double salmon roll's salmon didn't taste fresh... Gyoza tasted bad...

excerpts: I ended up getting the double salmon roll because mercury tastes delicious, and a vegetarian bento box on the side because vegetables and fibrous materials.
double salmon roll.author: Joy G.
double salmon roll.review:
The sushi menu is basically a Willy Wonka wonderland for anyone who is sick of the basic California roll - if you're at all an indecisive freak like me, you will change your mind at least five times before the waitress comes to take your order and then change your mind while you are ordering. I ended up getting the double salmon roll because mercury tastes delicious, and a vegetarian bento box on the side because vegetables and fibrous materials. The miso soup is really, really salty here, and I say that as someone who always finishes her complimentary miso soup. 

We decided to be annoying and asked for a seat in the back with the comfy lounge cushions instead of the rickety wooden chairs in the front. The waitress shook her head, saying that the back tables were only for parties of 10. It was 2 o'clock on a Wednesday. A party of 10 is not going to come strolling in and demand to be crammed around two tiny tables. I said so more or less, and she signed through her nose and said, sure, but only if we agree to move if a party of 10 comes in. It felt a little bizarre playing this passive-agro tug of war over a hypothetical party of 10 stragglers, but she lit up when we ordered 5 rolls and a ton of bento boxes. 

Two stars for delicious agedashi tofu. Yes, there is this layer of brown, umami goo caking the tofu. Yes, I was eyeing my friend's nabeyaki udon a bit wistfully. Yes, I ate too much and then had to wander through the mall in the Peace Plaza across the street arguing with myself (possibly aloud) if physical agony was worth green tea soft serve or a banana and nutella crepe. Thanks for having me, Japantown!

excerpts: Came on Friday afternoon, had the Titanic and Delicious Roll, very good.
Respectful and Quick service.
delicious roll.author: Cyndi F.
delicious roll.review: Came on Friday afternoon, had the Titanic and Delicious Roll, very good. Respectful and Quick service.

excerpts: I tried the delicious roll and it had a good taste and texture to it, so that made things a BIT better -- still doesn't make up for my flameless roll though.
grrrrr
delicious roll.author: Lisa L.
delicious roll.review:
I am so sad as I write this... It's not worth taking off a star but omg... after all the times I've been here with my girlfriend (I only go here with her) we FINALLY ordered the flaming dragon for the first time (for me, I always fall on her alternative day where she ordered it previous and decided to take a break from it) AND THERE WAS NO FLAME.  The waiter came over with it wrapped in foil and I was thinking, "oh. is he going to light it now?" NOPE, NOT SIR. IT WAS DONE AND HE JUST UNWRAPPED IT.  I don't know if it was because of that, it didn't even taste that great to me.  VERY VERY Disappointed. 

Thank goodness I had ordered another roll.. I tried the delicious roll and it had a good taste and texture to it, so that made things a BIT better -- still doesn't make up for my flameless roll though. grrrrr

excerpts: The Flaming Dragon Roll tasted like lighter fluid, couldn't even eat it.
dragon roll.author: Dustin M.
dragon roll.review: The Flaming Dragon Roll tasted like lighter fluid, couldn't even eat it. We also had gyoza, the bomb, and a couple other rolls. All just ok, not great. Wouldn't go back.

excerpts: We ordered the Java roll, Dragon Roll and the Incredible roll...
As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream.
Each roll came with 8 small sushi pieces, kind of a lot of dough given the high $11-$13/roll price tag.
OK, $11-$13/roll is pretty standard at most Japanese joints, but usually sushi rolls come with 10-12 pieces, not a measly 8.
dragon roll.author: Matthew L.
dragon roll.review:
Looks can be deceiving is a common saying that usually describes people, but in this case describes Kippu. A few days ago, my friend and I were hungry and were craving sushi rolls. And since we were in Japantown, we popped by here and saw what looked mighty big sushi rolls as displayed by the pictures in the window. But in actuality the sushi rolls were pretty tiny - definitely not as big as how they were advertised on the window pictures! How disappointing. 

We ordered the Java roll, Dragon Roll and the Incredible roll... As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream. Meals come with miso soup (this was kind of bland...) and a side salad with sesame dressing (dressing is good).  I'll admit the food in general had pretty good seasoning and flavor (however the seafood tasted slightly fishy, meaning it wasn't super fresh), but I was just a little upset that the portions of the rolls were smaller than advertised.  Each roll came with 8 small sushi pieces, kind of a lot of dough given the high $11-$13/roll price tag.  OK, $11-$13/roll is pretty standard at most Japanese joints, but usually sushi rolls come with 10-12 pieces, not a measly 8. Meh, whatever.

Don't come here hungry and with very little money because you won't get full unless you order a lot.

excerpts: Part of my order was a dragon roll and another table behind us orderd an unagi roll.
I was given the unagi rolll
and I brought it to the wait staff's attention.
They told me it was a dragon roll.
They came back a few seconds later and realized it wasn't and took the plate.
They told me it was a dragon roll.
They came back a few seconds later and realized it wasn't and took the plate.
However, the table they had given my dragon roll had already started eating it.
However, the table they had given my dragon roll had already started eating it.
Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.
Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.
Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.
Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.
Just remake the roll for god sakes.
dragon roll.author: Eric H.
dragon roll.review:
We went in here and the food was decent. Rolls are big. Giving 1 star because they mixed my order up and refused to fix it. Part of my order was a dragon roll and another table behind us orderd an unagi roll. They both are similar except one has shrimp tempura inside while the other has crab.

I was given the unagi rolll and I brought it to the wait staff's attention. They told me it was a dragon roll. They came back a few seconds later and realized it wasn't and took the plate. However, the table they had given my dragon roll had already started eating it. Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.

Just remake the roll for god sakes.

excerpts: We did see someone order the flaming dragon roll, which looked pretty impressive, but other than that, we'd probably opt for something different the next time we're in Japantown.
dragon roll.author: Wayne H.
dragon roll.review: Not great, not terrible, just average. The service was pretty fast, but also felt a little rushed. It was nice that we each got a salad and soup even though we just ordered a few rolls to share. The fish on the rolls were of varying quality, but overall it was not bad. The problem was the portions for the sushi rolls were a pretty small - even though there were plenty of pieces, each piece was like the size of a quarter. Sushi for ants, as my friend said. We did see someone order the flaming dragon roll, which looked pretty impressive, but other than that, we'd probably opt for something different the next time we're in Japantown.

excerpts: Get the flaming dragon roll!
Not only does it taste amazing
it comes with a show!
The service was quick and friendly.
The wait staff worked together to take care of us.
They were fairly busy but the food came quickly and it was all wonderful.
dragon roll.author: Megan R.
dragon roll.review: Get the flaming dragon roll!  Not only does it taste amazing it comes with a show!   The service was quick and friendly. The wait staff worked together to take care of us. They were fairly busy but the food came quickly and it was all wonderful. Fresh fish in the sushi,  crispy tempura,  great sauce on the salmon teriyaki. A must try restaurant if you're in Japan town!

excerpts: We ordered the Flaming Dragon Roll ($15) and the Mountain Roll ($11).
dragon roll.author: Shee X.
dragon roll.review: Sushi was delicious, flavorful, and fresh! We ordered the Flaming Dragon Roll ($15) and the Mountain Roll ($11). We also received complimentary miso soup and salad, which was nice and tasty as well. Would definitely recommend Kippu if you are in Japantown.

excerpts: Because we knew the owner he surprised us with the flaming dragon roll which comes on out on a plate on fire and even though we tend to not like cooked sushi this roll was delicious, I recommend it to everyone.
dragon roll.author: Guisela L.
dragon roll.review: First official review for me...awesome. Ok so let me start with my family is friends with the owner here but that won't stop me from writing an honest review. The location is conveniently right off the street and its nestled in a cute corner like location. The place is clean and the staff greeted us with a warm welcome even before they knew that we knew the owner. Overall the food was pretty good and everything tasted fresh. We ordered everything from nigiri, sashimi, hwe dub bap (Korean style sushi bowl) and dessert. Because we knew the owner he surprised us with the flaming dragon roll which comes on out on a plate on fire and even though we tend to not like cooked sushi this roll was delicious, I recommend it to everyone. We also received miso soup and salad which are the usual tasting fare but I was happy to receive it in any case. We also got hot and cold sake, the hot sake went down really smooth and the cold sake had these interesting gold flakes in it, but both were good. The staff were quick to remove plates and to refill all of our drinks. Overall a wonderful experience, the only reason why I couldn't give 5 stars is that this isn't the BEST sushi I've ever had but this business is certainly deserving of 4 solid stars. I will return.

excerpts: Ordered up a bunch of rolls with some coworkers - and this place did not disappoint - especially the FLAMING DRAGON roll.
I thought setting a sushi roll on fire was going to be super gimmecky, but it was awesome from both a taste and experience perspective.
dragon roll.author: Helen C.
dragon roll.review:
We played some sushi roulette during a recent conference and lucked out with a great lunch at Kippu.  Ordered up a bunch of rolls with some coworkers - and this place did not disappoint - especially the FLAMING DRAGON roll.  I thought setting a sushi roll on fire was going to be super gimmecky, but it was awesome from both a taste and experience perspective.

Everything we ate was fresh, tasty and served speedily during lunch time - if I find myself back in this part of town, I'll definitely be back!

excerpts: I was sold the first time I had the flaming dragon roll.
It's one of a kind and absolutely delicious.
dragon roll.author: Jennifer L.
dragon roll.review: I think the variety and innovation demonstrated by the menu makes this place a winner. I was sold the first time I had the flaming dragon roll. It's one of a kind and absolutely delicious.

excerpts: The flaming dragon roll and Ferrari roll are my favorite so far!
The service was great and food was great!
The waiter was really cute too
Also, while I was waiting I saw that they had a certificate of excellence!!!
Highly recommended!
dragon roll.author: Janice H.
dragon roll.review: This was my first time eating at this restaurant and I didn't know what to order because there were so many to choose. Out server named Bryan helped us out with what to order and they were all delicious! The flaming dragon roll and Ferrari roll are my favorite so far! The service was great and food was great! The waiter was really cute too =D. Also, while I was waiting I saw that they had a certificate of excellence!!! Highly recommended!

excerpts: The Dragon Roll and Tamago are great!
dragon roll.author: Anthony N.
dragon roll.review:
The Dragon Roll and Tamago are great! I have yet to try more things on the menu, but so far it has all been very good.

Side note: It was interesting to hear K-Pop circa 1998-2002 being played during lunch.

excerpts: Amazing menu with some definitely adventurous (the flaming dragon roll is LITERALLY on fire).
I love so many options on their menu that it is always hard to decide what to order.
They also have great happy hour drink prices, and the staff is so fun and friendly!
I always have a great sushi dining experience at Kippu!
dragon roll.author: Bridget B.
dragon roll.review: I absolutely love Kippu. Choosing a sushi place in Japan Town is difficult, but if you go to Kippu you will not be disappointed! Amazing menu with some definitely adventurous (the flaming dragon roll is LITERALLY on fire). I love so many options on their menu that it is always hard to decide what to order.  They also have great happy hour drink prices, and the staff is so fun and friendly! I always have a great sushi dining experience at Kippu!

excerpts: We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl.
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush.
dragon roll.author: Michelle T.
dragon roll.review:
After roaming around SF, my friends and I wanted some sushi so we decided to go eat somewhere around Japan Town. After walking around for a while, we went to Kippu because we saw their wide variety of sushi rolls. The waiter and chefs greeted us upon our entrance and received a complimentary miso soup right after we got our table. 
The miso soup was average, can't go wrong with that. We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl. 
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush. The rice was a little rough and didn't taste fresh. The katsu seemed over cooked and had been sitting out for a while. The food was mediocre and their prices do not correspond to their level of precision they put into their sushi. To be very blunt, this sushi was one of the worst yet. And I would not come back unless their sushi has risen to the prices they charge here.

excerpts: The mammoth roll was absolutely wonderful!!
I could go back and order just that!
The poke that is served on top was delicious!
Highly recommend.
Great, fast and friendly service too.
mammoth roll.author: Malia R.
mammoth roll.review: Stayed overnight in Japantown and this place was recommended. The mammoth roll was absolutely wonderful!! I could go back and order just that! The poke that is served on top was delicious! Highly recommend.  Great, fast and friendly service too.

excerpts: The Flaming Dragon Roll tasted like lighter fluid, couldn't even eat it.
flaming dragon roll.author: Dustin M.
flaming dragon roll.review: The Flaming Dragon Roll tasted like lighter fluid, couldn't even eat it. We also had gyoza, the bomb, and a couple other rolls. All just ok, not great. Wouldn't go back.

excerpts: They did offer a lot is specialty rolls, my friend got their fried golden gate roll.
It looked delicious!
golden gate roll.author: Brittany W.
golden gate roll.review:
When I heard that they have a Japantown in the city I had to get me some sushi!  My friend brought me here and the food wasn't that bad.  I got the usual, California roll and pretty much another California roll with salmon and yellow tail on top.  They offer a complimentary miso soup and salad to start your meal.  Don't go looking for a spoon either, we eat our soup just like they do in Japan haha.  Drink up!

The food is where the authentic culture ends.  The music selection was great but very American.  They did offer a lot is specialty rolls, my friend got their fried golden gate roll. It looked delicious!

excerpts: We ordered the Java roll, Dragon Roll and the Incredible roll...
As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream.
Each roll came with 8 small sushi pieces, kind of a lot of dough given the high $11-$13/roll price tag.
OK, $11-$13/roll is pretty standard at most Japanese joints, but usually sushi rolls come with 10-12 pieces, not a measly 8.

We ordered the Java roll, Dragon Roll and the Incredible roll... As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream. Meals come with miso soup (this was kind of bland...) and a side salad with sesame dressing (dressing is good).  I'll admit the food in general had pretty good seasoning and flavor (however the seafood tasted slightly fishy, meaning it wasn't super fresh), but I was just a little upset that the portions of the rolls were smaller than advertised.  Each roll came with 8 small sushi pieces, kind of a lot of dough given the high $11-$13/roll price tag.  OK, $11-$13/roll is pretty standard at most Japanese joints, but usually sushi rolls come with 10-12 pieces, not a measly 8. Meh, whatever.

Don't come here hungry and with very little money because you won't get full unless you order a lot.

excerpts: we got the salmon bento box and the beef teriyaki and the incredible roll (?).
I wish we were told that roll was raw.
I still tipped them because I work in a similar field as well and rely on tips sometimes.
I hope this review and the other reviews helps them with a little service upgrade.
incredible roll.author: Dixie x.
incredible roll.review: food was alright. not too good, not too bad. ive had better. not much on their menu, which doesnt please me at all. the waitress was rushing us to order our food which is definitely a no. the other servers were not water friendly with refills. other then that, nothing good to say. we got the salmon bento box and the beef teriyaki and the incredible roll (?). I wish we were told that roll was raw. I still tipped them because I work in a similar field as well and rely on tips sometimes. I hope this review and the other reviews helps them with a little service upgrade.

excerpts: I would highly recommend getting the flaming roll and the lion king roll (one of the best lion king roles I've had in the city).
Very flavorful with a mix of sauces including mustard (tastes surprisingly good).
One thing I would critic is the service is not that great
lion king roll.author: Kunal T.
lion king roll.review:
I would highly recommend getting the flaming roll and the lion king roll (one of the best lion king roles I've had in the city). Very flavorful with a mix of sauces including mustard (tastes surprisingly good). One thing I would critic is the service is not that great it seems like it is a very rushed setting where their trying to get you in and out as fast as possible,

I love the location its in the center of Japan town with a lot of shopping and Fillmore street right around the corner.

Check it out for some good sushi in the city.

excerpts: This is my first time here, but the Lion King Roll, Sashimi Combo and Sake lunch we had was delicious!
lion king roll.author: Rafael C.
lion king roll.review: Three Stars??? This is my first time here, but the Lion King Roll, Sashimi Combo and Sake lunch we had was delicious!

excerpts: We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl.
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush.
lion king roll.author: Michelle T.
lion king roll.review:
After roaming around SF, my friends and I wanted some sushi so we decided to go eat somewhere around Japan Town. After walking around for a while, we went to Kippu because we saw their wide variety of sushi rolls. The waiter and chefs greeted us upon our entrance and received a complimentary miso soup right after we got our table. 
The miso soup was average, can't go wrong with that. We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl. 
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush. The rice was a little rough and didn't taste fresh. The katsu seemed over cooked and had been sitting out for a while. The food was mediocre and their prices do not correspond to their level of precision they put into their sushi. To be very blunt, this sushi was one of the worst yet. And I would not come back unless their sushi has risen to the prices they charge here.

excerpts: We ordered the Java roll, Dragon Roll and the Incredible roll...
As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream.
Each roll came with 8 small sushi pieces, kind of a lot of dough given the high $11-$13/roll price tag.
OK, $11-$13/roll is pretty standard at most Japanese joints, but usually sushi rolls come with 10-12 pieces, not a measly 8.
java roll.author: Matthew L.
java roll.review:
Looks can be deceiving is a common saying that usually describes people, but in this case describes Kippu. A few days ago, my friend and I were hungry and were craving sushi rolls. And since we were in Japantown, we popped by here and saw what looked mighty big sushi rolls as displayed by the pictures in the window. But in actuality the sushi rolls were pretty tiny - definitely not as big as how they were advertised on the window pictures! How disappointing. 

We ordered the Java roll, Dragon Roll and the Incredible roll... As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream. Meals come with miso soup (this was kind of bland...) and a side salad with sesame dressing (dressing is good).  I'll admit the food in general had pretty good seasoning and flavor (however the seafood tasted slightly fishy, meaning it wasn't super fresh), but I was just a little upset that the portions of the rolls were smaller than advertised.  Each roll came with 8 small sushi pieces, kind of a lot of dough given the high $11-$13/roll price tag.  OK, $11-$13/roll is pretty standard at most Japanese joints, but usually sushi rolls come with 10-12 pieces, not a measly 8. Meh, whatever.

Don't come here hungry and with very little money because you won't get full unless you order a lot.

excerpts:
Love Roll
5.
love roll.author: Wolf B.
love roll.review:
Never had a single issue, I've come here a dozen times and the sushi is always cold, I love the service and how everyone is so polite, KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK!!! :D I will support you guys full on.

~List of dishes I've tried~
1. Four Seasons Roll
2. Seaweed Salad
3. Vegetable Tempura/Shrimp Tempura
4. Love Roll
5. Avocado Roll
6. Hamachi Lover Roll
7. Miso Soup
8. Cherry Blossom Roll/Orange Blossom Roll

excerpts: Absolutely awesome best sushi and most amazing date ever there love roll.
Everything was great
love roll.author: Michael M.
love roll.review: Absolutely awesome best sushi and most amazing date ever there love roll. Everything was great

excerpts: Nice Roll:
Not so nice.
nice roll.author: Lily W.
nice roll.review:
Is pretty meh, but that's to be expected. When you go to Japantown, you're not going for the top of the line, absolutely best sushi. But you're looking to hit a craving.

Spicy Killer Roll: Not really spicy, more of a sriracha spice. The tuna on top was pretty decent.

Spider roll: Was solid, but spider rolls tend to be okay.

Nice Roll: Not so nice. The tempura shrimp was old, and really over battered. 

The last roll was something with imitation crab meat and avocado inside, and salmon and hamachi on top. Not bad, was relatively fresh.

The tako in the takoyaki was pretty good, though I wish they cooked the takoyaki a little longer. The dough was a little too raw-ish.


That being said, the service was really good and people were very attentive. If the owners splurged a little for fresher product, I think this place could be much better.

excerpts: Cherry Blossom Roll/Orange Blossom Roll
orange blossom roll.author: Wolf B.
orange blossom roll.review:
Never had a single issue, I've come here a dozen times and the sushi is always cold, I love the service and how everyone is so polite, KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK!!! :D I will support you guys full on.

8. Cherry Blossom Roll/Orange Blossom Roll

All Perfection! :)

excerpts: We got the rainbow roll, Philadelphia and cherry blossom.
All were great and had very reasonable pricing.
rainbow roll.author: Cameron W.
rainbow roll.review: Great sushi! The meal came with complimentary miso salad. Staff was nice and friendly and attentive. I definitely will come back again! We got the rainbow roll, Philadelphia and cherry blossom. All were great and had very reasonable pricing.

excerpts: The first roll that came was the rainbow roll which wasn't what we ordered
and so we let it sit there till our server came so we can tell her that it isn't what we ordered.
rainbow roll.author: Chantille T.
rainbow roll.review: It was a Thursday afternoon, me and my friend were trying to look for a decent sushi place around Japantown and stumble across Kippu, so we decided to check it out. Came into the establishment and was seated right away, looked through the menus and the waitress comes over and asks us if we are ready to order. We weren't ready yet so we started off with two cokes. Once we were ready, we ordered 3 rolls, an appetizer and some miso soups. The miso soups were complimentary which was nice and we got the oysters, the mountain roll, the scallop bay roll and titanic. The first roll that came was the rainbow roll which wasn't what we ordered and so we let it sit there till our server came so we can tell her that it isn't what we ordered. Later on, she dropped off the titanic and scallop bay roll which was good and then later dropped off the mountain roll. Here's when things get a bit frustrating. She was the only server and she running around frustrated which I understood cause business started picking up but when she dropped off the mountain roll, I guess she didn't realize that it wasn't the mountain roll to begin with and it took her awhile to come check back with us. And we were patiently waiting, so patient to the point where we finished our first two rolls and our oysters that weren't even pleasant. Once she came, my friend and I were telling her that this isn't what we ordered and she tried to tell us that it was and we showed her the picture and she said, "it has this this and this" and then we pointed it out that it didn't have the certain toppings on it, so she asked us if we wanted those toppings on it and we said yes and she went and did that for us. I mean the issue wasn't about whose right and whose wrong but if you're gonna advertise something as this then don't bring it out something as something different you know? Overall cute little place, would I recommend this place to anyone? Eh, I don't think so.

excerpts: We chose the rock and roll and the spicy killer roll.
Both of rolls were decent.
The spicy killer roll was an amped spicy tuna roll which tasted overwhelming of siracha, taking away from the flavor of the fish.
The spicy killer roll was an amped spicy tuna roll which tasted overwhelming of siracha, taking away from the flavor of the fish.
Rick and roll hit the spot for my fiance.
rock and roll.author: Michelle C.
rock and roll.review:
Came in during lunch on a Tuesday afternoon. I've walked by this place many times but have never tried the place. Feeling the hunger pains, my fiance and I decided to join the crowd inside and dine in for lunch.

They have a pretty extensive menu with countless rolls to choose from. Kinda reminds me of the neverending menu at cheesecake factory, indecisive eaters beware! That aside, we kept our choices simple. We chose the rock and roll and the spicy killer roll. Both of rolls were decent. The spicy killer roll was an amped spicy tuna roll which tasted overwhelming of siracha, taking away from the flavor of the fish. Rick and roll hit the spot for my fiance. Overall, the experience was okay. 

A bit overpriced for mediocre rolls with decent fish quality. Quick and speedy service, however they did forget our utensils. Waitress and host seemed quite busy and ready to turn over our tables the second we finished our meals.

Don't know if I'd be willing to revisit this place again given there are far better sushi places in the area for better prices.

excerpts: We also ordered the rock and roll sushi, which includes unagi, shrimp, and avocado.
rock and roll.author: Rose Marie J.
rock and roll.review: I am having the bento box with salmon teriyaki, tempura, and the California roll.  C is having mixed tempura.  We also ordered the rock and roll sushi, which includes unagi, shrimp, and avocado.

excerpts: Spider roll:
spider roll.author: Lily W.
spider roll.review:
Is pretty meh, but that's to be expected. When you go to Japantown, you're not going for the top of the line, absolutely best sushi. But you're looking to hit a craving.

Spicy Killer Roll: Not really spicy, more of a sriracha spice. The tuna on top was pretty decent.

Spider roll: Was solid, but spider rolls tend to be okay.

Nice Roll: Not so nice. The tempura shrimp was old, and really over battered. 

The last roll was something with imitation crab meat and avocado inside, and salmon and hamachi on top. Not bad, was relatively fresh.

The tako in the takoyaki was pretty good, though I wish they cooked the takoyaki a little longer. The dough was a little too raw-ish.


That being said, the service was really good and people were very attentive. If the owners splurged a little for fresher product, I think this place could be much better.

excerpts: I ate 2 leftover pieces from my brother's Spider roll, and it was again mediocre.
Nothing special about this place, I left pretty hungry still.
Won't be coming back.
spider roll.author: Vy T.
spider roll.review: Went to eat lunch here with my family. Service was ok, food wasn't good. Server checked on us alot, but didn't get us a coke that we ordered until the end of our meal (we had to ask again because she didn't even remember we ordered a coke), and it all felt rushed because she did everything quickly and spoke very fast. I ordered the Takoyaki and 4 Seasons roll. Ate 1 Takoyaki out of 5 and didn't finish my 4 Seasons because it made me a little nauseous. The scallops were raw (I hate raw fish/shellfish) normally when I order an item with scallops, they are cooked. Guess I just ordered the wrong item on the menu. I ate 2 leftover pieces from my brother's Spider roll, and it was again mediocre. Nothing special about this place, I left pretty hungry still. Won't be coming back.

excerpts: After they took my order of 4 dishes - Post Roll, Washington Roll, Unagi Lover, and Ahi Tuna - we waited about 5 minutes for the miso soup which was not an issue.
However, after 30 minutes, the same waitress comes up to ask if we have ordered yet - she was ruffling through her pad to look for my order.
post roll.author: Ben L.
post roll.review:
This is the restaurant that made me decide to start a Yelp account.  My goal of this review is for anyone that works there to never provide this kind of experience to other customers.

1. Took close to 20 minutes to get any attention from the two waitresses to take our order. Obviously, this is not the first time anyone has experienced this, but for a restaurant that is less than 300 sq ft it was not acceptable.  I was also ignored twice with clear visual eye contact.  Two other parties had their order taken before mine was; I had a party of 2, the others were of 2 and 4.  

2. After they took my order of 4 dishes - Post Roll, Washington Roll, Unagi Lover, and Ahi Tuna - we waited about 5 minutes for the miso soup which was not an issue.  However, after 30 minutes, the same waitress comes up to ask if we have ordered yet - she was ruffling through her pad to look for my order.  She ends up going back to the cashier to find my order which at that point she tells me it will take 5 minutes to come out.  

3. She tried to compensate by providing edamame which was a nice gesture, however, the edamame was clearly old and had been sitting out in the open for a while.  It was sour (which it should never be), and much too soft like an old banana.  There was no way this can be OK to serve.  

4. The orders started to come in about 5-10 more minutes, all of which was significantly smaller than the picture.  Yes, it will never look identical to the picture, but it just looked like they didn't have enough ingredients to even complete the dish - even the rice on the rolls looked barren.  

I ended up paying about 65 dollars for this meal and it will be the last that I will ever spend there.  My girlfriend and I left hungry and totally dissatisfied with the food and service.  I've had bad restaurant experiences before and I do not have exuberant expectations, but from a customer service / technical support managerial background, this was unacceptable and needs to be improved on all ends.  Even if the quality of the food does not improve, I would continue to visit only if the service was there.  

If you get the chance to visit this restaurant, I recommend that you think twice about it before spending your hard earned cash.

excerpts: Pitchers for only $12 lured me through the door, Flaming Dragon and Ferrari Roll are worth trying....
ferrari roll.author: Mar E.
ferrari roll.review: Pitchers for only $12 lured me through the door, Flaming Dragon and Ferrari Roll are worth trying....

excerpts: The flaming dragon roll and Ferrari roll are my favorite so far!
The service was great and food was great!
The waiter was really cute too
Also, while I was waiting I saw that they had a certificate of excellence!!!
Highly recommended!
ferrari roll.author: Janice H.
ferrari roll.review: This was my first time eating at this restaurant and I didn't know what to order because there were so many to choose. Out server named Bryan helped us out with what to order and they were all delicious! The flaming dragon roll and Ferrari roll are my favorite so far! The service was great and food was great! The waiter was really cute too =D. Also, while I was waiting I saw that they had a certificate of excellence!!! Highly recommended!

excerpts: The Ferrari roll was okay.
Melts in your mouth but nothing I would order again.
Ordered dessert ...
I kinda was expecting the mochi to be maybe bigger?
Not something out of a trader joes box but that's just me.
I could live without.
We also ordered oyster shooters (I probably wont do that again)
it tasted weird but only because I've never had one.
The raw oysters were good.
ferrari roll.author: Nathalie N.
ferrari roll.review:
First time- Walked by on a whim and decided to give it a try.

I have to say customer service was good. Our waiter was attentive and took care of us well whenever we needed anything. Made some good recs.

We ordered the flaming dragon. Presentation was awesome. And the roll itself was good, the sauce made the roll. Victoria Secret had a awesome crunch to it. I would order 5 or 6 of those and eat way more. The Ferrari roll was okay. Melts in your mouth but nothing I would order again. Ordered dessert ... I kinda was expecting the mochi to be maybe bigger? Not something out of a trader joes box but that's just me. I could live without. We also ordered oyster shooters (I probably wont do that again) it tasted weird but only because I've never had one. The raw oysters were good. A bit spicy but tasted amazing. 

The price was also decent and cheap for SF sushi. I dont know about the music tho.. a bit too trancey for me. I'll be back for some more sushi tho. Tasted good and I'm already craving more Victoria Secret rolls!

excerpts: The Ferrari roll sounded promising, and both times I have ordered it, the spicy tuna tasted and smelled really fishy.
I don't know that they are committed to quality.
ferrari roll.author: Scott L.
ferrari roll.review: Meh.  They seemed confused when I asked for sashimi.  The Ferrari roll sounded promising, and both times I have ordered it, the spicy tuna tasted and smelled really fishy.  I don't know that they are committed to quality.  I think this is not Japanese owned, and it has a weak sake menu.  Not coming back.  :/

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the Ferrari and the Sex and the City roll and loved it.
He couldn't stop raving about it as we were eating.
His rolls were delicious with just the right amount of spice.
sex and the city roll.author: Laura D.
sex and the city roll.review: Food was good and service was quick. My boyfriend ordered the Ferrari and the Sex and the City roll and loved it. He couldn't stop raving about it as we were eating. His rolls were delicious with just the right amount of spice. We also had the beef teriyaki,gyoza, tempura box and it was very yummy. It was better than average for sure. Thanks Japantown!

excerpts: Bonzai and salmon ceviche roll were delicious!
Definitely coming back here.
salmon ceviche roll.author: Emma J.
salmon ceviche roll.review: Great customer service. Amazing age-dash tofu, tofu steak in the bento box was a bit bland. Bonzai and salmon ceviche roll were delicious! Definitely coming back here.

excerpts:
Karage chicken  is small like pop corn chicken
Sushi rolls are small , ordered the candy cane roll , 8 pieces size like California roll ...disappointed but there is only very few restaurant open around 9:30 pm at night
candy cane roll.author: Phoebe W.
candy cane roll.review:
Karage chicken  is small like pop corn chicken
Sushi rolls are small , ordered the candy cane roll , 8 pieces size like California roll ...disappointed but there is only very few restaurant open around 9:30 pm at night

excerpts: I came here with a friend for lunch on a Friday and got the Banzai roll, which is deep fried shrimp, avocado, and cucumber with mamenori, which is like a yellow paper, wrapped on the outside.
banzai roll.author: Erika S.
banzai roll.review:
FOOD:

I came here with a friend for lunch on a Friday and got the Banzai roll, which is deep fried shrimp, avocado, and cucumber with mamenori, which is like a yellow paper, wrapped on the outside. I wasn't too impressed, especially since the wrap covered any texture of the sushi.

SERVICE: 

It was pretty quiet when we entered, so we got a table by the window.

The servers were a bit quiet, but it was fine. They weren't particularly friendly, so we just ordered and paid after we finished. The overall experience was that we pretty much just ate our sushi and we were on our way.

excerpts: I came here with my parents and ordered a bento box, donburi (katsu don), and their sushi ( King Kong roll).
Bento box ( salmon teriyaki w/ California roll)
: This bento box included a side salad, 4pcs of California roll, white rice, a filet salmon teriyaki with ginger and wasabi.
The salmon teriyaki was good, the California roll was alright and salad was okay too.
Katsu don: just your basic katsu don with a little zucchini thrown into it.
King Kong roll-
it was alright.
The taste of it is fine
but it just didn't necessarily impressed me.
Overall the food was meh in my opinion.
If I had to recommend something that I ate it would be the sushi.
It was the best tasting out of things I've ordered.
Service was really friendly and nice.
Overall I don't think I will personally come here again if I am going to be completely honest.
king kong roll.author: Kochamon S.
king kong roll.review:
The food was alright honestly..
I came here with my parents and ordered a bento box, donburi (katsu don), and their sushi ( King Kong roll).

Bento box ( salmon teriyaki w/ California roll): This bento box included a side salad, 4pcs of California roll, white rice, a filet salmon teriyaki with ginger and wasabi. The salmon teriyaki was good, the California roll was alright and salad was okay too. 

Katsu don: just your basic katsu don with a little zucchini thrown into it. 
King Kong roll- it was alright. The taste of it is fine but it just didn't necessarily impressed me. 
Overall the food was meh in my opinion. If I had to recommend something that I ate it would be the sushi. It was the best tasting out of things I've ordered. 
Service was really friendly and nice. 
Overall I don't think I will personally come here again if I am going to be completely honest.

excerpts: I got the flaming roll being basic because everyone else's pictures and food looked amazing from the reviews.
The roll itself was good
/okay!
A little watery on the bottom and kind of salty.
roll.author: Jessica K.
roll.review:
This was a great lil Japanese sushi restaurant in Japantown! The owners are Korean. Very clean and prompt service. I got the flaming roll being basic because everyone else's pictures and food looked amazing from the reviews. 

The roll itself was good/okay! A little watery on the bottom and kind of salty. I would get sashimi next time though cause the fish looks fresh! 

Service was so good though that it just over complimented the food profile.

excerpts: I sat at the bar and ask the Sushi Chef for his recommends and ten minutes lates I had Salmon and Tuna Sashimi followed by a Firecracker Roll.
The Firecracker roll was scallops and cucumber in the middle with spicy tuna on top.
Nice size and nice spice, enjoyed very much.
Sashimi was fresh, little small for the price, great with a bit of lemon.
I would come back
and I would recommend.
roll.author: David E.
roll.review:
Great location, easy to find and just a fun place.  Service started as soon as I walked into the restaurant.  I sat at the bar and ask the Sushi Chef for his recommends and ten minutes lates I had Salmon and Tuna Sashimi followed by a Firecracker Roll.  
The Firecracker roll was scallops and cucumber in the middle with spicy tuna on top.  Nice size and nice spice, enjoyed very much.  Sashimi was fresh, little small for the price, great with a bit of lemon.
I would come back and I would recommend.

excerpts: That was the mistake I made with my third choice, the appropriately priced $5 Avocado Roll which was just that, avocado rolled in rice and nori (photo: http://bit.ly/2KN9afH).
There wasn't enough flavor to make it interesting.
I didn't find anything offensive about Kippu, it just felt interchangeable with any number of J-Town eateries offering the exact same dishes.
roll.author: Ed U.
roll.review:
I've sat in front of this inconspicuous Japanese restaurant several times whenever I took a seat on one of the worn benches on the cobblestoned Buchanan Street plaza. I decided to give it a try one evening as I was leisurely strolling through Japantown and found it about half full of customers. I didn't have high expectations about the quality based on some of the Yelp feedback I read, and frankly that preconception helped me get through my meal without incident.

I decided on three smaller items off their menu, but to my pleasant surprise, they generously served me a miso soup and salad anyway (photo: http://bit.ly/2z8G2xR). My first item was the $8.50 Chicken Yakitori because I felt like having a couple of skewers of poultry (photo: http://bit.ly/2Kx8QVW). The meat alternated with scallions and red pepper, but the flavor was compromised by the gooey marinade. Better was the $12.50 Hamachi Kama which was yellowtail collar simply grilled with the skin left intact (photo: http://bit.ly/2KDjNVv).

The simpler, the better. That's why the kama worked for me, but sometimes simple is just too simple. That was the mistake I made with my third choice, the appropriately priced $5 Avocado Roll which was just that, avocado rolled in rice and nori (photo: http://bit.ly/2KN9afH). There wasn't enough flavor to make it interesting. I didn't find anything offensive about Kippu, it just felt interchangeable with any number of J-Town eateries offering the exact same dishes. Maybe that's good enough sometimes.

FOOD - 3 stars...middling Japanese fare with the kama the best of the plates I had
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...pretty standard decor for J-Town
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...a bit on the slow side
TOTAL - 3 stars...kinda nondescript for my taste

excerpts: Spicy Killer Roll: Not really spicy, more of a sriracha spice.
Spider roll:
Nice Roll:
Not so nice.
The last roll was something with imitation crab meat and avocado inside, and salmon and hamachi on top.
roll.author: Lily W.
roll.review:
Is pretty meh, but that's to be expected. When you go to Japantown, you're not going for the top of the line, absolutely best sushi. But you're looking to hit a craving.

Spicy Killer Roll: Not really spicy, more of a sriracha spice. The tuna on top was pretty decent.

Spider roll: Was solid, but spider rolls tend to be okay.

Nice Roll: Not so nice. The tempura shrimp was old, and really over battered. 

The last roll was something with imitation crab meat and avocado inside, and salmon and hamachi on top. Not bad, was relatively fresh.

The tako in the takoyaki was pretty good, though I wish they cooked the takoyaki a little longer. The dough was a little too raw-ish.


That being said, the service was really good and people were very attentive. If the owners splurged a little for fresher product, I think this place could be much better.

excerpts: We chose the rock and roll and the spicy killer roll.
Both of rolls were decent.
The spicy killer roll was an amped spicy tuna roll which tasted overwhelming of siracha, taking away from the flavor of the fish.
The spicy killer roll was an amped spicy tuna roll which tasted overwhelming of siracha, taking away from the flavor of the fish.
Rick and roll hit the spot for my fiance.
roll.author: Michelle C.
roll.review:
Came in during lunch on a Tuesday afternoon. I've walked by this place many times but have never tried the place. Feeling the hunger pains, my fiance and I decided to join the crowd inside and dine in for lunch.

They have a pretty extensive menu with countless rolls to choose from. Kinda reminds me of the neverending menu at cheesecake factory, indecisive eaters beware! That aside, we kept our choices simple. We chose the rock and roll and the spicy killer roll. Both of rolls were decent. The spicy killer roll was an amped spicy tuna roll which tasted overwhelming of siracha, taking away from the flavor of the fish. Rick and roll hit the spot for my fiance. Overall, the experience was okay. 

A bit overpriced for mediocre rolls with decent fish quality. Quick and speedy service, however they did forget our utensils. Waitress and host seemed quite busy and ready to turn over our tables the second we finished our meals.

Don't know if I'd be willing to revisit this place again given there are far better sushi places in the area for better prices.

excerpts: The sushi roll (salmon, tuna, crab, avocado) was very standard with no detail or presentation.
& I had ordered the same sushi roll as the couple I had seen.
roll.author: Julian I.
roll.review:
I was really disappointed by my visit to Kippu in Japan town. I ordered the Chicken udon soup along with some sushi. The soup hardly had any chicken. A few bits, perhaps 5 or 6 small bits. The soup wasn't very flavorful & hardly had any veg. The sushi roll (salmon, tuna, crab, avocado) was very standard with no detail or presentation.

The service was a rather hurried. I was not impressed. I had a look at what others were eating & I had ordered the same sushi roll as the couple I had seen. The bento boxes also didn't look like something I was keen on trying.

All in all there are many other places to try before I'd consider going back.

excerpts: Also tried the edamame and the hamachi roll.
The edamame were over cooked but plentiful - we actually didn't finish them.
The hamachi roll was fine - nothing super memorable but it tasted good in the moment.
The hamachi roll was fine - nothing super memorable but it tasted good in the moment.
roll.author: Amy R.
roll.review:
I think this place is pretty accurately rated at around 3-3.5 stars. The food is run-of-the-mill Japanese American cuisine! 

The restaurant is really small - definitely not wheelchair accessible. And there are some steps out front and inside. The space to go use the restroom is also very tight and around a sharp corner. 

We got a veggie bento box and a steak teriyaki bento box late on a Friday night. Also tried the edamame and the hamachi roll. 

Bento boxes were good and just as you'd expect. It seems vegetarians have quite a few options! 
The steak teriyaki was tender and not over cooked. The portion felt fair. 

The edamame were over cooked but plentiful - we actually didn't finish them. 

The hamachi roll was fine - nothing super memorable but it tasted good in the moment.

excerpts: Bf ordered chicken teriyaki bento and I ordered vegetarian 3 item bento with age-dashi tofu, veggie tempura, and avocado roll.
Paid $35 after tip.
roll.author: Tammy P.
roll.review:
My go-to place for bento boxes in SF!

1. Prices for the lunch bentos are the best value.
2. We recently went for dinner. Bf ordered chicken teriyaki bento and I ordered vegetarian 3 item bento with age-dashi tofu, veggie tempura, and avocado roll. Paid $35 after tip.
3. Bentos come with rice, salad, and miso soup.
4. One of our soups had a little bug/fly in it. Told the waitress and she replaced it, but who knows what she did with it.
5. Their salad dressing is the best!

excerpts: I ordered the cherry blossom roll and was not disappointed.
I loved the salmon as it was fresh, soft, and nicely cut.
roll.author: Manuela R.
roll.review:
Incredible sushi, terrible service. I ordered the cherry blossom roll and was not disappointed. I loved the salmon as it was fresh, soft, and nicely cut. However, the staff was on the rude side and things took a while to come out. 

If you're not in a rush and don't mind bad service, this is the spot for you.

excerpts: Flaming Dragon - I'm not much of a sushi roll person
but if you are, this is
a definite must try!
Baked salmon with avocado and crabmeat with a special sauce which reminds me of Lion King Roll(which is another good roll).
roll.author: Sono S.
roll.review:
I'd have to say, this place improved quite a bit.


Located in the heart of Japantown.


About 3 years ago I've tried this sushi joint and thought it was just okay. I decided to give it another try last week during the weekday and boy was I surprised! 

The First thing I noticed was the deco: they definitely cleaned up nicely compared to my last visit.

Second, the food presentation bumped up quite a bit! Dishes were wonderfully plated, meticulous even.

Third, most important of all it seemed as though they've improved on the quality of the ingredients. I wouldn't say it was the absolute best quality but reasonably decent for its price.


Things to try:

1. Flaming Dragon - I'm not much of a sushi roll person but if you are, this is a definite must try! Baked salmon with avocado and crabmeat with a special sauce which reminds me of Lion King Roll(which is another good roll). Doesn't hurt that it has a theatrical effect with the actual FLAME which adds a finishing touch to the baked flavors of the neatly aluminum wrapped roll(which they'll peel for you once the flame is out).

2. 22pc sashimi combo - This was my favorite. Of course pricier than sushi rolls, but the meticulous attention to detail and the fresh ingredients used made it my most memorable of my visit.

3. Vege Tempura - Again I'm not a big fan of tempura, but one member of my party wanted to try it so we decided to split it. I ended up grabbing a few pieces of my own and was delightfully surprised! Crisp, vegetables cooked to tenderness, solid tempura that made me craving for more!

4. Service was incredibly attentive, which is expected at a Japanese restaurant.





Overall: If you've made it this far in the review then I'd like to congratulate you :)




Kippu is a cute and modern sushi-stop with a twist of traditional charm. Nice job! 





Con:
Not good for big party, small dining room. 2-4ppl should fit comfortably.

excerpts: We ordered hirame, sake, unagi, tobiko and a una-q roll (might have been called "caterpiller roll", unagi with cucumber, topped with avocado).
We weren't expecting much from a Japanese restaurant right on the tourist strip, but Kippu's fish was really good.
Nice temperature, good texture and larger pieces than I would've expected.
roll.author: Jason G.
roll.review:
We sat at the sushi bar and were happily surprised. Kippu was the only open restaurant later in the evening that seemed more dedicated to sushi (with an actual sushi bar). We ordered hirame, sake, unagi, tobiko and a una-q roll (might have been called "caterpiller roll", unagi with cucumber, topped with avocado).   We weren't expecting much from a Japanese restaurant right on the tourist strip, but Kippu's fish was really good. Nice temperature, good texture and larger pieces than I would've expected. More importantly the sushi rice was a really well done: vinegar with just a touch of sweet, very similar to my own recipe. I'm pretty sure the place was Korean owned, which isn't a surprise these days in J-town.  

The service was a bit sparse, as it was two hosts/servers/bussers for maybe 15 tables and you could not order anything, even sushi, via the sushi bar.  So ordering, paying, etc., often had a bit more wait than expected. 

Overall, I was really happy with Kippu and would definitely stop in again.

excerpts: I had my california roll (which was grocery store quality).
roll.author: Rachel D.
roll.review:
They were the only spot open on New Year's Day. I know it's hard to be open on New Year's day BUT the service and food were both pretty bad. We were ignored at the hostess stand for a good 10 minutes. Finally we were acknowledged after I said something to the hostess. 

My husband ordered the sashimi lunch box and I got the teriyaki chicken (afraid to eat the sushi based on other reviews). His salmon sashimi was inedible. The sushi was so slimy and warm. He had me look at it and it looked pretty bad. He ate a little bit and confirmed it wasn't fit to eat. We ate the chicken and rice. I had my california roll (which was grocery store quality). 

When we were done I had to flag down the waiter for the bill. Once I got the bill from him, he never asked me if I needed a box. The bill was set to pay and he was still MIA. I went up to the hostess stand and had to ask for a box which took much longer. 

I know they were busy and it's a hard day to be open but this was a pretty bad experience. I didn't mention the sushi to the server but because they seemed so busy and kept ignoring us, I figured it wasn't even worth mentioning to them anyway.. or they would ignore me. 

I'm from the east coast so I probably won't ever be back here but I wanted to let folks know regardless. If there are other options, try elsewhere!

excerpts: Average a little undercooked salmon teriyaki and expensive California roll with fake crab.
roll.author: Jack R.
roll.review:
Super slow service when we're the only ones there. Super high prices for an average bento box.

Only in Japan Town would this place survive.

No refills on tea no extra napkins.

Average a little undercooked salmon teriyaki and expensive California roll with fake crab.

Ugh, only because I was hungry.

I'm giving this place 3 stars because the salmon portion was big, but not necessarily that good to want a second helping.

excerpts: The roll was a bit less flavorful but still reasonably good
overall a good place, strongly recommend, except for one small detail : pleaaase find another type of music than random radio hits and it'd be perf
roll.author: Louisa S.
roll.review: Stopped in Kippu after seeing all the other restaurants around were closed/had a waiting line and we don't regret it. Service was good and very fast, the menu is quite long and varied with many options of rolls, sushis, ramens, udons and bentos. We got the udon which was very tasty, def one of the best we've had since a long time. The roll was a bit less flavorful but still reasonably good  overall a good place, strongly recommend, except for one small detail : pleaaase find another type of music than random radio hits and it'd be perf

excerpts: I stopped in for a roll and did not realize until after I ordered that all crab meat was imitation... that is a big party foul in my book... tasted fine but not like crab.
I immediately referenced the menu and at the bottom in fine print read,  "All the crabs are imitation crab" I can get sushi like this in Oklahoma...
roll.author: Philip C.
roll.review: I stopped in for a roll and did not realize until after I ordered that all crab meat was imitation... that is a big party foul in my book... tasted fine but not like crab. I immediately referenced the menu and at the bottom in fine print read,  "All the crabs are imitation crab" I can get sushi like this in Oklahoma...

excerpts: I ordered a sushi roll (forgot the name)
but it was shaped as a flower blossom with salmon on the outside and tuna on the inside.
My mom ordered the beef bento box with sashmi.
I thought that my roll was very small.
The fish also did not taste super fresh.
The overall service was decent, it took time a while for us to get our bill.
I think the food here is just average, go across to the main plaza...
they have much better food!
roll.author: Andy L.
roll.review:
I should've checked Yelp before coming here. My mom suggested this restaurant because she came here with friends and really liked it. Kippu is located across the street from Japan Town in a less busy plaza. 

Walking in, there was a lot less people than you would find in your typical Japan Town eatery. I ordered a sushi roll (forgot the name) but it was shaped as a flower blossom with salmon on the outside and tuna on the inside. My mom ordered the beef bento box with sashmi. I thought that my roll was very small. The fish also did not taste super fresh. The overall service was decent, it took time a while for us to get our bill. I think the food here is just average, go across to the main plaza... they have much better food!

excerpts:
Karage chicken  is small like pop corn chicken
Sushi rolls are small , ordered the candy cane roll , 8 pieces size like California roll ...disappointed but there is only very few restaurant open around 9:30 pm at night
roll.author: Phoebe W.
roll.review:
Karage chicken  is small like pop corn chicken
Sushi rolls are small , ordered the candy cane roll , 8 pieces size like California roll ...disappointed but there is only very few restaurant open around 9:30 pm at night

excerpts:
Four Seasons Roll
2.

Love Roll
5.

Avocado Roll
6.

Hamachi Lover Roll
7.
Cherry Blossom Roll/Orange Blossom Roll
roll.author: Wolf B.
roll.review:
Never had a single issue, I've come here a dozen times and the sushi is always cold, I love the service and how everyone is so polite, KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK!!! :D I will support you guys full on.

~List of dishes I've tried~
1. Four Seasons Roll
2. Seaweed Salad
3. Vegetable Tempura/Shrimp Tempura
4. Love Roll
5. Avocado Roll
6. Hamachi Lover Roll
7. Miso Soup
8. Cherry Blossom Roll/Orange Blossom Roll

All Perfection! :)

excerpts: We got the rainbow roll, Philadelphia and cherry blossom.
All were great and had very reasonable pricing.
roll.author: Cameron W.
roll.review: Great sushi! The meal came with complimentary miso salad. Staff was nice and friendly and attentive. I definitely will come back again! We got the rainbow roll, Philadelphia and cherry blossom. All were great and had very reasonable pricing.

excerpts: Came on Friday afternoon, had the Titanic and Delicious Roll, very good.
Respectful and Quick service.
roll.author: Cyndi F.
roll.review: Came on Friday afternoon, had the Titanic and Delicious Roll, very good. Respectful and Quick service.

excerpts: The prices were standard sushi prices: $7-17 per roll.
The ambiance was standard modern sushi joint: bright colors and fast paced music in the background with plenty of natural and man made light with Asian decor.
The rolls themselves were good - nothing new, nothing very traditional, just, standard American sushi.
roll.author: Dan E.
roll.review: I'd call this restaurant the epitome of a 3 star rating. The service was friendly enough, but not great. Case in point: asked to get new edamame - the ones we were served were cold and had clearly been sitting for a while... they came back with our same edamame just microwaved. The prices were standard sushi prices: $7-17 per roll. The ambiance was standard modern sushi joint: bright colors and fast paced music in the background with plenty of natural and man made light with Asian decor. The rolls themselves were good - nothing new, nothing very traditional, just, standard American sushi.

excerpts: I am having the bento box with salmon teriyaki, tempura, and the California roll.
We also ordered the rock and roll sushi, which includes unagi, shrimp, and avocado.
roll.author: Rose Marie J.
roll.review: I am having the bento box with salmon teriyaki, tempura, and the California roll.  C is having mixed tempura.  We also ordered the rock and roll sushi, which includes unagi, shrimp, and avocado.

excerpts: We all enjoyed every roll ordered and felt they were of good quality.
roll.author: Marissa N.
roll.review: Six of us showed up and continued to order three or four rolls at a time till we were full, they were very friendly and attentive. We all enjoyed every roll ordered and felt they were of good quality.

excerpts: We had the giant roll and a roll with scallops which were quite tasty.
roll.author: Francine B.
roll.review: Walked through Japan town and decided on this place out of a dozen and glad we did. Love places that give you complimentary miso and salad! The teriyaki chicken box with rice, salad, miso soup and an assortment of tempura was enough for my two kids to share.  We had the giant roll and a roll with scallops which were quite tasty. The oyster shooter was not very warm and did not have any spice to it like I prefer. The Portions were good size except the Pepperfin which came with only 4 pieces and was about $12. It also had some flakes on top I didn't like and not enough sauce. That being said I really enjoyed the rolls and the staff was very nice and attentive. They had over 70 rolls to choose from and some that were pretty unique. I would go back here again when visiting.

excerpts: The Flaming Dragon Roll tasted like lighter fluid, couldn't even eat it.
roll.author: Dustin M.
roll.review: The Flaming Dragon Roll tasted like lighter fluid, couldn't even eat it. We also had gyoza, the bomb, and a couple other rolls. All just ok, not great. Wouldn't go back.

excerpts: I ordered their Daily Special A which comes with miso soup, salad, five pieces of nigiri, and california roll.
roll.author: Joshua M.
roll.review: I went to Kippu Japanese Cuisine on a Wednesday night to eat some good sushi. The service was great and friendly throughout the entire meal. I ordered their Daily Special A which comes with miso soup, salad, five pieces of nigiri, and california roll. The nigiri was great in that there was a high sashimi to rice ratio. The hamachi also tasted exceptionally well. For the affordable price, I enjoyed the meal very much with the wonderful hot tea as well.

excerpts: I had the Chicken teriyaki with California roll for $9.
Perfect amount of food and one of the best California rolls I've had in a while
roll.author: Matt M.
roll.review: Delicious, affordable lunch special. I had the Chicken teriyaki with California roll for $9. Perfect amount of food and one of the best California rolls I've had in a while

excerpts: I got the usual, California roll and pretty much another California roll with salmon and yellow tail on top.
They did offer a lot is specialty rolls, my friend got their fried golden gate roll.
It looked delicious!
roll.author: Brittany W.
roll.review:
When I heard that they have a Japantown in the city I had to get me some sushi!  My friend brought me here and the food wasn't that bad.  I got the usual, California roll and pretty much another California roll with salmon and yellow tail on top.  They offer a complimentary miso soup and salad to start your meal.  Don't go looking for a spoon either, we eat our soup just like they do in Japan haha.  Drink up!

The food is where the authentic culture ends.  The music selection was great but very American.  They did offer a lot is specialty rolls, my friend got their fried golden gate roll. It looked delicious!

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the dinner bento box special, and the California roll portion of his meal literally came with two pieces.
Finally, after sitting and waiting for our check for about 10 minutes after our plates had been cleared, we had to ask the waitress to please bring us our check, which took several more minutes.
When she finally arrived at our table, she brought us someone else's check, so we had to go up to the front counter and ask for our proper check.
We wanted to try a new restaurant in Japantown that we hadn't been to yet, so we chose this one.
Next time, we'll be going somewhere where we know we will receive good food AND good service.
roll.author: Molly I.
roll.review:
My boyfriend and I had dinner here last week. While the food was acceptable, the service was not. Our waitress was not very friendly, and seemed as if she wanted to be anywhere but there. We had to ask her for water, which is understandable given California's drought. However, what was not understandable or acceptable was why she gave us half-full glasses of tap water, while the tables near us had full glasses of water with ice cubes. The waitress did not offer to refill our glasses once we finished the half-full water glasses, so we kept having to repeatedly ask her for more water (which we received in a slow manner). My food was okay; I ordered the vegetarian bento box, which came with inari, vegetable tempura, miso soup, salad, and karrokes. The quantity of food I received for the price (around $13) was pretty good, and overall I enjoyed my dinner, with the exception of the inari tofu. It was soggy, hardly breaded and fried at all, and just tasted bad. My boyfriend ordered the dinner bento box special, and the California roll portion of his meal literally came with two pieces. Finally, after sitting and waiting for our check for about 10 minutes after our plates had been cleared, we had to ask the waitress to please bring us our check, which took several more minutes. When she finally arrived at our table, she brought us someone else's check, so we had to go up to the front counter and ask for our proper check. 
We wanted to try a new restaurant in Japantown that we hadn't been to yet, so we chose this one. Next time, we'll be going somewhere where we know we will receive good food AND good service.

excerpts: We ordered the Java roll, Dragon Roll and the Incredible roll...
As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream.
Each roll came with 8 small sushi pieces, kind of a lot of dough given the high $11-$13/roll price tag.
OK, $11-$13/roll is pretty standard at most Japanese joints, but usually sushi rolls come with 10-12 pieces, not a measly 8.
roll.author: Matthew L.
roll.review:
Looks can be deceiving is a common saying that usually describes people, but in this case describes Kippu. A few days ago, my friend and I were hungry and were craving sushi rolls. And since we were in Japantown, we popped by here and saw what looked mighty big sushi rolls as displayed by the pictures in the window. But in actuality the sushi rolls were pretty tiny - definitely not as big as how they were advertised on the window pictures! How disappointing. 

We ordered the Java roll, Dragon Roll and the Incredible roll... As well as a spicy tuna hand roll and salmon skin hand roll, and for dessert, a scoop of green tea ice cream. Meals come with miso soup (this was kind of bland...) and a side salad with sesame dressing (dressing is good).  I'll admit the food in general had pretty good seasoning and flavor (however the seafood tasted slightly fishy, meaning it wasn't super fresh), but I was just a little upset that the portions of the rolls were smaller than advertised.  Each roll came with 8 small sushi pieces, kind of a lot of dough given the high $11-$13/roll price tag.  OK, $11-$13/roll is pretty standard at most Japanese joints, but usually sushi rolls come with 10-12 pieces, not a measly 8. Meh, whatever.

Don't come here hungry and with very little money because you won't get full unless you order a lot.

excerpts: This is right place to have good roll sushi in Japan town..many choices of rolls and quick nice services.
They also not closing for lunch break between 2 to 5 as any other typical Japanese restaurant in town..
I got here Thursday around 3pm and ordered two rolls and fried chicken..
they were solid and tasty..
I will definitely come back here with my girlfriend
roll.author: Seung Jun L.
roll.review: This is right place to have good roll sushi in Japan town..many choices of rolls and quick nice services. They also not closing for lunch break between 2 to 5 as any other typical Japanese restaurant in town..I got here Thursday around 3pm and ordered two rolls and fried chicken..they were solid and tasty..I will definitely come back here with my girlfriend

excerpts: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.
The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).
The steak was dry and lightly sauced.
Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.
The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).
The steak was dry and lightly sauced.
Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.
roll.author: Leonard L.
roll.review:
Kippu Japanese
SF J-Town
3pm Thursday 16th April 2015
Three Stars

We had the dog so we couldn't eat inside so we ordered takeout.  I got the Number 9 Combination: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.  The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).    It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.  The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).  The steak was dry and lightly sauced. Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.

excerpts: The presentation was amazing but when I tried the roll it tasted like gasoline.
Me and my friend now feel nauseous, lightheaded and our stomach works.
If you get this roll check if there's a hole on the foil.
roll.author: Ian L.
roll.review: I recently ordered a flaming dragon around 7:30pm 07/31/17. The presentation was amazing but when I tried the roll it tasted like gasoline. Me and my friend now feel nauseous, lightheaded and our stomach works. If you get this roll check if there's a hole on the foil.

excerpts: The fish was very fresh, and the only roll we didn't really like was the Flaming Dragon.
It's apparently one of the most popular rolls, but I think that's only because it comes out in flames.
roll.author: Jenna G.
roll.review:
Great inexpensive sushi restaurant. I went here with my parents and we got 5 rolls for 3 people (I could have been fine with 4 but my dad wanted another). We went at 5pm on a Sunday (Fathers Day) and it was pretty empty and we got great service.

Atmosphere: right in japantown, very authentic. the waitstaff was very attentive in getting our orders, refilling our waters, and bringing us the food on time

Food: They bring you complimentary miso soup as soon as you sit down, and then house salad once you order your sushi! It was so great!! For our rolls, we got the carmen, delicious, double salmon, (another one I forgot) and then the flaming dragon. The fish was very fresh, and the only roll we didn't really like was the Flaming Dragon. It's apparently one of the most popular rolls, but I think that's only because it comes out in flames. The flames cook the fish, which makes it weird and not that good.

Overall: I would definitely come here again. I would love to try the bay scallop and lion king rolls (their other two most popular rolls).

excerpts: The Go Go Roll was especially tasty.
roll.author: Kate J.
roll.review: Delicious sushi, kind staff, and prompt service.  The atmosphere was nothing super special, but I was happy to stop here for dinner while visiting San Francsico.  The Go Go Roll was especially tasty.

excerpts: I ordered Sushi Combo C, which had 7 nigiris and a tekka roll, which costed $17, so the price is definitely on the high end.
roll.author: Henry L.
roll.review:
Fairly decent sushi. I ordered Sushi Combo C, which had 7 nigiris and a tekka roll, which costed $17, so the price is definitely on the high end. The sushi was ok, but wasn't exceptional as I had expected beforehand, and the variety is very narrow (all the nigiris in the combo were of red/white fish pieces--there was no color e.g. egg, octopus, fish roe etc, which was disappointing).

Would definitely recommend finding sushi elsewhere e.g. the conveyor belt sushi boat places, where you can find a much larger variety of fish selection

excerpts: I saw numerous individuals on yelp talking about the "flaming dragon" roll, so I opted to give that a try.
my friends ordered some other rolls to sample.
they bring the foil wrapped roll on FIRE which is visually appealing.
although I feel the roll itself while good, wasn't too much special.
roll.author: Jei C.
roll.review:
*churrs lightly* 
Ah Japantown. always a wonderful place to go for this cat. growing up nearby, trips to Japantown always meant that some good Japanese food would likely be a part of each trip.  whether it be a sit down meal at a restaurant, or a quick to go item from nijiya market, "J-Town" is all about good food.

I decided to take a venture to this little side restaurant with some friends of mine. I had seen Kippu before, but never got the chance to give them a try, so for the sake of adventure, I did. 

Kippu is a very cozy narrow restaurant that seems to have mostly younger people working there. I noticed that their menu had many wonderful pictures of the different sushi rolls they offered, and instantly I became quite excited to give a few a try. 

I saw numerous individuals on yelp talking about the "flaming dragon" roll, so I opted to give that a try. my friends ordered some other rolls to sample. and after a bit of a wait, we were served. 

of the numerous rolls we had, I feel that while they were quite good, some of the fish didn't taste very "fresh" to me. not that they were old or spoiled, just that I feel I have tasted fresher. maybe that's just the cat in me being picky, but that is my feeling. the flavor of the rolls we had were decent, nothing too crazy or overwhelming, basically your standard decent sushi. 

the flaming dragon I saw many speaking of is definitely a show piece! they bring the foil wrapped roll on FIRE which is visually appealing. although I feel the roll itself while good, wasn't too much special. 

service here is very nice and polite and they were very attentive to us which I highly appreciate. 

overall, I'd say that Kippu is a fairly priced sushi restaurant that isn't the best in the world, but isn't bad either! worth a shot if you are in japantown and don't want to go to one of the "main" restaurants in the mall. 
*Chirp!*

I was given the unagi rolll
and I brought it to the wait staff's attention.
They told me it was a dragon roll.
They came back a few seconds later and realized it wasn't and took the plate.
They told me it was a dragon roll.
They came back a few seconds later and realized it wasn't and took the plate.
However, the table they had given my dragon roll had already started eating it.
However, the table they had given my dragon roll had already started eating it.
Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.
