Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.
Just remake the roll for god sakes.
roll.author: Eric H.
roll.review:
We went in here and the food was decent. Rolls are big. Giving 1 star because they mixed my order up and refused to fix it. Part of my order was a dragon roll and another table behind us orderd an unagi roll. They both are similar except one has shrimp tempura inside while the other has crab.

I was given the unagi rolll and I brought it to the wait staff's attention. They told me it was a dragon roll. They came back a few seconds later and realized it wasn't and took the plate. However, the table they had given my dragon roll had already started eating it. Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.

Just remake the roll for god sakes.

excerpts: The roll we ordered had a decent amount of baked scallops on it, but this is not enough to come back!
Go to another place!
Good birthday memory.
Hahaha.
roll.author: Michelle N.
roll.review:
Yo, the food here sucks. You know when the man topping for all dishes is sriracha, they probably aren't the most skilled when it comes to culinary arts.

I chose this place for my birthday dinner with my sisters because it looked super cute from the outside. The wait staff and pleasing aesthetics earn the two stars.

The food was awful though. You'd think a restaurant can't go wrong with raw oysters...lol...each oyster was "decorated" with a dot of sriracha. Then we had the seared ahi tuna, again "decorated" with sricacha. The oyster shooters were somewhat bearable; this was a mix of mostly ponzu sauce and maybe a drop of sake with a quail egg and a very good sized oyster. My middle sister did gag on the ponzu mixture though. Hahaha.

The roll we ordered had a decent amount of baked scallops on it, but this is not enough to come back! Go to another place! Good birthday memory. Hahaha.

excerpts: We ended up eating just two rolls the Washington and the mountain roll...
They were just alright
they left the seeds in the lemon toppings.
Their service was really quick!
Thumbs up
roll.author: Pu B.
roll.review: When i walked into the restaurant i was wondering why it was so hot in there. We just ate some burgers so we were already full but we took a stroll through japan town and we stumbled upon this restaurant and my girlfriend and i will never ever say no to some sushi! I really really like how they give free miso soup and a salad in the beginning too. Its like a full course meal. We ended up eating just two rolls the Washington and the mountain roll... They were just alright they left the seeds in the lemon toppings. Their service was really quick! Thumbs up

excerpts: I would highly recommend getting the flaming roll and the lion king roll (one of the best lion king roles I've had in the city).
Very flavorful with a mix of sauces including mustard (tastes surprisingly good).
One thing I would critic is the service is not that great
roll.author: Kunal T.
roll.review:
I would highly recommend getting the flaming roll and the lion king roll (one of the best lion king roles I've had in the city). Very flavorful with a mix of sauces including mustard (tastes surprisingly good). One thing I would critic is the service is not that great it seems like it is a very rushed setting where their trying to get you in and out as fast as possible,

I love the location its in the center of Japan town with a lot of shopping and Fillmore street right around the corner.

Check it out for some good sushi in the city.

excerpts: $12.5 caterpillar roll only had really tiny pieces of unagi in there...
Double salmon roll's salmon didn't taste fresh...
Gyoza tasted bad...
roll.author: Jessie K.
roll.review: Super small portion for not so cheap prices. Paid $35 for two tiny rolls with small pieces of fish, and six pieces of Gyoza. Really disappointing. Food tasted meh... $12.5 caterpillar roll only had really tiny pieces of unagi in there... Double salmon roll's salmon didn't taste fresh... Gyoza tasted bad...

excerpts: The mammoth roll was absolutely wonderful!!
I could go back and order just that!
The poke that is served on top was delicious!
Highly recommend.
Great, fast and friendly service too.
roll.author: Malia R.
roll.review: Stayed overnight in Japantown and this place was recommended. The mammoth roll was absolutely wonderful!! I could go back and order just that! The poke that is served on top was delicious! Highly recommend.  Great, fast and friendly service too.

excerpts: We did see someone order the flaming dragon roll, which looked pretty impressive, but other than that, we'd probably opt for something different the next time we're in Japantown.
roll.author: Wayne H.
roll.review: Not great, not terrible, just average. The service was pretty fast, but also felt a little rushed. It was nice that we each got a salad and soup even though we just ordered a few rolls to share. The fish on the rolls were of varying quality, but overall it was not bad. The problem was the portions for the sushi rolls were a pretty small - even though there were plenty of pieces, each piece was like the size of a quarter. Sushi for ants, as my friend said. We did see someone order the flaming dragon roll, which looked pretty impressive, but other than that, we'd probably opt for something different the next time we're in Japantown.

excerpts: The sushi menu is basically a Willy Wonka wonderland for anyone who is sick of the basic California roll - if you're at all an indecisive freak like me, you will change your mind at least five times before the waitress comes to take your order and then change your mind while you are ordering.
I ended up getting the double salmon roll because mercury tastes delicious, and a vegetarian bento box on the side because vegetables and fibrous materials.
roll.author: Joy G.
roll.review:
The sushi menu is basically a Willy Wonka wonderland for anyone who is sick of the basic California roll - if you're at all an indecisive freak like me, you will change your mind at least five times before the waitress comes to take your order and then change your mind while you are ordering. I ended up getting the double salmon roll because mercury tastes delicious, and a vegetarian bento box on the side because vegetables and fibrous materials. The miso soup is really, really salty here, and I say that as someone who always finishes her complimentary miso soup. 

We decided to be annoying and asked for a seat in the back with the comfy lounge cushions instead of the rickety wooden chairs in the front. The waitress shook her head, saying that the back tables were only for parties of 10. It was 2 o'clock on a Wednesday. A party of 10 is not going to come strolling in and demand to be crammed around two tiny tables. I said so more or less, and she signed through her nose and said, sure, but only if we agree to move if a party of 10 comes in. It felt a little bizarre playing this passive-agro tug of war over a hypothetical party of 10 stragglers, but she lit up when we ordered 5 rolls and a ton of bento boxes. 

Two stars for delicious agedashi tofu. Yes, there is this layer of brown, umami goo caking the tofu. Yes, I was eyeing my friend's nabeyaki udon a bit wistfully. Yes, I ate too much and then had to wander through the mall in the Peace Plaza across the street arguing with myself (possibly aloud) if physical agony was worth green tea soft serve or a banana and nutella crepe. Thanks for having me, Japantown!

excerpts: I ordered a Mexican Roll and a spicy tuna roll.
The Mexican roll was actually pretty good.
It was made up of spicy crab meat, cucumber, avocado, and shrimp.
The Mexican roll was actually pretty good.
It was made up of spicy crab meat, cucumber, avocado, and shrimp.
The spicy tuna roll was weird.
Overwhelming and not consistent with any spicy tuna I've ever had before.
The spicy tuna roll was weird.
Overwhelming and not consistent with any spicy tuna I've ever had before.
roll.author: Priti K.
roll.review:
My friend and I showed up at dinner hour on a weekday. There weren't very many people in the restaurant, so it was pretty quiet. The menu is so extensive, so it took us a while to choose what we wanted - way to many sushi variations for when you're so hungry. The service here was really weird. Everything was so rushed. The server came over to our table a number of times while we were trying to decide and it just got kind of annoying. We'll tell you when we tell you. Please relax. 

I ordered a Mexican Roll and a spicy tuna roll. The Mexican roll was actually pretty good. It was made up of spicy crab meat, cucumber, avocado, and shrimp. The spicy tuna roll was weird. Overwhelming and not consistent with any spicy tuna I've ever had before. I think they overdid it with the amount of fish, too. 

The service was, again, very pushy. It seemed like they wanted us out of there and I couldn't understand why because there was barely anyone else in the restaurant. 

Overall, Kippu is pretty average in both food and just pretty weird in service. Hmm. I look forward to trying a bunch of the other sushi restaurants in Japantown. This ended up being a pretty mediocre intro to the area.

excerpts: I ordered a california roll and a scallop lovers roll.
Keeping up with their theme, the California roll came super hot!
WHY IS IT HOT!
Keeping up with their theme, the California roll came super hot!
WHY IS IT HOT!
The Scallop lovers roll which was supposed to be baked was hardly so and the mayo sauce on top was so gross.
Oh god.
Why.
I saw they had toro on sale for $15
roll.author: Tiffany V.
roll.review:
Everyone is aware sushi in Japantown is a total joke right? I would never eat here in a million years if I had the choice but my grandma lives across the street and our options are limited within walking distance. 

Decided to give this place a try since its one of the few places I haven't gone to yet and it was one of the worst. Service is SO FUCKING SLOW. There is one woman working and it seriously seems like you are bothering her by asking her for water since she hasn't refilled your glass once in the 90 degree humid as fuck space imitating as a Japanese restaurant. The other reviewers aren't kidding when they say its hot in here. There was a small fan at our table we couldn't figure out how to turn on and when I asked the waitress if she could turn it on for us she just looked at us and said we could do it ourselves. Um what. 

I ordered a california roll and a scallop lovers roll. Keeping up with their theme, the California roll came super hot! WHY IS IT HOT! The Scallop lovers roll which was supposed to be baked was hardly so and the mayo sauce on top was so gross. Oh god. Why. I saw they had toro on sale for $15 but I would never trust a place like this for their toro. 

Avoid at all costs plz. Japantown has yet to cease to fail me.

excerpts: Lunch special 5 PC nigiri and California roll
Salmon and tuna was fresh whereas the other nigiri had veins( poor cuts).
For the $12.95, it was a good deal.
roll.author: Daniel W.
roll.review:
Lunch special 5 PC nigiri and California roll
Salmon and tuna was fresh whereas the other nigiri had veins( poor cuts). For the $12.95, it was a good deal.

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the Ferrari and the Sex and the City roll and loved it.
He couldn't stop raving about it as we were eating.
His rolls were delicious with just the right amount of spice.
roll.author: Laura D.
roll.review: Food was good and service was quick. My boyfriend ordered the Ferrari and the Sex and the City roll and loved it. He couldn't stop raving about it as we were eating. His rolls were delicious with just the right amount of spice. We also had the beef teriyaki,gyoza, tempura box and it was very yummy. It was better than average for sure. Thanks Japantown!

excerpts: I came here with a friend for lunch on a Friday and got the Banzai roll, which is deep fried shrimp, avocado, and cucumber with mamenori, which is like a yellow paper, wrapped on the outside.
roll.author: Erika S.
roll.review:
FOOD:

I came here with a friend for lunch on a Friday and got the Banzai roll, which is deep fried shrimp, avocado, and cucumber with mamenori, which is like a yellow paper, wrapped on the outside. I wasn't too impressed, especially since the wrap covered any texture of the sushi.

SERVICE: 

It was pretty quiet when we entered, so we got a table by the window.

The servers were a bit quiet, but it was fine. They weren't particularly friendly, so we just ordered and paid after we finished. The overall experience was that we pretty much just ate our sushi and we were on our way.

excerpts: My favorite dishes were the Dynamite Roll (deep fried spicy tuna & avocado), the Spicy Killer (spicy tuna, cucumber covered w/ white tuna), and the Peppercorn Seared Tuna with garlic sauce.
Dinner started with a generous bowl of miso - which is a great palate opener.

While I had a relatively small helping of food (due to an all-day tummy ache), my dining companions went to town with the Udon (heart bowls of soup filled with your choice of chicken, meat, pork, and veggies, and thick noodles).
Everyone raved about their selection.
roll.author: Kevin B.
roll.review:
We dined here after a relaxing spa excursion at Kabuki Springs. We had discovered this place in a Yelp search for Japanese restaurants. Once again, Yelpers steered us in the right direction!

This is some of the tastiest sushi and and udon around. The place is kind of tiny. And once you walk inside, you feel like you're actually in Tokyo, far removed from SF. 

Our group shared a bunch of sushi and salads. My favorite dishes were the Dynamite Roll (deep fried spicy tuna & avocado), the Spicy Killer (spicy tuna, cucumber covered w/ white tuna), and the Peppercorn Seared Tuna with garlic sauce. Dinner started with a generous bowl of miso - which is a great palate opener. While I had a relatively small helping of food (due to an all-day tummy ache), my dining companions went to town with the Udon (heart bowls of soup filled with your choice of chicken, meat, pork, and veggies, and thick noodles). Everyone raved about their selection. So I'll need to come back again to taste it for myself.

One small warning - contrary to their website, Kippu no longer serves ramen. So if you're in the mood for ramen, you'll have to go somewhere else.

All in all, Kippu was a lovely Japantown discovery. I think I'll probably return here the next time I see a movie at the Sundance Kabuki Theater.

excerpts: At her suggestion, I ordered one roll, something with spicy tuna.
And, of course the waitress pushed me to order more.
Based upon the photos and high price, I thought one roll was sufficient.
But, the waitress insisted otherwise and further pressured that the kitchen was now closed -- it was only 9:22pm.
So, I also ordered a spicy tuna hand roll and croquets.
The spicy tuna hand roll was nothing to write home about and a bit fishy.
The moment I took the last bite the waitress, knowing I had another roll coming, swiped my plate, ginger, wasabi, and soy sauce.
Then set down the croquets which were average.
Again, my roll had fake crab and spicy tuna.
It tasted worse than a cheap roll from the grocery store and cost $16.
It was not fresh or worth the price charged.
roll.author: Kiki I.
roll.review:
I had an awful experience here with my friend.  The food literally made me sick.

My friend I arrived at 9:20pm, which seemed like plenty of time given that the restaurant allegedly closes at 10:00pm.  With in two seconds of seating we were told to order within the next five minutes because the kitchen was closing.  Ok.  A minute later the waitress was back demanding our order.  It is a large menu and we did not even have time to read it.

Then we ordered.  The waitress talked my friend into ordering two rolls that basically were fried California rolls.  I had not even read half the menu, so I asked the waitress for a recommendation.  At her suggestion, I ordered one roll, something with spicy tuna.  And, of course the waitress pushed me to order more.  Based upon the photos and high price, I thought one roll was sufficient.  But, the waitress insisted otherwise and further pressured that the kitchen was now closed -- it was only 9:22pm.  So, I also ordered a spicy tuna hand roll and croquets. 

Well they must have had items pre-made because the next thing we knew they were throwing food on the table and taking it away faster than we could eat it.  The waitress failed toe toon that everything comes with miso soup and salad.  When they both unexpectedly arrived, we officially knew we were swindled into ordering too much food.  

The spicy tuna hand roll was nothing to write home about and a bit fishy.  The moment I took the last bite the waitress, knowing I had another roll coming, swiped my plate, ginger, wasabi, and soy sauce.  Then set down the croquets which were average.  As soon as the croquets cooled they were disgusting and they got cold fast.  

Then the rolls came.  My friend's rolls were average fried and expensive California rolls that were made with fake crab at real crab prices.  She was upset because the waitress clearly pushed her to over order as well and the once the rolls cooled off they were gross.  Again, my roll had fake crab and spicy tuna. It tasted worse than a cheap roll from the grocery store and cost $16.  It was not fresh or worth the price charged.  In fact, I asked for a beer to wash it down and didn't finish it.

The service was so rude.  They started putting chairs up on tables around us at 9:30pm.  This is inappropriate because the restaurant is open until 10:00pm and, more importantly, there were guests still waiting for food.  We left well before 10:00pm and the lights were off and the staff was walking out too -- seriously change your hours to reflect the restaurants actual closing time.   If the rushed service, bad service, and fact that the restaurant closed before completing its food service wasn't bad enough, our waitress was not friendly and purposely oversold us on food.  Maybe that works with tourists, but we live here and expect a more honest approach.

To make matters worse, by the time I got home, I was violently ill.  I think it was the fishy tuna.  Let's just say it was a long and unpleasant night of my body physically ejecting what I ate there.  Miserable.  I think it had to be the fishy tuna because my friend did not feel well, but was not violently ill.

Maybe it was an off night for this place, but either way they got me really sick and that is really not ok.

excerpts: Get the flaming dragon roll!
Not only does it taste amazing
it comes with a show!
The service was quick and friendly.
The wait staff worked together to take care of us.
They were fairly busy but the food came quickly and it was all wonderful.
roll.author: Megan R.
roll.review: Get the flaming dragon roll!  Not only does it taste amazing it comes with a show!   The service was quick and friendly. The wait staff worked together to take care of us. They were fairly busy but the food came quickly and it was all wonderful. Fresh fish in the sushi,  crispy tempura,  great sauce on the salmon teriyaki. A must try restaurant if you're in Japan town!

excerpts: I had ordered another roll..
I tried the delicious roll and it had a good taste and texture to it, so that made things a BIT better -- still doesn't make up for my flameless roll though.
grrrrr
roll.author: Lisa L.
roll.review:
I am so sad as I write this... It's not worth taking off a star but omg... after all the times I've been here with my girlfriend (I only go here with her) we FINALLY ordered the flaming dragon for the first time (for me, I always fall on her alternative day where she ordered it previous and decided to take a break from it) AND THERE WAS NO FLAME.  The waiter came over with it wrapped in foil and I was thinking, "oh. is he going to light it now?" NOPE, NOT SIR. IT WAS DONE AND HE JUST UNWRAPPED IT.  I don't know if it was because of that, it didn't even taste that great to me.  VERY VERY Disappointed. 

Thank goodness I had ordered another roll.. I tried the delicious roll and it had a good taste and texture to it, so that made things a BIT better -- still doesn't make up for my flameless roll though. grrrrr

excerpts: I ordered the beef teryaki and california roll lunch combo.
Food was pretty good.
roll.author: Lydia H.
roll.review: Great service and received my to-go order quickly. I ordered the beef teryaki and california roll lunch combo. Food was pretty good.

excerpts: We ordered the Flaming Dragon Roll ($15) and the Mountain Roll ($11).
roll.author: Shee X.
roll.review: Sushi was delicious, flavorful, and fresh! We ordered the Flaming Dragon Roll ($15) and the Mountain Roll ($11). We also received complimentary miso soup and salad, which was nice and tasty as well. Would definitely recommend Kippu if you are in Japantown.

excerpts: I ordered the Takoyaki and 4 Seasons roll.
Ate 1 Takoyaki out of 5 and didn't finish my 4 Seasons because it made me a little nauseous.
The scallops were raw (I hate raw fish/shellfish) normally when I order an item with scallops, they are cooked.
Guess I just ordered the wrong item on the menu.
I ate 2 leftover pieces from my brother's Spider roll, and it was again mediocre.
Nothing special about this place, I left pretty hungry still.
Won't be coming back.
roll.author: Vy T.
roll.review: Went to eat lunch here with my family. Service was ok, food wasn't good. Server checked on us alot, but didn't get us a coke that we ordered until the end of our meal (we had to ask again because she didn't even remember we ordered a coke), and it all felt rushed because she did everything quickly and spoke very fast. I ordered the Takoyaki and 4 Seasons roll. Ate 1 Takoyaki out of 5 and didn't finish my 4 Seasons because it made me a little nauseous. The scallops were raw (I hate raw fish/shellfish) normally when I order an item with scallops, they are cooked. Guess I just ordered the wrong item on the menu. I ate 2 leftover pieces from my brother's Spider roll, and it was again mediocre. Nothing special about this place, I left pretty hungry still. Won't be coming back.

excerpts: The miso soups were complimentary which was nice and we got the oysters, the mountain roll, the scallop bay roll and titanic.
The first roll that came was the rainbow roll which wasn't what we ordered
and so we let it sit there till our server came so we can tell her that it isn't what we ordered.
Later on, she dropped off the titanic and scallop bay roll which was good and then later dropped off the mountain roll.
Here's when things get a bit frustrating.
She was the only server and she running around frustrated which I understood cause business started picking up but
Later on, she dropped off the titanic and scallop bay roll which was good and then later dropped off the mountain roll.
Here's when things get a bit frustrating.
She was the only server and she running around frustrated which I understood cause business started picking up but
when she dropped off the mountain roll, I guess she didn't realize that it wasn't the mountain roll to begin with
and it took her awhile to come check back with us.
And we were patiently waiting, so patient to the point where we finished our first two rolls and our oysters that weren't even pleasant.
Once she came, my friend and I were telling her that this isn't what we ordered and she tried to tell us that it was and we showed her the picture
and she said, "it has this this and this" and then we pointed it out that it didn't have the certain toppings on it,
so she asked us if we wanted those toppings on it and we said yes
and she went and did that for us.
I mean the issue wasn't about whose right and whose wrong
but if you're gonna advertise something as this then don't bring it out something as something different you know?
Overall cute little place, would I recommend this place to anyone?
Eh, I don't think so.

and it took her awhile to come check back with us.
And we were patiently waiting, so patient to the point where we finished our first two rolls and our oysters that weren't even pleasant.

Overall cute little place, would I recommend this place to anyone?
Eh, I don't think so.
roll.author: Chantille T.
roll.review: It was a Thursday afternoon, me and my friend were trying to look for a decent sushi place around Japantown and stumble across Kippu, so we decided to check it out. Came into the establishment and was seated right away, looked through the menus and the waitress comes over and asks us if we are ready to order. We weren't ready yet so we started off with two cokes. Once we were ready, we ordered 3 rolls, an appetizer and some miso soups. The miso soups were complimentary which was nice and we got the oysters, the mountain roll, the scallop bay roll and titanic. The first roll that came was the rainbow roll which wasn't what we ordered and so we let it sit there till our server came so we can tell her that it isn't what we ordered. Later on, she dropped off the titanic and scallop bay roll which was good and then later dropped off the mountain roll. Here's when things get a bit frustrating. She was the only server and she running around frustrated which I understood cause business started picking up but when she dropped off the mountain roll, I guess she didn't realize that it wasn't the mountain roll to begin with and it took her awhile to come check back with us. And we were patiently waiting, so patient to the point where we finished our first two rolls and our oysters that weren't even pleasant. Once she came, my friend and I were telling her that this isn't what we ordered and she tried to tell us that it was and we showed her the picture and she said, "it has this this and this" and then we pointed it out that it didn't have the certain toppings on it, so she asked us if we wanted those toppings on it and we said yes and she went and did that for us. I mean the issue wasn't about whose right and whose wrong but if you're gonna advertise something as this then don't bring it out something as something different you know? Overall cute little place, would I recommend this place to anyone? Eh, I don't think so.

excerpts: The orange blossom special roll, Cucumber salad, California roll and avocado roll.
The pieces were well sized.
roll.author: Natascha G.
roll.review:
We came on a Thursday night. Most of the tables were occupied, but due to the good size we had no trouble being seated.
The sushi is fresh and the service courteous.  
We ordered salmon, tuna and shrimp sushi. The orange blossom special roll, Cucumber salad, California roll and avocado roll.
The pieces were well sized.

excerpts: My friend ordered the tonkatsu with California roll.
I did not have high hopes for this restaurant (as Japanese restaurants in Japantown don't have the best food ironically).
roll.author: Lillian C.
roll.review:
This restaurant is conveniently located in the middle of Japantown in SF. 

I came here for lunch and ordered the lunch special bento box with sashimi and salmon teriyaki. My friend ordered the tonkatsu with California roll. I did not have high hopes for this restaurant (as Japanese restaurants in Japantown don't have the best food ironically). However, the salmon sashimi was pretty fresh and tasty; the salmon teriyaki was decent as well (a little overdone but the teriyaki sauce was flavorful and not overkill). The tonkatsu (Chicken katsu) was too dry making the meat too tough. 

Overall, I'd come back but the food is just okay and not worth a trip on its own.

excerpts: We only ordered a few small rolls and a hand roll
and they were chock full of fresh, delicious fish, and my unagi hand roll had 4 big pieces of bbq eel in it.
roll.author: Margot D.
roll.review:
Stumbled on this place while being a tourist and wandering through Japantown.

Atmosphere was great - not too big, pretty private areas for seating in spite of being one big room.

Menu was great - lots of Nigiri Sushi options, special rolls and basic ones too. 

Great quality and volume of food for the prices.

Quality and volume of food was excellent - rolls were decent in size, very evenly diced tiny vegetables in vegetarian rolls, and extremely fresh. We only ordered a few small rolls and a hand roll and they were chock full of fresh, delicious fish, and my unagi hand roll had 4 big pieces of bbq eel in it. The other surprise - was that we each received a miso soup and a salad in spite of only ordering ~$10 worth of sushi each.

Service was excellent and fast - rolls came out quickly, servers were attentive and answered questions about the different rolls.

excerpts: The California roll was very good.
roll.author: Pedro D.
roll.review:
I agree all the negative reviews about this place.. I have been a loyal customer for a long time and I want to point something very dangerous about their food serving lately..
As I was eating my food my wife noticed the chicken surfaced half pink and God knows what could happen if she didn't tell me..  
1- The California roll was very good.
2-Their side salad was very fresh and tasty.
3-Their server seems nice,but they don't clean your table special when going back to their kitchen with  their hand empty and they don't know how to run the floor.
4-My wife got her food and mine dish came 25 minute after she eat half hers....

excerpts: I had a King's roll, she had a crunchy roll.
They weren't serving Beto boxes, maybe due to the Presidents' Day holiday.
roll.author: Noah C.
roll.review: My daughter and I had a quick lunch here today. The food was great and the service was excellent. I had a King's roll, she had a crunchy roll. They weren't serving Beto boxes, maybe due to the Presidents' Day holiday.

excerpts: We ordered an Orange Blossom, Victoria Secret roll, a bento and an 18 piece shashimi combo- which all was individually cheap compared to other sushi restaurants I've been to.
roll.author: Jordan T.
roll.review:
It's always an adventure when I travel to the city. When ever I go, I either get lost trying to go somewhere or try a new place with good ratings on yelp. This time it was both.

Not knowing where we were, my friend and I decided to park near what we hoped was Japantown to find a place to eat. This was the very first place we stumbled upon and after a short hesitation we decided to give 'er a try (I lived in OK, sorry). 

Anyway, we walked in and it wasn't hard to tell they were swamped with customers. Loud screams and shouts telling us where to sit came from what seemed to be the owner of the restaurant. (which didn't really bother me)

But we sat at the bar and looked through the menu while an older, drunk Japanese couple left the bar and dumped a $60 tip into the chefs jar. With that, my expectations rose.

We ordered an Orange Blossom, Victoria Secret roll, a bento and an 18 piece shashimi combo- which all was individually cheap compared to other sushi restaurants I've been to.

Sadly the food took over 30 minutes to get to us- and I was afraid the waiter who tended us was swamped and forgot to give the chefs our order. But after maintaining some patience we finally received our food which made up for it's wait.

Everything was incredibly fresh which surprised me being that all of it was so cheap.

The rolls were very tasty- and I was sad when it was over.

The tempura on the bento was cooked to near perfection (some of the best tempura I've had in a while). And the noodles were awesome.

And lastly, we were given a complimentary salad from one of the chefs. I don't know if this was for the wait, just something the bar got, or just for a good tip. 

Well if it was for a tip, it worked- but of course the salad alone didn't do it. With the fresh, inexpensive food and the caring, entertaining chefs- (one almost stabbed the other and a hilarious conversation between them ensued)- I left this place full and satisfied. 

Maybe again some day when you guys aren't so busy!

3/5

excerpts: Amazing selection (dozens and dozens of roll options).
They even have a good veggie section!
Super fast service.
roll.author: Dan F.
roll.review: Great sushi. Amazing selection (dozens and dozens of roll options). They even have a good veggie section! Super fast service. They start you off with complementary miso soup and a salad. Been here a few times and have left sated and happy each time!

excerpts: Atleast not how this roll was done.
There was a plethora of 4 sauces...too much in my opinion.
roll.author: Christine E.
roll.review: Meh. Hungry and in a pinch it worked, but I don't think mustard ever has a place on sushi rolls. Atleast not how this roll was done. There was a plethora of 4 sauces...too much in my opinion.

excerpts: but you can never go wrong with a 49er roll.
Service was great and will definitely be coming back here.
roll.author: Lesley M.
roll.review: Me and my friend came here the day before Valentine's day and we were seated right away. It was about 8pm at that time. They served us complimentary miso soup and salad. I'm not sure if it's always like that but they said it was free so yay for us! My friend got the Flaming Dragon and I got the 49ers. Didn't really like the smokey taste of the Flaming Dragon but you can never go wrong with a 49er roll. Service was great and will definitely be coming back here.

excerpts: Because we knew the owner he surprised us with the flaming dragon roll which comes on out on a plate on fire and even though we tend to not like cooked sushi this roll was delicious, I recommend it to everyone.
roll.author: Guisela L.
roll.review: First official review for me...awesome. Ok so let me start with my family is friends with the owner here but that won't stop me from writing an honest review. The location is conveniently right off the street and its nestled in a cute corner like location. The place is clean and the staff greeted us with a warm welcome even before they knew that we knew the owner. Overall the food was pretty good and everything tasted fresh. We ordered everything from nigiri, sashimi, hwe dub bap (Korean style sushi bowl) and dessert. Because we knew the owner he surprised us with the flaming dragon roll which comes on out on a plate on fire and even though we tend to not like cooked sushi this roll was delicious, I recommend it to everyone. We also received miso soup and salad which are the usual tasting fare but I was happy to receive it in any case. We also got hot and cold sake, the hot sake went down really smooth and the cold sake had these interesting gold flakes in it, but both were good. The staff were quick to remove plates and to refill all of our drinks. Overall a wonderful experience, the only reason why I couldn't give 5 stars is that this isn't the BEST sushi I've ever had but this business is certainly deserving of 4 solid stars. I will return.

excerpts: Washington roll is good
roll.author: Regi K.
roll.review:
Don't order the chewy beef aka beef teriyaki.   

Washington roll is good if you're in the mood for salmon

everything else is really okay... kinda typical fare.  nothing special.

excerpts: Ordered up a bunch of rolls with some coworkers - and this place did not disappoint - especially the FLAMING DRAGON roll.
I thought setting a sushi roll on fire was going to be super gimmecky, but it was awesome from both a taste and experience perspective.
roll.author: Helen C.
roll.review:
We played some sushi roulette during a recent conference and lucked out with a great lunch at Kippu.  Ordered up a bunch of rolls with some coworkers - and this place did not disappoint - especially the FLAMING DRAGON roll.  I thought setting a sushi roll on fire was going to be super gimmecky, but it was awesome from both a taste and experience perspective.

Everything we ate was fresh, tasty and served speedily during lunch time - if I find myself back in this part of town, I'll definitely be back!

excerpts: I also enjoyed part of my wife's dish the Teryaki chicken with California roll and deep fried veggies.
Ive never seen portions this huge in a Japanese restaurant; it was like a hungry mans restaurant.
The waiter was nice.
It is a little pricey but it was absolutely worth it to me.
Quite possibly the best Japanese food Ive ever eaten.
It was really that good.
I wish I knew the names of the dishes
but Im not very well versed in Japanese cuisine.
roll.author: David S.
roll.review:
My first time here. The prices were very reasonable for the amount of food you get. My wife and I loved it. The Wasabi salad is great, we ordered a dish called The Bomb which is deep fried Jalapenos in some kind of sauce. I had the breaded pork which came with a salad and potato salad. The flavors and sauces that came with the food were also great. I also enjoyed part of my wife's dish the Teryaki chicken with California roll and deep fried veggies. Ive never seen portions this huge in a Japanese restaurant; it was like a hungry mans restaurant. The waiter was nice. It is a little pricey but it was absolutely worth it to me. Quite possibly the best Japanese food Ive ever eaten. It was really that good. I wish I knew the names of the dishes but Im not very well versed in Japanese cuisine.
You also get some really tasty Miso soup before you order.. All in all I was pleased and very full. I guess portions depend on what you order. The dinner tray dishes are packed with food though...Even Godzilla would be full from eating there !

she then bring over a unagi roll with crab in it even though she told me it only have unagi and avocado.

roll.review:
haven't been here forever but i guess it changed hands many times.

service was terrible, asked for a unagi roll and asked what was in it, she went and asked the chef and came back saying it's unagi and avocado.  she then bring over a unagi roll with crab in it even though she told me it only have unagi and avocado.  i said you told me it's unagi and avocado and she looked like that conversation never took place.  we also asked for the unagi sauce to be on the side and it showed up with unagi sauce all over the roll, soaked.  when i asked her, she was like, it's not me, it's the guy making the sushi.  see, i wrote here, sauce on the side.  he didn't do it, it's his fault.  i was like wtf.  who cares who fucked up, someone fucked up.  fix it!  but no, that offer was never made.

excerpts: Ordered 49er roll, Carmen, Crunch roll which were all delicious.
Volcano bowl which was the breaded fried scallops were sooo yummy the gyoza I should of asked for pan fried they were just ok have had better.
Overall great service, quick very nice staff
and it was a pleasant find!
roll.author: Dana W.
roll.review: Walking through the area on our way to a concert at the Fillmore we decided to walk into this little restaurant and give it a try. We were greeted with a complimentary bowl of miso soup which was tasty. Edamame is served cold which I prefer hot but it was ok. Ordered 49er roll, Carmen, Crunch roll which were all delicious. Volcano bowl which was the breaded fried scallops were sooo yummy the gyoza I should of asked for pan fried they were just ok have had better. Overall great service, quick very nice staff and it was a pleasant find!

excerpts: This is my first time here, but the Lion King Roll, Sashimi Combo and Sake lunch we had was delicious!
roll.author: Rafael C.
roll.review: Three Stars??? This is my first time here, but the Lion King Roll, Sashimi Combo and Sake lunch we had was delicious!

excerpts: Pitchers for only $12 lured me through the door, Flaming Dragon and Ferrari Roll are worth trying....
roll.author: Mar E.
roll.review: Pitchers for only $12 lured me through the door, Flaming Dragon and Ferrari Roll are worth trying....

excerpts: 2) Ordered a spicy tuna hand roll, which came out promptly but with no wasabi.
I certainly didn't expect to be there for almost an hour for just a cold soba with tempura and a hand roll.
roll.author: Bern H.
roll.review:
I want to like this place. It's close by and the first time I went was for lunch and the donkatsu was pretty good and service was fine.

I went again recently for dinner and the overall experience was terrible. Hey, restaurants get swamped and honest mistakes are bound to happen. The kicker was the manner in which they handled what they knew was a terrible dining experience for a customer.

1) Walked in and got a seat at the sushi bar. About 10 minutes passed when an older lady asked if I had already ordered. I told them I didn't even get a menu.

2) Ordered a spicy tuna hand roll, which came out promptly but with no wasabi. 

3) At the same time, also ordered a tempura cold soba. And waited.

4) And waited some more. After about 30 mins, one of the guy workers asked what else am I waiting for and I told him the zaru soba with tempura. He yells it into the kitchen. Tempura comes out 10 minutes later. Soba comes out another 5 minutes later.  They tasted decent.

6) Another 10 mins pass,and  an older worker (maybe the owner?) apologizes for the long wait and gives me a side salad that is supposed to come with the soba dinner set. 

7) Side salad has a jagged sharp piece of plastic over an inch long in there which did go in my mouth. I mention it to one of the waitresses who gives it to the guy at the cashier's area...who just seemed to bury the evidence without a care (throw in the trash and pretend it didn't happen). I told the waitress to give my check and inform the older lady (owner?). She does and the lady comes over and just looks kind of surprised and flustered but unapologetic.  No mention of anything to make up for the bad experience. I promptly left. 

Normally, I try to base the review mostly on food taste and minimally on service unless it's a fine restaurant. And maybe it was a one-off but it's pretty hard to be a fan of the restaurant after that experience. I certainly didn't expect to be there for almost an hour for just a cold soba with tempura and a hand roll.

excerpts: I was sold the first time I had the flaming dragon roll.
It's one of a kind and absolutely delicious.
roll.author: Jennifer L.
roll.review: I think the variety and innovation demonstrated by the menu makes this place a winner. I was sold the first time I had the flaming dragon roll. It's one of a kind and absolutely delicious.

excerpts: The flaming dragon roll and Ferrari roll are my favorite so far!
The service was great and food was great!
The waiter was really cute too
Also, while I was waiting I saw that they had a certificate of excellence!!!
Highly recommended!
roll.author: Janice H.
roll.review: This was my first time eating at this restaurant and I didn't know what to order because there were so many to choose. Out server named Bryan helped us out with what to order and they were all delicious! The flaming dragon roll and Ferrari roll are my favorite so far! The service was great and food was great! The waiter was really cute too =D. Also, while I was waiting I saw that they had a certificate of excellence!!! Highly recommended!

excerpts: Cherry blossom roll was perfect!
The food came out quick and it tasted fresh.
Everyone in my party loved their food: tea, California roll, Bento box, teriyaki...
roll.author: Carla L.
roll.review: Cherry blossom roll was perfect!  The food came out quick and it tasted fresh.  Miso soup was good too.  Everyone in my party loved their food: tea, California roll, Bento box, teriyaki...

excerpts: The scallop roll......everything were beyond belief good.
The place is pretty busy.
Low key.
The sushi chefs are super fast and nice.
We happened to wander in during the Cherry Blossom Fest so it was super busy.
They were very fast, delicious and had great prices.
Unusual rolls.
Can't remember all of them.
Totally different and unique.
Love this place!!!!!
roll.author: Elisa B.
roll.review: Flaming Dragon and reasonable prices rock!  The scallop roll......everything were beyond belief good.  The place is pretty busy.  Low key. The sushi chefs are super fast and nice. We happened to wander in during the Cherry Blossom Fest so it was super busy. They were very fast, delicious and had great prices.  Unusual rolls. Can't remember all of them.  Totally different and unique.  Love this place!!!!!

excerpts: Absolutely awesome best sushi and most amazing date ever there love roll.
Everything was great
roll.author: Michael M.
roll.review: Absolutely awesome best sushi and most amazing date ever there love roll. Everything was great

excerpts: And the roll itself was good, the sauce made the roll.
Victoria Secret had a awesome crunch to it.
I would order 5 or 6 of those and eat way more.
The Ferrari roll was okay.
Melts in your mouth but nothing I would order again.
Ordered dessert ...
I kinda was expecting the mochi to be maybe bigger?
Not something out of a trader joes box but that's just me.
I could live without.
We also ordered oyster shooters (I probably wont do that again)
it tasted weird but only because I've never had one.
The raw oysters were good.
roll.author: Nathalie N.
roll.review:
First time- Walked by on a whim and decided to give it a try.

I have to say customer service was good. Our waiter was attentive and took care of us well whenever we needed anything. Made some good recs.

We ordered the flaming dragon. Presentation was awesome. And the roll itself was good, the sauce made the roll. Victoria Secret had a awesome crunch to it. I would order 5 or 6 of those and eat way more. The Ferrari roll was okay. Melts in your mouth but nothing I would order again. Ordered dessert ... I kinda was expecting the mochi to be maybe bigger? Not something out of a trader joes box but that's just me. I could live without. We also ordered oyster shooters (I probably wont do that again) it tasted weird but only because I've never had one. The raw oysters were good. A bit spicy but tasted amazing. 

The price was also decent and cheap for SF sushi. I dont know about the music tho.. a bit too trancey for me. I'll be back for some more sushi tho. Tasted good and I'm already craving more Victoria Secret rolls!

excerpts: I had sashimi and california roll; my dining partner went with the california roll and tempura.
California roll was typical, made with imitation crab.
California roll was typical, made with imitation crab.
roll.author: Steph T.
roll.review:
Lunch deals are amazing here.  For two, the bill came out to just over 15.  Standard mix and match basics with soup, salad and rice.  I had sashimi and california roll; my dining partner went with the california roll and tempura.  Simple, yet good - and excellent for the price!

Tuna sashimi was very fresh and sliced into three decent pieces.  California roll was typical, made with imitation crab.  Miso soup was also the common soup that you find at restaurants in this price range, but I did find more than few, small pieces of tofu!  Even the green tea was pretty good, although I did spill it all over the place because of the chewed-up plastic covered teapot spout.  Careful. 

I didn't attempt any of the rolls, but would definitely find my way back for a nice lunch under 10 dollars when I'm around Japantown.  That said, this is definitely not worth the trek or parking charges for a cheap lunch, unless you are already in the area.

excerpts: The Dragon Roll and Tamago are great!
roll.author: Anthony N.
roll.review:
The Dragon Roll and Tamago are great! I have yet to try more things on the menu, but so far it has all been very good.

Side note: It was interesting to hear K-Pop circa 1998-2002 being played during lunch.

excerpts: We ordered a few rolls (Double Salmon, Spicy Juno, Golden Gate, King's roll) and the agadashi tofu.
The sushi was missing the fish quality and taste, but rather, each roll was just masked by either the flavor of spicy tuna and other sauces imbedded within.
The rolls were fine, but the worst part of the entire meal was that agadashi tofu.
WORST
I've ever had
and I didn't even know that was even possible?
First of all, I was so disgusted by the texture, since to create that fried and soft exterior, Kippu used some type of starch that creates a thin clear layer of slime.
Second of all, other than the nasty film of stuff, the taste was just not there
roll.author: Luby H.
roll.review:
I am sorry, but definitely one of the worst sushi I have ever ate. I admit, it's hard to eat sushi in the lower price points and expect the same quality as places like Maruya in the city, but sometimes you just cant help but think, I rather pay more and get a little more in terms of satisfaction.

We ordered a few rolls (Double Salmon, Spicy Juno, Golden Gate, King's roll) and the agadashi tofu. I must say, I think the complimentary miso soup was the best part of the meal, as the soup came piping hot and was extremely flavorful, then it just all went downhill from there. There was absolutely nothing special about any of the rolls, and as hungry as I was, I literally only ate at most 3 pieces. The sushi was missing the fish quality and taste, but rather, each roll was just masked by either the flavor of spicy tuna and other sauces imbedded within. The rolls were fine, but the worst part of the entire meal was that agadashi tofu. WORST I've ever had and I didn't even know that was even possible? First of all, I was so disgusted by the texture, since to create that fried and soft exterior, Kippu used some type of starch that creates a thin clear layer of slime. Second of all, other than the nasty film of stuff, the taste was just not there and the tofu was more of a medium softness tofu rather than soft, which is what agadashi tofu is really supposed to be.

I was really disappointed, considering the fact that one of one co-workers suggested Kippu as one of her usual date night spots.

Although the service was spectacular, and the waiters were extremely attentive, I would surely not want to ever return here for another meal again. Apparently she told me that there's never a wait here though, and now I can completely understand why.

excerpts: Bonzai and salmon ceviche roll were delicious!
Definitely coming back here.
roll.author: Emma J.
roll.review: Great customer service. Amazing age-dash tofu, tofu steak in the bento box was a bit bland. Bonzai and salmon ceviche roll were delicious! Definitely coming back here.

excerpts: I can't remember what the name of the sushi roll I got, I think the Lion King, that they set on fire and bring to your table.
Very cool experience.
roll.author: Erica D.
roll.review: I really liked this place, good sushi at a good price. I can't remember what the name of the sushi roll I got, I think the Lion King, that they set on fire and bring to your table. Very cool experience.

excerpts: Bottom line...pricey and the fish was not fresh on either roll...tuna and salmon.
Staff were very friendly.
roll.author: Mr. B.
roll.review: Came for a late lunch and had two kinds of sushi rolls. Bottom line...pricey and the fish was not fresh on either roll...tuna and salmon. Staff were very friendly.

excerpts: The Ferrari roll sounded promising, and both times I have ordered it, the spicy tuna tasted and smelled really fishy.
I don't know that they are committed to quality.
roll.author: Scott L.
roll.review: Meh.  They seemed confused when I asked for sashimi.  The Ferrari roll sounded promising, and both times I have ordered it, the spicy tuna tasted and smelled really fishy.  I don't know that they are committed to quality.  I think this is not Japanese owned, and it has a weak sake menu.  Not coming back.  :/

excerpts: The roll was horribly put together by some young kid that had no business being behind the sushi bar.
The roll was practically falling apart.
The fish for the nigiri sushi was sliced incorrectly and the nigiri itself was not properly shaped or portioned.
Not to mention no selection of fish to speak of and not very good quality fish.
This was a Friday night!
This is not an authentic Japanese restaurant (I know I am Japanese).
The people making the sushi are not experienced or qualified and quality was terrible.
After a couple of tastes we abandoned this place.
Very disappointing experience.
roll.author: John S.
roll.review: The food was terrible here.  I was here on business from Chicago and thought coming to Japantown for a great sushi dinner would be the smart move.  Sat at the sushi bar with a work colleague and the tip off should have been the lukewarm tap beer that we were served.  Never understand a place that can't get the simple things like a cold beer right.  From there it was downhill.  We tried a couple of rolls and nigiri sushi.  The roll was horribly put together by some young kid that had no business being behind the sushi bar. The roll was practically falling apart. The fish for the nigiri sushi was sliced incorrectly and the nigiri itself was not properly shaped or portioned.  Not to mention no selection of fish to speak of and not very good quality fish.  This was a Friday night!  This is not an authentic Japanese restaurant (I know I am Japanese).  The people making the sushi are not experienced or qualified and quality was terrible.   After a couple of tastes we abandoned this place.  Very disappointing experience.

excerpts:
Lobster roll was decent, but the number of rolls in the picture did not depict reality.
The fried oyster also had that charred aroma lathered in the brown dipping sauce that prevented me from finishing the single piece on my plate. 
I have lost the battle of "Man Vs Food" and cannot raise my head high any longer.
Should have ordered a bento box.
And "yes"; the service was sssllloooooooowwww...
Two stars because I didn't throw up.
roll.author: Mac P.
roll.review:
I've never ordered bad food that I refuse to eat before until now. Wow!!!
Flaming dragon was flaming in all the bad ways possible. It tasted like charred salty sticky rice.
Soft shell crab was good after I pealed off the batter that was the thickness of an orange peal.
Lobster roll was decent, but the number of rolls in the picture did not depict reality.
The fried oyster also had that charred aroma lathered in the brown dipping sauce that prevented me from finishing the single piece on my plate. I have lost the battle of "Man Vs Food" and cannot raise my head high any longer.
Should have ordered a bento box.
And "yes"; the service was sssllloooooooowwww...
Two stars because I didn't throw up.

excerpts: one of the thing that was in my bento was california roll.
california roll is always just ok to me.
the california rolls i had here was better than all the other ones i had though.
i don't know why.
california roll is always just ok to me.
the california rolls i had here was better than all the other ones i had though.
i don't know why.
roll.author: R F.
roll.review:
their food is good, in my opinion.  i had a bento.... cause i love the smaller portion and how you get little of many things.  healthier that way.  

one of the thing that was in my bento was california roll.  california roll is always just ok to me.  the california rolls i had here was better than all the other ones i had though.  i don't know why.   my bf liked his food as well.

the reason i didn't give 5 stars was because of the service.  the server didn't seem friendly at all.

excerpts: Food was tasty, highlights being the sushi roll we had as an extra to our "dinner bento" (large portion by the way!).
Bags of character and friendly, affable staff.
roll.author: Gareth E.
roll.review: This is a cool place. Atmosphere was informal, especially at the bar where we could watch the chaos of the chefs at work :-) Food was tasty, highlights being the sushi roll we had as an extra to our "dinner bento" (large portion by the way!). Bags of character and friendly, affable staff.

excerpts: My shrimp roll showed up with tail in it but no shrimp .
Crunchy tail no meat .
And it was a mess $10.00 dollars per roll and smaller then the length of my chop sticks.
There are 2 super markets one to the left and one to the right around the corner.
Both of them have better sushi on their worst days.
Really one star that they don't deserve
roll.author: William W.
roll.review: Ok how do you f up sushi. First start with a sushi chef who does not care about what he makes . My shrimp roll showed up with tail in it but no shrimp . Crunchy tail no meat . And it was a mess $10.00 dollars per roll and smaller then the length of my chop sticks. There are 2 super markets one to the left and one to the right around the corner. Both of them have better sushi on their worst days. Really one star that they don't deserve

excerpts: Amazing menu with some definitely adventurous (the flaming dragon roll is LITERALLY on fire).
I love so many options on their menu that it is always hard to decide what to order.
They also have great happy hour drink prices, and the staff is so fun and friendly!
I always have a great sushi dining experience at Kippu!
roll.author: Bridget B.
roll.review: I absolutely love Kippu. Choosing a sushi place in Japan Town is difficult, but if you go to Kippu you will not be disappointed! Amazing menu with some definitely adventurous (the flaming dragon roll is LITERALLY on fire). I love so many options on their menu that it is always hard to decide what to order.  They also have great happy hour drink prices, and the staff is so fun and friendly! I always have a great sushi dining experience at Kippu!

excerpts: I highly recommend the Washington Roll (Salmon with lemon).
roll.author: Sarah H.
roll.review: Yum sushi, we went twice during a 3 day visit!  I highly recommend the Washington Roll (Salmon with lemon).   Asparagus is deep fried in the rolls which is not my thing.  Service was good.

excerpts: You must get the Washington roll!
roll.author: Nadiyah S.
roll.review: 3.5? Good for non-expensive Calfornia-style sushi. They have an extensive list of mix-and-match rolls.  We only had two rolls here. You must get the Washington roll!

excerpts: Sometimes the portions are pretty small depending on the roll but most of them are a pretty decent size.
When I first started coming here, the service was so nice
and I really liked the combination of cordial service and good food.
HOWEVER, today I went in with my family to have a nice family dinner because we were familiar with the place.
But we didn't like the table that they first directed us to.
Not to be a snippy sally but one of the waitresses was just giving us some attitude when we tried asking for another table.
After finally convincing her to give us another table (the first one was in the sun and my mom gets really bad migraines), she just continued to have this unwelcoming face.
The food is good, but this isn't the first time this waitress has had some sort of attitude when serving my table.
It kind of puts you off from the experience.
roll.author: Hue H.
roll.review:
I've been here a couple times and the sushi is always great. Sometimes the portions are pretty small depending on the roll but most of them are a pretty decent size. When I first started coming here, the service was so nice and I really liked the combination of cordial service and good food. 
HOWEVER, today I went in with my family to have a nice family dinner because we were familiar with the place. But we didn't like the table that they first directed us to. Not to be a snippy sally but one of the waitresses was just giving us some attitude when we tried asking for another table. After finally convincing her to give us another table (the first one was in the sun and my mom gets really bad migraines), she just continued to have this unwelcoming face. 
The food is good, but this isn't the first time this waitress has had some sort of attitude when serving my table. It kind of puts you off from the experience.

excerpts: We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl.
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush.
roll.author: Michelle T.
roll.review:
After roaming around SF, my friends and I wanted some sushi so we decided to go eat somewhere around Japan Town. After walking around for a while, we went to Kippu because we saw their wide variety of sushi rolls. The waiter and chefs greeted us upon our entrance and received a complimentary miso soup right after we got our table. 
The miso soup was average, can't go wrong with that. We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl. 
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush. The rice was a little rough and didn't taste fresh. The katsu seemed over cooked and had been sitting out for a while. The food was mediocre and their prices do not correspond to their level of precision they put into their sushi. To be very blunt, this sushi was one of the worst yet. And I would not come back unless their sushi has risen to the prices they charge here.

excerpts: we got the salmon bento box and the beef teriyaki and the incredible roll (?).
I wish we were told that roll was raw.
I still tipped them because I work in a similar field as well and rely on tips sometimes.
I hope this review and the other reviews helps them with a little service upgrade.
roll.author: Dixie x.
roll.review: food was alright. not too good, not too bad. ive had better. not much on their menu, which doesnt please me at all. the waitress was rushing us to order our food which is definitely a no. the other servers were not water friendly with refills. other then that, nothing good to say. we got the salmon bento box and the beef teriyaki and the incredible roll (?). I wish we were told that roll was raw. I still tipped them because I work in a similar field as well and rely on tips sometimes. I hope this review and the other reviews helps them with a little service upgrade.

excerpts: Surprisingly the California roll was nice and fresh.
I probably would come back and try their sashimi next time.
Place is not bad.
Probably ordered the wrong item.
Their lunch special are pretty cheap but again
just beware that maybe some of the items are just okay.
Overall 3 out of 5 stars.
roll.author: J C.
roll.review: The chicken teriyaki in their tempura box was dry. Surprisingly the California roll was nice and fresh. I probably would come back and try their sashimi next time. Place is not bad. Probably ordered the wrong item. Their lunch special are pretty cheap but again just beware that maybe some of the items are just okay. Overall 3 out of 5 stars.

excerpts: After they took my order of 4 dishes - Post Roll, Washington Roll, Unagi Lover, and Ahi Tuna - we waited about 5 minutes for the miso soup which was not an issue.
However, after 30 minutes, the same waitress comes up to ask if we have ordered yet - she was ruffling through her pad to look for my order.
roll.author: Ben L.
roll.review:
This is the restaurant that made me decide to start a Yelp account.  My goal of this review is for anyone that works there to never provide this kind of experience to other customers.

1. Took close to 20 minutes to get any attention from the two waitresses to take our order. Obviously, this is not the first time anyone has experienced this, but for a restaurant that is less than 300 sq ft it was not acceptable.  I was also ignored twice with clear visual eye contact.  Two other parties had their order taken before mine was; I had a party of 2, the others were of 2 and 4.  

2. After they took my order of 4 dishes - Post Roll, Washington Roll, Unagi Lover, and Ahi Tuna - we waited about 5 minutes for the miso soup which was not an issue.  However, after 30 minutes, the same waitress comes up to ask if we have ordered yet - she was ruffling through her pad to look for my order.  She ends up going back to the cashier to find my order which at that point she tells me it will take 5 minutes to come out.  

3. She tried to compensate by providing edamame which was a nice gesture, however, the edamame was clearly old and had been sitting out in the open for a while.  It was sour (which it should never be), and much too soft like an old banana.  There was no way this can be OK to serve.  

4. The orders started to come in about 5-10 more minutes, all of which was significantly smaller than the picture.  Yes, it will never look identical to the picture, but it just looked like they didn't have enough ingredients to even complete the dish - even the rice on the rolls looked barren.  

I ended up paying about 65 dollars for this meal and it will be the last that I will ever spend there.  My girlfriend and I left hungry and totally dissatisfied with the food and service.  I've had bad restaurant experiences before and I do not have exuberant expectations, but from a customer service / technical support managerial background, this was unacceptable and needs to be improved on all ends.  Even if the quality of the food does not improve, I would continue to visit only if the service was there.  

If you get the chance to visit this restaurant, I recommend that you think twice about it before spending your hard earned cash.

excerpts: I had the Chicken Teriyaki + Tempura + California Roll.
The Teriyaki was pretty good, Tempura was amazing and California Roll was just a little less than perfect.
I would give it 5 stars given it's relatively affordable at such an expensive location and the food was good.
The total tab came out to be $12 for a very VERY full meal.
The Teriyaki was pretty good, Tempura was amazing and California Roll was just a little less than perfect.
I would give it 5 stars given it's relatively affordable at such an expensive location and the food was good.
The total tab came out to be $12 for a very VERY full meal.
roll.author: Shun Y.
roll.review: Pretty decent place. Thought it was expensive at first, but the dinner bentos come with LOADS of food. I had the Chicken Teriyaki + Tempura + California Roll. The Teriyaki was pretty good, Tempura was amazing and California Roll was just a little less than perfect. I would give it 5 stars given it's relatively affordable at such an expensive location and the food was good. The total tab came out to be $12 for a very VERY full meal.

excerpts: The manager gave us a complementary sushi roll and fried ice cream tempura in celebration of my Mom's birthday!
What an awesome surprise :-)
I definitely would come here again!
roll.author: Jessica G.
roll.review: Highly recommend this Japanese restaurant! It was my Mom's birthday and the manager, staff and food were fantastic.  The manager gave us a complementary sushi roll and fried ice cream tempura in celebration of my Mom's birthday!  What an awesome surprise :-)  I definitely would come here again!

excerpts: I coukd even taste the bad fish in the spicy tuna roll
roll.author: Sam S.
roll.review: Their sushi was very unfresh. I coukd even taste the bad fish in the spicy tuna roll

excerpts: They were all under the Special Roll section of the menu.
The servers were interesting - there were several girls and one guy that seemed to be serving us, and the guy seemed to be the only one who really knew what was going on.
The girls didn't seem to know what they were serving us and couldn't really answer questions.
They were friendly though
roll.author: Erin A.
roll.review: We liked this place. The sushi is good. We ordered the Candy Cane, the Incredible and the something with the word Mexican in it. I can't remember the full name of the last one. They were all really good! They were all under the Special Roll section of the menu. The servers were interesting - there were several girls and one guy that seemed to be serving us, and the guy seemed to be the only one who really knew what was going on. The girls didn't seem to know what they were serving us and couldn't really answer questions. They were friendly though :) The miso soup was good. The salad wasn't as good as I've had it at other Japanese restaurants, but it's a pretty basic salad, so it can't get that bad or good. Oh, and they have cool cocktails! I got the Purple Gecko, my fiance got the Mojito Affair and my cousin got the Plumtini. All very good. Tasted like Jolly Ranchers! :) For the three of us and all that food it cost about $64.

excerpts: it was a super yummy roll with a bunch of fish I can't remember and some of that delicious crab filling.
It was delicious and really cool of him to bring it out to us juts because of a little spill.
We ended up getting 3 rolls (The Lion King, The American, and a basic unagi roll) and the chef's choice nigiri and everything was pretty good.
I would give the food 3 1/2 stars, but the service bumped my review up to 4!
roll.author: Angelique D.
roll.review: My fam and I found ourselves in Japantown looking for a non-touristy, yummy sushi spot. We tried a well-reviewed-on-Yelp spot inside Peace Plaza but they had a minimum of $20 a person and we just didn't think we could pull that off (plus, I don't like being told what to spend). So we tried Kippu, even though the reviews were mixed on Yelp. For starters, the restaurant was pretty empty except for table right next to us that looked like it was the owner or something. Our waiter greeted us and promptly spilled water right next to me. No harm done and we weren't bothered by the spill at all. Next thing we know, the owner makes sure we ok and a few minutes later, brings us this fancy dish, "The Flaming Dragon." He tries to tell us what we're supposed it to with it...something about smelling and waiting a minute after the flames die out before we open it...but then just tells us he'll be back to help us. IT was this cool looking thing--something long wrapped in foil with flames literally coming from the bottom. So after it's not on fire he comes over and opens it up...it was a super yummy roll with a bunch of fish I can't remember and some of that delicious crab filling. It was delicious and really cool of him to bring it out to us juts because of a little spill. We ended up getting 3 rolls (The Lion King, The American, and a basic unagi roll) and the chef's choice nigiri and everything was pretty good. I would give the food 3 1/2 stars, but the service bumped my review up to 4! My fam got the green tea ice cream and they enjoyed that as well. Overall, it was great start to our SF dining experiences!

excerpts: Washington roll is good
washington roll.author: Regi K.
washington roll.review:
Don't order the chewy beef aka beef teriyaki.   

Washington roll is good if you're in the mood for salmon

everything else is really okay... kinda typical fare.  nothing special.

excerpts: I highly recommend the Washington Roll (Salmon with lemon).
washington roll.author: Sarah H.
washington roll.review: Yum sushi, we went twice during a 3 day visit!  I highly recommend the Washington Roll (Salmon with lemon).   Asparagus is deep fried in the rolls which is not my thing.  Service was good.

excerpts: You must get the Washington roll!
washington roll.author: Nadiyah S.
washington roll.review: 3.5? Good for non-expensive Calfornia-style sushi. They have an extensive list of mix-and-match rolls.  We only had two rolls here. You must get the Washington roll!

The Mexican roll was actually pretty good.
It was made up of spicy crab meat, cucumber, avocado, and shrimp.
The Mexican roll was actually pretty good.
It was made up of spicy crab meat, cucumber, avocado, and shrimp.
The spicy tuna roll was weird.
Overwhelming and not consistent with any spicy tuna I've ever had before.
The spicy tuna roll was weird.
Overwhelming and not consistent with any spicy tuna I've ever had before.
mexican roll.author: Priti K.
mexican roll.review:
My friend and I showed up at dinner hour on a weekday. There weren't very many people in the restaurant, so it was pretty quiet. The menu is so extensive, so it took us a while to choose what we wanted - way to many sushi variations for when you're so hungry. The service here was really weird. Everything was so rushed. The server came over to our table a number of times while we were trying to decide and it just got kind of annoying. We'll tell you when we tell you. Please relax. 

I ordered a Mexican Roll and a spicy tuna roll. The Mexican roll was actually pretty good. It was made up of spicy crab meat, cucumber, avocado, and shrimp. The spicy tuna roll was weird. Overwhelming and not consistent with any spicy tuna I've ever had before. I think they overdid it with the amount of fish, too. 

The service was, again, very pushy. It seemed like they wanted us out of there and I couldn't understand why because there was barely anyone else in the restaurant. 

Overall, Kippu is pretty average in both food and just pretty weird in service. Hmm. I look forward to trying a bunch of the other sushi restaurants in Japantown. This ended up being a pretty mediocre intro to the area.

excerpts: My favorite dishes were the Dynamite Roll (deep fried spicy tuna & avocado), the Spicy Killer (spicy tuna, cucumber covered w/ white tuna), and the Peppercorn Seared Tuna with garlic sauce.
Dinner started with a generous bowl of miso - which is a great palate opener.

While I had a relatively small helping of food (due to an all-day tummy ache), my dining companions went to town with the Udon (heart bowls of soup filled with your choice of chicken, meat, pork, and veggies, and thick noodles).
Everyone raved about their selection.
dynamite roll.author: Kevin B.
dynamite roll.review:
We dined here after a relaxing spa excursion at Kabuki Springs. We had discovered this place in a Yelp search for Japanese restaurants. Once again, Yelpers steered us in the right direction!

This is some of the tastiest sushi and and udon around. The place is kind of tiny. And once you walk inside, you feel like you're actually in Tokyo, far removed from SF. 

Our group shared a bunch of sushi and salads. My favorite dishes were the Dynamite Roll (deep fried spicy tuna & avocado), the Spicy Killer (spicy tuna, cucumber covered w/ white tuna), and the Peppercorn Seared Tuna with garlic sauce. Dinner started with a generous bowl of miso - which is a great palate opener. While I had a relatively small helping of food (due to an all-day tummy ache), my dining companions went to town with the Udon (heart bowls of soup filled with your choice of chicken, meat, pork, and veggies, and thick noodles). Everyone raved about their selection. So I'll need to come back again to taste it for myself.

One small warning - contrary to their website, Kippu no longer serves ramen. So if you're in the mood for ramen, you'll have to go somewhere else.

All in all, Kippu was a lovely Japantown discovery. I think I'll probably return here the next time I see a movie at the Sundance Kabuki Theater.

excerpts: The Go Go Roll was especially tasty.
go go roll.author: Kate J.
go go roll.review: Delicious sushi, kind staff, and prompt service.  The atmosphere was nothing super special, but I was happy to stop here for dinner while visiting San Francsico.  The Go Go Roll was especially tasty.

excerpts: We ended up eating just two rolls the Washington and the mountain roll...
They were just alright
they left the seeds in the lemon toppings.
Their service was really quick!
Thumbs up
mountain roll.author: Pu B.
mountain roll.review: When i walked into the restaurant i was wondering why it was so hot in there. We just ate some burgers so we were already full but we took a stroll through japan town and we stumbled upon this restaurant and my girlfriend and i will never ever say no to some sushi! I really really like how they give free miso soup and a salad in the beginning too. Its like a full course meal. We ended up eating just two rolls the Washington and the mountain roll... They were just alright they left the seeds in the lemon toppings. Their service was really quick! Thumbs up

excerpts: We ordered the Flaming Dragon Roll ($15) and the Mountain Roll ($11).
mountain roll.author: Shee X.
mountain roll.review: Sushi was delicious, flavorful, and fresh! We ordered the Flaming Dragon Roll ($15) and the Mountain Roll ($11). We also received complimentary miso soup and salad, which was nice and tasty as well. Would definitely recommend Kippu if you are in Japantown.
