mountain roll.author: Chantille T.
mountain roll.review: It was a Thursday afternoon, me and my friend were trying to look for a decent sushi place around Japantown and stumble across Kippu, so we decided to check it out. Came into the establishment and was seated right away, looked through the menus and the waitress comes over and asks us if we are ready to order. We weren't ready yet so we started off with two cokes. Once we were ready, we ordered 3 rolls, an appetizer and some miso soups. The miso soups were complimentary which was nice and we got the oysters, the mountain roll, the scallop bay roll and titanic. The first roll that came was the rainbow roll which wasn't what we ordered and so we let it sit there till our server came so we can tell her that it isn't what we ordered. Later on, she dropped off the titanic and scallop bay roll which was good and then later dropped off the mountain roll. Here's when things get a bit frustrating. She was the only server and she running around frustrated which I understood cause business started picking up but when she dropped off the mountain roll, I guess she didn't realize that it wasn't the mountain roll to begin with and it took her awhile to come check back with us. And we were patiently waiting, so patient to the point where we finished our first two rolls and our oysters that weren't even pleasant. Once she came, my friend and I were telling her that this isn't what we ordered and she tried to tell us that it was and we showed her the picture and she said, "it has this this and this" and then we pointed it out that it didn't have the certain toppings on it, so she asked us if we wanted those toppings on it and we said yes and she went and did that for us. I mean the issue wasn't about whose right and whose wrong but if you're gonna advertise something as this then don't bring it out something as something different you know? Overall cute little place, would I recommend this place to anyone? Eh, I don't think so.

excerpts: We had the giant roll and a roll with scallops which were quite tasty.
giant roll.author: Francine B.
giant roll.review: Walked through Japan town and decided on this place out of a dozen and glad we did. Love places that give you complimentary miso and salad! The teriyaki chicken box with rice, salad, miso soup and an assortment of tempura was enough for my two kids to share.  We had the giant roll and a roll with scallops which were quite tasty. The oyster shooter was not very warm and did not have any spice to it like I prefer. The Portions were good size except the Pepperfin which came with only 4 pieces and was about $12. It also had some flakes on top I didn't like and not enough sauce. That being said I really enjoyed the rolls and the staff was very nice and attentive. They had over 70 rolls to choose from and some that were pretty unique. I would go back here again when visiting.

excerpts: The spicy killer roll was an amped spicy tuna roll which tasted overwhelming of siracha, taking away from the flavor of the fish.
spicy tuna roll.author: Michelle C.
spicy tuna roll.review:
Came in during lunch on a Tuesday afternoon. I've walked by this place many times but have never tried the place. Feeling the hunger pains, my fiance and I decided to join the crowd inside and dine in for lunch.

They have a pretty extensive menu with countless rolls to choose from. Kinda reminds me of the neverending menu at cheesecake factory, indecisive eaters beware! That aside, we kept our choices simple. We chose the rock and roll and the spicy killer roll. Both of rolls were decent. The spicy killer roll was an amped spicy tuna roll which tasted overwhelming of siracha, taking away from the flavor of the fish. Rick and roll hit the spot for my fiance. Overall, the experience was okay. 

A bit overpriced for mediocre rolls with decent fish quality. Quick and speedy service, however they did forget our utensils. Waitress and host seemed quite busy and ready to turn over our tables the second we finished our meals.

Don't know if I'd be willing to revisit this place again given there are far better sushi places in the area for better prices.

spicy tuna roll.author: Michelle T.
spicy tuna roll.review:
After roaming around SF, my friends and I wanted some sushi so we decided to go eat somewhere around Japan Town. After walking around for a while, we went to Kippu because we saw their wide variety of sushi rolls. The waiter and chefs greeted us upon our entrance and received a complimentary miso soup right after we got our table. 
The miso soup was average, can't go wrong with that. We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl. 
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush. The rice was a little rough and didn't taste fresh. The katsu seemed over cooked and had been sitting out for a while. The food was mediocre and their prices do not correspond to their level of precision they put into their sushi. To be very blunt, this sushi was one of the worst yet. And I would not come back unless their sushi has risen to the prices they charge here.

unagi roll.author: Eric H.
unagi roll.review:
We went in here and the food was decent. Rolls are big. Giving 1 star because they mixed my order up and refused to fix it. Part of my order was a dragon roll and another table behind us orderd an unagi roll. They both are similar except one has shrimp tempura inside while the other has crab.

I was given the unagi rolll and I brought it to the wait staff's attention. They told me it was a dragon roll. They came back a few seconds later and realized it wasn't and took the plate. However, the table they had given my dragon roll had already started eating it. Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.

Just remake the roll for god sakes.

excerpts: We ended up getting 3 rolls (The Lion King, The American, and a basic unagi roll) and the chef's choice nigiri and everything was pretty good.
I would give the food 3 1/2 stars, but the service bumped my review up to 4!
unagi roll.author: Angelique D.
unagi roll.review: My fam and I found ourselves in Japantown looking for a non-touristy, yummy sushi spot. We tried a well-reviewed-on-Yelp spot inside Peace Plaza but they had a minimum of $20 a person and we just didn't think we could pull that off (plus, I don't like being told what to spend). So we tried Kippu, even though the reviews were mixed on Yelp. For starters, the restaurant was pretty empty except for table right next to us that looked like it was the owner or something. Our waiter greeted us and promptly spilled water right next to me. No harm done and we weren't bothered by the spill at all. Next thing we know, the owner makes sure we ok and a few minutes later, brings us this fancy dish, "The Flaming Dragon." He tries to tell us what we're supposed it to with it...something about smelling and waiting a minute after the flames die out before we open it...but then just tells us he'll be back to help us. IT was this cool looking thing--something long wrapped in foil with flames literally coming from the bottom. So after it's not on fire he comes over and opens it up...it was a super yummy roll with a bunch of fish I can't remember and some of that delicious crab filling. It was delicious and really cool of him to bring it out to us juts because of a little spill. We ended up getting 3 rolls (The Lion King, The American, and a basic unagi roll) and the chef's choice nigiri and everything was pretty good. I would give the food 3 1/2 stars, but the service bumped my review up to 4! My fam got the green tea ice cream and they enjoyed that as well. Overall, it was great start to our SF dining experiences!

excerpts: Bento box ( salmon teriyaki w/ California roll)
: This bento box included a side salad, 4pcs of California roll, white rice, a filet salmon teriyaki with ginger and wasabi.
: This bento box included a side salad, 4pcs of California roll, white rice, a filet salmon teriyaki with ginger and wasabi.
The salmon teriyaki was good, the California roll was alright and salad was okay too.
The salmon teriyaki was good, the California roll was alright and salad was okay too.
california roll.author: Kochamon S.
california roll.review:
The food was alright honestly..
I came here with my parents and ordered a bento box, donburi (katsu don), and their sushi ( King Kong roll).

Bento box ( salmon teriyaki w/ California roll): This bento box included a side salad, 4pcs of California roll, white rice, a filet salmon teriyaki with ginger and wasabi. The salmon teriyaki was good, the California roll was alright and salad was okay too. 

Katsu don: just your basic katsu don with a little zucchini thrown into it. 
King Kong roll- it was alright. The taste of it is fine but it just didn't necessarily impressed me. 
Overall the food was meh in my opinion. If I had to recommend something that I ate it would be the sushi. It was the best tasting out of things I've ordered. 
Service was really friendly and nice. 
Overall I don't think I will personally come here again if I am going to be completely honest.

excerpts: I had my california roll (which was grocery store quality).
california roll.author: Rachel D.
california roll.review:
They were the only spot open on New Year's Day. I know it's hard to be open on New Year's day BUT the service and food were both pretty bad. We were ignored at the hostess stand for a good 10 minutes. Finally we were acknowledged after I said something to the hostess. 

My husband ordered the sashimi lunch box and I got the teriyaki chicken (afraid to eat the sushi based on other reviews). His salmon sashimi was inedible. The sushi was so slimy and warm. He had me look at it and it looked pretty bad. He ate a little bit and confirmed it wasn't fit to eat. We ate the chicken and rice. I had my california roll (which was grocery store quality). 

When we were done I had to flag down the waiter for the bill. Once I got the bill from him, he never asked me if I needed a box. The bill was set to pay and he was still MIA. I went up to the hostess stand and had to ask for a box which took much longer. 

I know they were busy and it's a hard day to be open but this was a pretty bad experience. I didn't mention the sushi to the server but because they seemed so busy and kept ignoring us, I figured it wasn't even worth mentioning to them anyway.. or they would ignore me. 

I'm from the east coast so I probably won't ever be back here but I wanted to let folks know regardless. If there are other options, try elsewhere!

excerpts: Average a little undercooked salmon teriyaki and expensive California roll with fake crab.
california roll.author: Jack R.
california roll.review:
Super slow service when we're the only ones there. Super high prices for an average bento box.

Only in Japan Town would this place survive.

No refills on tea no extra napkins.

Average a little undercooked salmon teriyaki and expensive California roll with fake crab.

Ugh, only because I was hungry.

I'm giving this place 3 stars because the salmon portion was big, but not necessarily that good to want a second helping.

Karage chicken  is small like pop corn chicken
Sushi rolls are small , ordered the candy cane roll , 8 pieces size like California roll ...disappointed but there is only very few restaurant open around 9:30 pm at night

We also ordered the rock and roll sushi, which includes unagi, shrimp, and avocado.

california roll.review: I am having the bento box with salmon teriyaki, tempura, and the California roll.  C is having mixed tempura.  We also ordered the rock and roll sushi, which includes unagi, shrimp, and avocado.

excerpts: I ordered their Daily Special A which comes with miso soup, salad, five pieces of nigiri, and california roll.
california roll.author: Joshua M.
california roll.review: I went to Kippu Japanese Cuisine on a Wednesday night to eat some good sushi. The service was great and friendly throughout the entire meal. I ordered their Daily Special A which comes with miso soup, salad, five pieces of nigiri, and california roll. The nigiri was great in that there was a high sashimi to rice ratio. The hamachi also tasted exceptionally well. For the affordable price, I enjoyed the meal very much with the wonderful hot tea as well.

excerpts: I had the Chicken teriyaki with California roll for $9.
Perfect amount of food and one of the best California rolls I've had in a while
california roll.author: Matt M.
california roll.review: Delicious, affordable lunch special. I had the Chicken teriyaki with California roll for $9. Perfect amount of food and one of the best California rolls I've had in a while

excerpts: I got the usual, California roll and pretty much another California roll with salmon and yellow tail on top.
They did offer a lot is specialty rolls, my friend got their fried golden gate roll.
It looked delicious!
california roll.author: Brittany W.
california roll.review:
When I heard that they have a Japantown in the city I had to get me some sushi!  My friend brought me here and the food wasn't that bad.  I got the usual, California roll and pretty much another California roll with salmon and yellow tail on top.  They offer a complimentary miso soup and salad to start your meal.  Don't go looking for a spoon either, we eat our soup just like they do in Japan haha.  Drink up!

The food is where the authentic culture ends.  The music selection was great but very American.  They did offer a lot is specialty rolls, my friend got their fried golden gate roll. It looked delicious!

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the dinner bento box special, and the California roll portion of his meal literally came with two pieces.
Finally, after sitting and waiting for our check for about 10 minutes after our plates had been cleared, we had to ask the waitress to please bring us our check, which took several more minutes.
When she finally arrived at our table, she brought us someone else's check, so we had to go up to the front counter and ask for our proper check.
We wanted to try a new restaurant in Japantown that we hadn't been to yet, so we chose this one.
Next time, we'll be going somewhere where we know we will receive good food AND good service.
california roll.author: Molly I.
california roll.review:
My boyfriend and I had dinner here last week. While the food was acceptable, the service was not. Our waitress was not very friendly, and seemed as if she wanted to be anywhere but there. We had to ask her for water, which is understandable given California's drought. However, what was not understandable or acceptable was why she gave us half-full glasses of tap water, while the tables near us had full glasses of water with ice cubes. The waitress did not offer to refill our glasses once we finished the half-full water glasses, so we kept having to repeatedly ask her for more water (which we received in a slow manner). My food was okay; I ordered the vegetarian bento box, which came with inari, vegetable tempura, miso soup, salad, and karrokes. The quantity of food I received for the price (around $13) was pretty good, and overall I enjoyed my dinner, with the exception of the inari tofu. It was soggy, hardly breaded and fried at all, and just tasted bad. My boyfriend ordered the dinner bento box special, and the California roll portion of his meal literally came with two pieces. Finally, after sitting and waiting for our check for about 10 minutes after our plates had been cleared, we had to ask the waitress to please bring us our check, which took several more minutes. When she finally arrived at our table, she brought us someone else's check, so we had to go up to the front counter and ask for our proper check. 
We wanted to try a new restaurant in Japantown that we hadn't been to yet, so we chose this one. Next time, we'll be going somewhere where we know we will receive good food AND good service.

excerpts: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.
The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).
The steak was dry and lightly sauced.
Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.

california roll.author: Leonard L.
california roll.review:
Kippu Japanese
SF J-Town
3pm Thursday 16th April 2015
Three Stars

We had the dog so we couldn't eat inside so we ordered takeout.  I got the Number 9 Combination: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.  The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).    It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.  The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).  The steak was dry and lightly sauced. Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.

excerpts: The sushi menu is basically a Willy Wonka wonderland for anyone who is sick of the basic California roll - if you're at all an indecisive freak like me, you will change your mind at least five times before the waitress comes to take your order and then change your mind while you are ordering.
I ended up getting the double salmon roll because mercury tastes delicious, and a vegetarian bento box on the side because vegetables and fibrous materials.
california roll.author: Joy G.
california roll.review:
The sushi menu is basically a Willy Wonka wonderland for anyone who is sick of the basic California roll - if you're at all an indecisive freak like me, you will change your mind at least five times before the waitress comes to take your order and then change your mind while you are ordering. I ended up getting the double salmon roll because mercury tastes delicious, and a vegetarian bento box on the side because vegetables and fibrous materials. The miso soup is really, really salty here, and I say that as someone who always finishes her complimentary miso soup. 

We decided to be annoying and asked for a seat in the back with the comfy lounge cushions instead of the rickety wooden chairs in the front. The waitress shook her head, saying that the back tables were only for parties of 10. It was 2 o'clock on a Wednesday. A party of 10 is not going to come strolling in and demand to be crammed around two tiny tables. I said so more or less, and she signed through her nose and said, sure, but only if we agree to move if a party of 10 comes in. It felt a little bizarre playing this passive-agro tug of war over a hypothetical party of 10 stragglers, but she lit up when we ordered 5 rolls and a ton of bento boxes. 

Two stars for delicious agedashi tofu. Yes, there is this layer of brown, umami goo caking the tofu. Yes, I was eyeing my friend's nabeyaki udon a bit wistfully. Yes, I ate too much and then had to wander through the mall in the Peace Plaza across the street arguing with myself (possibly aloud) if physical agony was worth green tea soft serve or a banana and nutella crepe. Thanks for having me, Japantown!

WHY IS IT HOT!

california roll.author: Tiffany V.
california roll.review:
Everyone is aware sushi in Japantown is a total joke right? I would never eat here in a million years if I had the choice but my grandma lives across the street and our options are limited within walking distance. 

Decided to give this place a try since its one of the few places I haven't gone to yet and it was one of the worst. Service is SO FUCKING SLOW. There is one woman working and it seriously seems like you are bothering her by asking her for water since she hasn't refilled your glass once in the 90 degree humid as fuck space imitating as a Japanese restaurant. The other reviewers aren't kidding when they say its hot in here. There was a small fan at our table we couldn't figure out how to turn on and when I asked the waitress if she could turn it on for us she just looked at us and said we could do it ourselves. Um what. 

I ordered a california roll and a scallop lovers roll. Keeping up with their theme, the California roll came super hot! WHY IS IT HOT! The Scallop lovers roll which was supposed to be baked was hardly so and the mayo sauce on top was so gross. Oh god. Why. I saw they had toro on sale for $15 but I would never trust a place like this for their toro. 

Avoid at all costs plz. Japantown has yet to cease to fail me.

We ordered salmon, tuna and shrimp sushi. The orange blossom special roll, Cucumber salad, California roll and avocado roll.

excerpts: My friend ordered the tonkatsu with California roll.
I did not have high hopes for this restaurant (as Japanese restaurants in Japantown don't have the best food ironically).
california roll.author: Lillian C.
california roll.review:
This restaurant is conveniently located in the middle of Japantown in SF. 

I came here for lunch and ordered the lunch special bento box with sashimi and salmon teriyaki. My friend ordered the tonkatsu with California roll. I did not have high hopes for this restaurant (as Japanese restaurants in Japantown don't have the best food ironically). However, the salmon sashimi was pretty fresh and tasty; the salmon teriyaki was decent as well (a little overdone but the teriyaki sauce was flavorful and not overkill). The tonkatsu (Chicken katsu) was too dry making the meat too tough. 

Overall, I'd come back but the food is just okay and not worth a trip on its own.

excerpts: The California roll was very good.
california roll.author: Pedro D.
california roll.review:
I agree all the negative reviews about this place.. I have been a loyal customer for a long time and I want to point something very dangerous about their food serving lately..
As I was eating my food my wife noticed the chicken surfaced half pink and God knows what could happen if she didn't tell me..  
1- The California roll was very good.
2-Their side salad was very fresh and tasty.
3-Their server seems nice,but they don't clean your table special when going back to their kitchen with  their hand empty and they don't know how to run the floor.
4-My wife got her food and mine dish came 25 minute after she eat half hers....

excerpts: I also enjoyed part of my wife's dish the Teryaki chicken with California roll and deep fried veggies.
Ive never seen portions this huge in a Japanese restaurant; it was like a hungry mans restaurant.
The waiter was nice.
It is a little pricey but it was absolutely worth it to me.
Quite possibly the best Japanese food Ive ever eaten.
It was really that good.
I wish I knew the names of the dishes
but Im not very well versed in Japanese cuisine.
california roll.author: David S.
california roll.review:
My first time here. The prices were very reasonable for the amount of food you get. My wife and I loved it. The Wasabi salad is great, we ordered a dish called The Bomb which is deep fried Jalapenos in some kind of sauce. I had the breaded pork which came with a salad and potato salad. The flavors and sauces that came with the food were also great. I also enjoyed part of my wife's dish the Teryaki chicken with California roll and deep fried veggies. Ive never seen portions this huge in a Japanese restaurant; it was like a hungry mans restaurant. The waiter was nice. It is a little pricey but it was absolutely worth it to me. Quite possibly the best Japanese food Ive ever eaten. It was really that good. I wish I knew the names of the dishes but Im not very well versed in Japanese cuisine.
You also get some really tasty Miso soup before you order.. All in all I was pleased and very full. I guess portions depend on what you order. The dinner tray dishes are packed with food though...Even Godzilla would be full from eating there !

excerpts: Everyone in my party loved their food: tea, California roll, Bento box, teriyaki...
california roll.author: Carla L.
california roll.review: Cherry blossom roll was perfect!  The food came out quick and it tasted fresh.  Miso soup was good too.  Everyone in my party loved their food: tea, California roll, Bento box, teriyaki...

excerpts: I had sashimi and california roll; my dining partner went with the california roll and tempura.
California roll was typical, made with imitation crab.
California roll was typical, made with imitation crab.
california roll.author: Steph T.
california roll.review:
Lunch deals are amazing here.  For two, the bill came out to just over 15.  Standard mix and match basics with soup, salad and rice.  I had sashimi and california roll; my dining partner went with the california roll and tempura.  Simple, yet good - and excellent for the price!

Tuna sashimi was very fresh and sliced into three decent pieces.  California roll was typical, made with imitation crab.  Miso soup was also the common soup that you find at restaurants in this price range, but I did find more than few, small pieces of tofu!  Even the green tea was pretty good, although I did spill it all over the place because of the chewed-up plastic covered teapot spout.  Careful. 

I didn't attempt any of the rolls, but would definitely find my way back for a nice lunch under 10 dollars when I'm around Japantown.  That said, this is definitely not worth the trek or parking charges for a cheap lunch, unless you are already in the area.

I would give it 5 stars given it's relatively affordable at such an expensive location and the food was good.

california roll.review: Pretty decent place. Thought it was expensive at first, but the dinner bentos come with LOADS of food. I had the Chicken Teriyaki + Tempura + California Roll. excerpts: We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl.
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush.
sake roll.author: Michelle T.
sake roll.review:
After roaming around SF, my friends and I wanted some sushi so we decided to go eat somewhere around Japan Town. After walking around for a while, we went to Kippu because we saw their wide variety of sushi rolls. The waiter and chefs greeted us upon our entrance and received a complimentary miso soup right after we got our table. 
The miso soup was average, can't go wrong with that. We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl. 
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush. The rice was a little rough and didn't taste fresh. The katsu seemed over cooked and had been sitting out for a while. The food was mediocre and their prices do not correspond to their level of precision they put into their sushi. To be very blunt, this sushi was one of the worst yet. And I would not come back unless their sushi has risen to the prices they charge here.

excerpts: I ordered Sushi Combo C, which had 7 nigiris and a tekka roll, which costed $17, so the price is definitely on the high end.
tekka roll.author: Henry L.
tekka roll.review:
Fairly decent sushi. I ordered Sushi Combo C, which had 7 nigiris and a tekka roll, which costed $17, so the price is definitely on the high end. The sushi was ok, but wasn't exceptional as I had expected beforehand, and the variety is very narrow (all the nigiris in the combo were of red/white fish pieces--there was no color e.g. egg, octopus, fish roe etc, which was disappointing).

Would definitely recommend finding sushi elsewhere e.g. the conveyor belt sushi boat places, where you can find a much larger variety of fish selection

excerpts: That was the mistake I made with my third choice, the appropriately priced $5 Avocado Roll which was just that, avocado rolled in rice and nori (photo: http://bit.ly/2KN9afH).
There wasn't enough flavor to make it interesting.
I didn't find anything offensive about Kippu, it just felt interchangeable with any number of J-Town eateries offering the exact same dishes.
avocado roll.author: Ed U.
avocado roll.review:
I've sat in front of this inconspicuous Japanese restaurant several times whenever I took a seat on one of the worn benches on the cobblestoned Buchanan Street plaza. I decided to give it a try one evening as I was leisurely strolling through Japantown and found it about half full of customers. I didn't have high expectations about the quality based on some of the Yelp feedback I read, and frankly that preconception helped me get through my meal without incident.

I decided on three smaller items off their menu, but to my pleasant surprise, they generously served me a miso soup and salad anyway (photo: http://bit.ly/2z8G2xR). My first item was the $8.50 Chicken Yakitori because I felt like having a couple of skewers of poultry (photo: http://bit.ly/2Kx8QVW). The meat alternated with scallions and red pepper, but the flavor was compromised by the gooey marinade. Better was the $12.50 Hamachi Kama which was yellowtail collar simply grilled with the skin left intact (photo: http://bit.ly/2KDjNVv).

The simpler, the better. That's why the kama worked for me, but sometimes simple is just too simple. That was the mistake I made with my third choice, the appropriately priced $5 Avocado Roll which was just that, avocado rolled in rice and nori (photo: http://bit.ly/2KN9afH). There wasn't enough flavor to make it interesting. I didn't find anything offensive about Kippu, it just felt interchangeable with any number of J-Town eateries offering the exact same dishes. Maybe that's good enough sometimes.

FOOD - 3 stars...middling Japanese fare with the kama the best of the plates I had
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...pretty standard decor for J-Town
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...a bit on the slow side
TOTAL - 3 stars...kinda nondescript for my taste

excerpts: Bf ordered chicken teriyaki bento and I ordered vegetarian 3 item bento with age-dashi tofu, veggie tempura, and avocado roll.
Paid $35 after tip.
avocado roll.author: Tammy P.
avocado roll.review:
My go-to place for bento boxes in SF!

1. Prices for the lunch bentos are the best value.
2. We recently went for dinner. Bf ordered chicken teriyaki bento and I ordered vegetarian 3 item bento with age-dashi tofu, veggie tempura, and avocado roll. Paid $35 after tip.
3. Bentos come with rice, salad, and miso soup.
4. One of our soups had a little bug/fly in it. Told the waitress and she replaced it, but who knows what she did with it.
5. Their salad dressing is the best!

avocado roll.review:
Kippu Japanese
SF J-Town
3pm Thursday 16th April 2015
Three Stars

We had the dog so we couldn't eat inside so we ordered takeout.  I got the Number 9 Combination: Beef Teriyaki and California Roll and Sara got the Vegetarian Bento with Avocado Roll and Vegetable Tempura.  The Boxes came with Salad and Rice but no Miso Soup since it was a togo order (which is typical).    It took a bit to get our food but it was pretty good.  The four pieces of california roll were delicious (wish there was more).  The steak was dry and lightly sauced. Overall, an affordable lunch on a nice San Francisco day.

excerpts: The orange blossom special roll, Cucumber salad, California roll and avocado roll.
The pieces were well sized.
avocado roll.author: Natascha G.
avocado roll.review:
We came on a Thursday night. Most of the tables were occupied, but due to the good size we had no trouble being seated.
The sushi is fresh and the service courteous.  
We ordered salmon, tuna and shrimp sushi. The orange blossom special roll, Cucumber salad, California roll and avocado roll.
The pieces were well sized.

excerpts: Asparagus is deep fried in the rolls which is not my thing.
Service was good.
asparagus.author: Sarah H.
asparagus.review: Yum sushi, we went twice during a 3 day visit!  I highly recommend the Washington Roll (Salmon with lemon).   Asparagus is deep fried in the rolls which is not my thing.  Service was good.

excerpts: Better was the $12.50 Hamachi Kama which was yellowtail collar
hamachi.author: Ed U.
hamachi.review:
I've sat in front of this inconspicuous Japanese restaurant several times whenever I took a seat on one of the worn benches on the cobblestoned Buchanan Street plaza. I decided to give it a try one evening as I was leisurely strolling through Japantown and found it about half full of customers. I didn't have high expectations about the quality based on some of the Yelp feedback I read, and frankly that preconception helped me get through my meal without incident.

I decided on three smaller items off their menu, but to my pleasant surprise, they generously served me a miso soup and salad anyway (photo: http://bit.ly/2z8G2xR). My first item was the $8.50 Chicken Yakitori because I felt like having a couple of skewers of poultry (photo: http://bit.ly/2Kx8QVW). The meat alternated with scallions and red pepper, but the flavor was compromised by the gooey marinade. Better was the $12.50 Hamachi Kama which was yellowtail collar simply grilled with the skin left intact (photo: http://bit.ly/2KDjNVv).

The simpler, the better. That's why the kama worked for me, but sometimes simple is just too simple. That was the mistake I made with my third choice, the appropriately priced $5 Avocado Roll which was just that, avocado rolled in rice and nori (photo: http://bit.ly/2KN9afH). There wasn't enough flavor to make it interesting. I didn't find anything offensive about Kippu, it just felt interchangeable with any number of J-Town eateries offering the exact same dishes. Maybe that's good enough sometimes.

FOOD - 3 stars...middling Japanese fare with the kama the best of the plates I had
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...pretty standard decor for J-Town
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...a bit on the slow side
TOTAL - 3 stars...kinda nondescript for my taste

excerpts: The last roll was something with imitation crab meat and avocado inside, and salmon and hamachi on top.
hamachi.author: Lily W.
hamachi.review:
Is pretty meh, but that's to be expected. When you go to Japantown, you're not going for the top of the line, absolutely best sushi. But you're looking to hit a craving.

Spicy Killer Roll: Not really spicy, more of a sriracha spice. The tuna on top was pretty decent.

Spider roll: Was solid, but spider rolls tend to be okay.

Nice Roll: Not so nice. The tempura shrimp was old, and really over battered. 

The last roll was something with imitation crab meat and avocado inside, and salmon and hamachi on top. Not bad, was relatively fresh.

The tako in the takoyaki was pretty good, though I wish they cooked the takoyaki a little longer. The dough was a little too raw-ish.


That being said, the service was really good and people were very attentive. If the owners splurged a little for fresher product, I think this place could be much better.

excerpts: Also tried the edamame and the hamachi roll.
The edamame were over cooked but plentiful - we actually didn't finish them.
The hamachi roll was fine - nothing super memorable but it tasted good in the moment.
The hamachi roll was fine - nothing super memorable but it tasted good in the moment.
hamachi.author: Amy R.
hamachi.review:
I think this place is pretty accurately rated at around 3-3.5 stars. The food is run-of-the-mill Japanese American cuisine! 

The restaurant is really small - definitely not wheelchair accessible. And there are some steps out front and inside. The space to go use the restroom is also very tight and around a sharp corner. 

We got a veggie bento box and a steak teriyaki bento box late on a Friday night. Also tried the edamame and the hamachi roll. 

Bento boxes were good and just as you'd expect. It seems vegetarians have quite a few options! 
The steak teriyaki was tender and not over cooked. The portion felt fair. 

The edamame were over cooked but plentiful - we actually didn't finish them. 

The hamachi roll was fine - nothing super memorable but it tasted good in the moment.

excerpts: The hamachi also tasted exceptionally well.
For the affordable price, I enjoyed the meal very much with the wonderful hot tea as well.
hamachi.author: Joshua M.
hamachi.review: I went to Kippu Japanese Cuisine on a Wednesday night to eat some good sushi. The service was great and friendly throughout the entire meal. I ordered their Daily Special A which comes with miso soup, salad, five pieces of nigiri, and california roll. The nigiri was great in that there was a high sashimi to rice ratio. The hamachi also tasted exceptionally well. For the affordable price, I enjoyed the meal very much with the wonderful hot tea as well.

excerpts:
What I get -
Tuna, salmon, hamachi rolls.
hamachi.author: Rajat S.
hamachi.review:
What I get -
Tuna, salmon, hamachi rolls.

I live in japantown and have been to Kippu many times.  It's a great place to get some well made sushi rolls. They do the conventional stuff really well and that's mostly what I'm a fan of in my sushi.  The quality of the fish varies sometimes but the tuna, salmon and shrimp are always reliable.  Their rolls and nigiri are great.  Tried the octopus there but it was a bit tough.

I've usually had good experiences here except once where I had to get take out and they messed up my order - but then I probably shouldn't have got sushi to go.

Sake when you're with 2-4 people is a great addition since this place has intimate seating and is good for groups that size.

excerpts: Just had perfectly fresh hamachi sashimi here.
Kippu is always fresh, always has quick, courteous service and always gives generous portions.
Our favorite sushi place in San Fran.
Should have 5 stars.
hamachi.author: Harrison K.
hamachi.review: Just had perfectly fresh hamachi sashimi here. Kippu is always fresh, always has quick, courteous service and always gives generous portions. Our favorite sushi place in San Fran. Should have 5 stars.

excerpts: We ordered hirame, sake, unagi, tobiko and a una-q roll (might have been called "caterpiller roll", unagi with cucumber, topped with avocado).
We weren't expecting much from a Japanese restaurant right on the tourist strip, but Kippu's fish was really good.
Nice temperature, good texture and larger pieces than I would've expected.
sake.author: Jason G.
sake.review:
We sat at the sushi bar and were happily surprised. Kippu was the only open restaurant later in the evening that seemed more dedicated to sushi (with an actual sushi bar). We ordered hirame, sake, unagi, tobiko and a una-q roll (might have been called "caterpiller roll", unagi with cucumber, topped with avocado).   We weren't expecting much from a Japanese restaurant right on the tourist strip, but Kippu's fish was really good. Nice temperature, good texture and larger pieces than I would've expected. More importantly the sushi rice was a really well done: vinegar with just a touch of sweet, very similar to my own recipe. I'm pretty sure the place was Korean owned, which isn't a surprise these days in J-town.  

The service was a bit sparse, as it was two hosts/servers/bussers for maybe 15 tables and you could not order anything, even sushi, via the sushi bar.  So ordering, paying, etc., often had a bit more wait than expected. 

Overall, I was really happy with Kippu and would definitely stop in again.

excerpts: We kicked off dinner with sake and beer, so far so good.
Our server made sure we all had enough to drink.
We placed our orders; some standard rolls, miso soups, and a bento box.
The food looked questionable when it came out - against my better judgement and having had my fair share of grocery store sushi, I figured I'd be okay.
Boy, was I wrong.
The raw fish was on the warm, chewy side
but I ignored my gut (at first) and powered through.
sake.author: Erika D.
sake.review:
Welp, safe to say you'll never see me in here again. I came in with a group of friends on a not-too-busy night, no wait but the number of seated parties convinced us that it would probably be an alright place. 

Before we get too deep in it, I do want to acknowledge the wait staff and their attentiveness. It's not their fault the food made our whole group sick. 

We kicked off dinner with sake and beer, so far so good. Our server made sure we all had enough to drink. We placed our orders; some standard rolls, miso soups, and a bento box. The food looked questionable when it came out - against my better judgement and having had my fair share of grocery store sushi, I figured I'd be okay. Boy, was I wrong. The raw fish was on the warm, chewy side but I ignored my gut (at first) and powered through. Everyone in the group had their fill, we paid the bill, and went on our merry way. 

Fast forward five hours to the middle of the night. I could not ignore my gut anymore and...well, I'll spare the gory details. I followed up with my pals and the story was consistent across the board. 

I wanted to like this place, but for my own good and health I can't.

excerpts: The sake was good and the service was also good but they can improve a bit.
I was expecting higher quality type of sushi since they are in Japantown.
sake.author: Martin A.
sake.review: They have a great variety of sushi rolls. The sake was good and the service was also good but they can improve a bit. I was expecting higher quality type of sushi since they are in Japantown.

excerpts: I had seen Kippu before, but never got the chance to give them a try, so for the sake of adventure, I did.
sake.author: Jei C.
sake.review:
*churrs lightly* 
Ah Japantown. always a wonderful place to go for this cat. growing up nearby, trips to Japantown always meant that some good Japanese food would likely be a part of each trip.  whether it be a sit down meal at a restaurant, or a quick to go item from nijiya market, "J-Town" is all about good food.

I decided to take a venture to this little side restaurant with some friends of mine. I had seen Kippu before, but never got the chance to give them a try, so for the sake of adventure, I did. 

Kippu is a very cozy narrow restaurant that seems to have mostly younger people working there. I noticed that their menu had many wonderful pictures of the different sushi rolls they offered, and instantly I became quite excited to give a few a try. 

I saw numerous individuals on yelp talking about the "flaming dragon" roll, so I opted to give that a try. my friends ordered some other rolls to sample. and after a bit of a wait, we were served. 

of the numerous rolls we had, I feel that while they were quite good, some of the fish didn't taste very "fresh" to me. not that they were old or spoiled, just that I feel I have tasted fresher. maybe that's just the cat in me being picky, but that is my feeling. the flavor of the rolls we had were decent, nothing too crazy or overwhelming, basically your standard decent sushi. 

the flaming dragon I saw many speaking of is definitely a show piece! they bring the foil wrapped roll on FIRE which is visually appealing. although I feel the roll itself while good, wasn't too much special. 

service here is very nice and polite and they were very attentive to us which I highly appreciate. 

overall, I'd say that Kippu is a fairly priced sushi restaurant that isn't the best in the world, but isn't bad either! worth a shot if you are in japantown and don't want to go to one of the "main" restaurants in the mall. 
*Chirp!*

excerpts: The oyster shooters were somewhat bearable; this was a mix of mostly ponzu sauce and maybe a drop of sake with a quail egg and a very good sized oyster.
My middle sister did gag on the ponzu mixture though.
sake.author: Michelle N.
sake.review:
Yo, the food here sucks. You know when the man topping for all dishes is sriracha, they probably aren't the most skilled when it comes to culinary arts.

I chose this place for my birthday dinner with my sisters because it looked super cute from the outside. The wait staff and pleasing aesthetics earn the two stars.

The food was awful though. You'd think a restaurant can't go wrong with raw oysters...lol...each oyster was "decorated" with a dot of sriracha. Then we had the seared ahi tuna, again "decorated" with sricacha. The oyster shooters were somewhat bearable; this was a mix of mostly ponzu sauce and maybe a drop of sake with a quail egg and a very good sized oyster. My middle sister did gag on the ponzu mixture though. Hahaha.

The roll we ordered had a decent amount of baked scallops on it, but this is not enough to come back! Go to another place! Good birthday memory. Hahaha.

excerpts: There are beer & sake bottles on display, but this place is so new that it currently has
*no alcohol
license*.
Don't plan to take your 21st birthday entourage here just yet.
(But when you do, text me.)
sake.author: Dan B.
sake.review:
Walk over to Daiso and get a $1.50 Asian cowboy hat. Now you're ready to eat at Kippu, with its country-western music that enveloped the first 10-15 minutes of my visit before 180'ing to Kpop.

The miso soup smelled like one thing and one thing only: when I was little, I had a He-Man playset of a claw trap to catch foes and punish them with green slime pouring overhead - THAT. I didn't have to nasally investigate or reminisce either. The split-second the soup bowl hit the table, that smell came all the way back from the 80s right then and there. After deliberation, I eventually took a reluctant benefit-of-the-doubt sip. I shouldn't have.

Take time to pore over the creative and often lawsuit-inviting names of all the sushi rolls. "Chuck Noris" [sic], "Finding Nemo", "Forrest Gump", "Monkey Brain", and maaaany more await you. There's even "Victoria's Secret". But in that case, where's "Agent Provocateur"? Or straight-up "Costco" (you know who you are).

Also, get the frequent flyer miles card. Once you & your new hat have $dined$ here 10 times, you get $10 off your next meal. You'll need it if your portions are like what I got for what I paid.

I'm going with just under 3 stars.

FYI: There are beer & sake bottles on display, but this place is so new that it currently has *no alcohol license*. Don't plan to take your 21st birthday entourage here just yet. (But when you do, text me.)

excerpts: My husband and I love to get their hot sake and a vegetarian bento box before heading to the Sundance Theatre nearby.
sake.author: Circadian R.
sake.review: My husband and I love to get their hot sake and a vegetarian bento box before heading to the Sundance Theatre nearby.

excerpts: Also enjoyed the hirame (halibut), sake (salmon) and unagi
(eel).
sake.author: Elizabeth L.
sake.review:
3.5-star food
2.8-star service

FOOD

Nigiri
Ono (super white tuna) was fantastic - thrilled to find it here as many sushi bars often don't have ono. Also enjoyed the hirame (halibut), sake (salmon) and unagi (eel). While the fish was fresh, the construction was sub-par - the fish kept separating from the rice. 

Skip the uni and roe (term) - these were mediocre.

Starters
Seaweed salad was excellent -  not too salty/sweet
Kaki fried (oysters): panko-breaded, tasty and plump

SERVICE
Sushi chef was pleasant, but otherwise service was non-existent. Server didn't check on us until nearly the end of our meal, which almost seemed like an afterthought. 

Pricing is reasonable.

excerpts: Everyone really enjoyed their food (and this was not just because we had been drinking sake...).
To top it all off, the waiters all sang very exuberantly to my friend for her bday, and brought her a dessert on the house which was big enough for literally everyone at the table to have some.
The bill was really reasonable considering the beer & sake, all the food, and the great service.
sake.author: Caroline K.
sake.review:
I have been meaning to write this review for about a month now.  My friend's birthday was middle of September and we came here randomly, after wandering Japantown for a bit looking for a place to eat.

We had a big group of people (~10), and we ordered a lot of rolls, appetizers, drinks, bento boxes etc.  They handled it really well, and were SUPER friendly to all of us.  The food came out in stages of course, but they tried to make sure everyone had at least one of their dishes in the first round so that no one would be waiting and hungry. Everyone really enjoyed their food (and this was not just because we had been drinking sake...).  To top it all off, the waiters all sang very exuberantly to my friend for her bday, and brought her a dessert on the house which was big enough for literally everyone at the table to have some.  Yum!

The bill was really reasonable considering the beer & sake, all the food, and the great service.  It came to about $50pp, including paying for the bday girl and tipping well.

I would definitely consider bringing another large group here.  I can't believe our luck to come without a reservation, at 7pm on a Friday night, and still make it in with like a 5 minute wait (while they set up the table).  And the service really made the evening!  Our waiters were so friendly and our birthday girl really enjoyed getting the princess treatment!

excerpts: Hot sake for cold days, and a warm atmosphere.
This is a decent place for food.
sake.author: Matt W.
sake.review: Nicely priced. The sushi is good,  and dinner bento box is filling.   People are moderately friendly.  Hot sake for cold days, and a warm atmosphere.  This is a decent place for food.

excerpts: Love this place's SAKE!
Sake is salmon nigiri.
They use best part of salmon to make the nigiri.
Very time I came here I will order at least 3 orders sake, if I came with friends, we may order more than 6orders.
Service are friendly and helpful!
Definitely will come back and this is the best Japanese food in sf!
sake.author: Cyan C.
sake.review: Love this place's SAKE! Sake is salmon nigiri. They use best part of salmon to make the nigiri. Very time I came here I will order at least 3 orders sake, if I came with friends, we may order more than 6orders. Service are friendly and helpful! Definitely will come back and this is the best Japanese food in sf!

excerpts: Good quality fish, good sake
, I'm happy.
sake.author: Mario A.
sake.review: I was in a bad mood when I laid out my comments. It's really my go-to place for convenience and always open when other places closed for lunch. Good quality fish, good sake, I'm happy.

excerpts: Although, the sake was kind of weak in flavor.
Given some of the other options in J-Town, I think I'd come back for some cheap sake bombs and light snacks, but that's it.
sake.author: Josh S.
sake.review: When I moved to SF (from LA) I thought the J-Town here would kick LA's Little Tokyo's butt!  Sadly, I was mistaken and left to choose from a sea of restaurants with mostly 3 star ratings.  I ordered the katsudon which was dried out and chewy. The water content from the eggs and onions leaked and made my rice soggy.  The flavor was alright, but nothing spectacular.  The saving grace was the cheap drink prices.  Although, the sake was kind of weak in flavor. Given some of the other options in J-Town, I think I'd come back for some cheap sake bombs and light snacks, but that's it.

excerpts: We first only ordered beers and sake and she immediately said we have to order food to be there.
We said we were looking over the menu and she waited at the table for several minutes for an order.
She finally went back to her stand and stared at us the entire time thereafter.
She was so angry that we finally asked for the bill and left.
On our way out she asked us never to return!
In addition to the completely uncomfortable experience, the restaurant was overheating and the it smelled like old ware washing throughout the front.
sake.author: Casey C.
sake.review:
This was one of the worst experiences I have had in terms of service. We went at 4:30 one afternoon and with a party of 5 we were 1 of two tables in the restaurant with over 80% open tables otherwise. We first only ordered beers and sake and she immediately said we have to order food to be there. We said we were looking over the menu and she waited at the table for several minutes for an order. She finally went back to her stand and stared at us the entire time thereafter. She was so angry that we finally asked for the bill and left. On our way out she asked us never to return! In addition to the completely uncomfortable experience, the restaurant was overheating and the it smelled like old ware washing throughout the front. All the cups provided were sticky and the tables were not wiped entirely clean.  

I really recommend choosing another option in the area and avoiding this one. Aside from service I am concerned about cleanliness!

excerpts: We also got hot and cold sake, the hot sake went down really smooth and the cold sake had these interesting gold flakes in it, but both were good.
The staff were quick to remove plates and to refill all of our drinks.
Overall a wonderful experience, the only reason why I couldn't give 5 stars is that this isn't the BEST sushi I've ever had but this business is certainly deserving of 4 solid stars.
I will return.
sake.author: Guisela L.
sake.review: First official review for me...awesome. Ok so let me start with my family is friends with the owner here but that won't stop me from writing an honest review. The location is conveniently right off the street and its nestled in a cute corner like location. The place is clean and the staff greeted us with a warm welcome even before they knew that we knew the owner. Overall the food was pretty good and everything tasted fresh. We ordered everything from nigiri, sashimi, hwe dub bap (Korean style sushi bowl) and dessert. Because we knew the owner he surprised us with the flaming dragon roll which comes on out on a plate on fire and even though we tend to not like cooked sushi this roll was delicious, I recommend it to everyone. We also received miso soup and salad which are the usual tasting fare but I was happy to receive it in any case. We also got hot and cold sake, the hot sake went down really smooth and the cold sake had these interesting gold flakes in it, but both were good. The staff were quick to remove plates and to refill all of our drinks. Overall a wonderful experience, the only reason why I couldn't give 5 stars is that this isn't the BEST sushi I've ever had but this business is certainly deserving of 4 solid stars. I will return.

excerpts: This is my first time here, but the Lion King Roll, Sashimi Combo and Sake lunch we had was delicious!
sake.author: Rafael C.
sake.review: Three Stars??? This is my first time here, but the Lion King Roll, Sashimi Combo and Sake lunch we had was delicious!

excerpts: Great Hat Sake.
Sake also means salmon.
Sake can also mean tuna.
They really want a quick giving and taking of the check transaction even if you want dessert.
But if you don't want an ice cream, you won't want dessert anyways, right?
There could be curtains dividing all the tables along the walls so each group could engage in secret activities, but they chose to take those curtains down it seems.
I didn't use the bathroom, but I bet it smells a lot better than the bathrooms at the Apple cupertino headquarters in beijing, cupertino because those smelled like poop.
sake.author: Michael H.
sake.review: Great atmos.  The menu is wrong, but that's ok because the waitress will tell you what it means and she is nice. Great Hat Sake.  Sake also means salmon.  Sake can also mean tuna.  They really want a quick giving and taking of the check transaction even if you want dessert.  But if you don't want an ice cream, you won't want dessert anyways, right?  There could be curtains dividing all the tables along the walls so each group could engage in secret activities, but they chose to take those curtains down it seems.  I didn't use the bathroom, but I bet it smells a lot better than the bathrooms at the Apple cupertino headquarters in beijing, cupertino because those smelled like poop.

excerpts: They do have the oyster, sake, roe and scallion
but I don't know what makes it red.
Either way, it was rather disappointing.
I just ordered beer, sake and appetizers.
Their appetizers are pretty good, we ordered their raw oysters, seaweed, tofu and some other stuff?
sake.author: James Y.
sake.review:
So my friend and I traversed Japantown in San Francisco in hopes of finding a place that served Oyster Shooters.  I mean I've had some good Oyster Shooters back in the day but most of them were from Southern California and after moving to Miami for a few years and moving back to the Bay Area, boy how I've missed a good Oyster Shooter.  Their Kippu has them!  They're tricky in that it's not listed under drinks but deeply entrenched in their Appetizer section.  What's interesting is that their Oyster Shooters are of a red color.  They do have the oyster, sake, roe and scallion but I don't know what makes it red.  Either way, it was rather disappointing.  I don't think I'd go again for their Oyster Shooters.

Okay, Oyster Shooter aside, the atmosphere was really nice, it's at a lower level so when you look out the window you're seeing people's feet but that has a nice feel to it.  Their service is decently fast and friendly, for the most part.  My buddy and I just ordered beer, sake and appetizers.  Their appetizers are pretty good, we ordered their raw oysters, seaweed, tofu and some other stuff?  I don't remember anymore. 

One note, do not order their cold tofu, it's just tofu you buy from a store cut up and served.  I added my own soy sauce :( 

Anyway, we had a good time here, maybe because we were drinking heavily, since that tend to make things "happier" for people.  Overall experience was good but all the foods we ordered came drastically short of our expectations except for the raw oysters and the beer.  But it's not like they brewed the beer, so just the raw oysters.  Their appetizers definitely need an overhaul.

excerpts: I think this is not Japanese owned, and it has a weak sake menu.
Not coming back.
sake.author: Scott L.
sake.review: Meh.  They seemed confused when I asked for sashimi.  The Ferrari roll sounded promising, and both times I have ordered it, the spicy tuna tasted and smelled really fishy.  I don't know that they are committed to quality.  I think this is not Japanese owned, and it has a weak sake menu.  Not coming back.  :/

excerpts: We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl.
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush.
sake.author: Michelle T.
sake.review:
After roaming around SF, my friends and I wanted some sushi so we decided to go eat somewhere around Japan Town. After walking around for a while, we went to Kippu because we saw their wide variety of sushi rolls. The waiter and chefs greeted us upon our entrance and received a complimentary miso soup right after we got our table. 
The miso soup was average, can't go wrong with that. We ordered a Lion King roll, Dragon Roll, Sake Roll, and a Spicy Tuna roll, along with a Katsu Donburi bowl. 
The raw fish in the rolls had a weird consistency and broke apart like mush. The rice was a little rough and didn't taste fresh. The katsu seemed over cooked and had been sitting out for a while. The food was mediocre and their prices do not correspond to their level of precision they put into their sushi. To be very blunt, this sushi was one of the worst yet. And I would not come back unless their sushi has risen to the prices they charge here.

excerpts: the milky sake we had complemented the meal well, and the service was impeccable.
the price wasn't bad either.
sake.author: Jasen S.
sake.review: i really can't get in to sushi. I have tried sushi at least a dozen times, and I just can't get in to it...just not my thing. even though I will never be a sushi person, this restaurant is phenomenal. I only ordered the kotate, as far as sushi, which was so dang good, and everything else was equally as good. the miso soup was great, the shrimp tempura was mouth watering, and the teriyaki chicken was the best I've ever had. the milky sake we had complemented the meal well, and the service was impeccable. the price wasn't bad either. :)

excerpts: We ordered sushi and I have to tell you the Albacore was SOOOOO soft, it melted in our mouth as soon as it hit.
The crazy baked scallop sushi also melted in our mouths with every bite.
I would say the food here is worth coming back.
albacore.author: Randy L.
albacore.review:
Kippu is located on Buchanan St. between Sutter and Post.  It is a quaint, small Japanese Restaurant that holds about 45-50 ppl.  The menu selection is vast with many different combinations of sushi, bento boxes, and proteins (beef, chix, fish).  Pricing is comparable to that in Irvine/Costa Mesa, so I consider the price reasonable from where I live.

We ordered sushi and I have to tell you the Albacore was SOOOOO soft, it melted in our mouth as soon as it hit.  The crazy baked scallop sushi also melted in our mouths with every bite.  I would say the food here is worth coming back.  Total for 3 ppl $76: 5 sushi rolls, rolled spicy tuna (cone), and Chicken Donburi.

There are so many restaurants, it is hard to say this is a 5-Star when I have not tried them all.  Yay, I AM a fan and will return.

excerpts: I ordered a soda, brown rice (which they ended up being out of), and some BBQ albacore to get me through to dinner, and it was mission accomplished!
However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore...
I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor.
The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own.
The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up.
The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen!
I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!
However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore...
I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor.
The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own.
The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up.
The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen!
I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!
albacore.author: Danielle S.
albacore.review: While shopping through japantown I needed a quick between lunch and dinner snack. Since it was an awkward time most of the places nearby were closed with the exception of Kippu. I ordered a soda, brown rice (which they ended up being out of), and some BBQ albacore to get me through to dinner, and it was mission accomplished! However I wasn't especially impressed with the BBQ albacore... I was expecting bold flavors that I usually experience with my usual order, but this was lacking any kind of flavor. The service was quick, and the prices were very very reasonable, but I just wish the quality stood up on its own. The restaurant itself is very small and interestingly set up. The bathroom has some of the most comical tile work I've ever seen! I recommend Kippu for a quick nosh, but don't expect to be blown away!

excerpts: We ordered hirame, sake, unagi, tobiko and a una-q roll (might have been called "caterpiller roll", unagi with cucumber, topped with avocado).
We weren't expecting much from a Japanese restaurant right on the tourist strip, but Kippu's fish was really good.
Nice temperature, good texture and larger pieces than I would've expected.
hirame.author: Jason G.
hirame.review:
We sat at the sushi bar and were happily surprised. Kippu was the only open restaurant later in the evening that seemed more dedicated to sushi (with an actual sushi bar). We ordered hirame, sake, unagi, tobiko and a una-q roll (might have been called "caterpiller roll", unagi with cucumber, topped with avocado).   We weren't expecting much from a Japanese restaurant right on the tourist strip, but Kippu's fish was really good. Nice temperature, good texture and larger pieces than I would've expected. More importantly the sushi rice was a really well done: vinegar with just a touch of sweet, very similar to my own recipe. I'm pretty sure the place was Korean owned, which isn't a surprise these days in J-town.  

The service was a bit sparse, as it was two hosts/servers/bussers for maybe 15 tables and you could not order anything, even sushi, via the sushi bar.  So ordering, paying, etc., often had a bit more wait than expected. 

Overall, I was really happy with Kippu and would definitely stop in again.

excerpts: Also enjoyed the hirame (halibut), sake (salmon) and unagi
(eel).
hirame.author: Elizabeth L.
hirame.review:
3.5-star food
2.8-star service

FOOD

Nigiri
Ono (super white tuna) was fantastic - thrilled to find it here as many sushi bars often don't have ono. Also enjoyed the hirame (halibut), sake (salmon) and unagi (eel). While the fish was fresh, the construction was sub-par - the fish kept separating from the rice. 

Skip the uni and roe (term) - these were mediocre.

Starters
Seaweed salad was excellent -  not too salty/sweet
Kaki fried (oysters): panko-breaded, tasty and plump

SERVICE
Sushi chef was pleasant, but otherwise service was non-existent. Server didn't check on us until nearly the end of our meal, which almost seemed like an afterthought. 

Pricing is reasonable.

excerpts: We also ordered the rock and roll sushi, which includes unagi, shrimp, and avocado.
unagi.author: Rose Marie J.
unagi.review: I am having the bento box with salmon teriyaki, tempura, and the California roll.  C is having mixed tempura.  We also ordered the rock and roll sushi, which includes unagi, shrimp, and avocado.

I was given the unagi rolll
and I brought it to the wait staff's attention.
They told me it was a dragon roll.
They came back a few seconds later and realized it wasn't and took the plate.
They told me it was a dragon roll.
They came back a few seconds later and realized it wasn't and took the plate.
However, the table they had given my dragon roll had already started eating it.
However, the table they had given my dragon roll had already started eating it.

Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.

unagi.author: Eric H.
unagi.review:
We went in here and the food was decent. Rolls are big. Giving 1 star because they mixed my order up and refused to fix it. Part of my order was a dragon roll and another table behind us orderd an unagi roll. They both are similar except one has shrimp tempura inside while the other has crab.

I was given the unagi rolll and I brought it to the wait staff's attention. They told me it was a dragon roll. They came back a few seconds later and realized it wasn't and took the plate. However, the table they had given my dragon roll had already started eating it. Instead of remaking my roll they came back, gave me the unagi roll again, and double downed on it being a dragon roll.

Just remake the roll for god sakes.

excerpts: $12.5 caterpillar roll only had really tiny pieces of unagi in there...
Double salmon roll's salmon didn't taste fresh...
Gyoza tasted bad...
unagi.author: Jessie K.
unagi.review: Super small portion for not so cheap prices. Paid $35 for two tiny rolls with small pieces of fish, and six pieces of Gyoza. Really disappointing. Food tasted meh... $12.5 caterpillar roll only had really tiny pieces of unagi in there... Double salmon roll's salmon didn't taste fresh... Gyoza tasted bad...

excerpts: and they were chock full of fresh, delicious fish, and my unagi hand roll had 4 big pieces of bbq eel in it.
unagi.author: Margot D.
unagi.review:
Stumbled on this place while being a tourist and wandering through Japantown.

Atmosphere was great - not too big, pretty private areas for seating in spite of being one big room.

Menu was great - lots of Nigiri Sushi options, special rolls and basic ones too. 

Great quality and volume of food for the prices.

Quality and volume of food was excellent - rolls were decent in size, very evenly diced tiny vegetables in vegetarian rolls, and extremely fresh. We only ordered a few small rolls and a hand roll and they were chock full of fresh, delicious fish, and my unagi hand roll had 4 big pieces of bbq eel in it. The other surprise - was that we each received a miso soup and a salad in spite of only ordering ~$10 worth of sushi each.

Service was excellent and fast - rolls came out quickly, servers were attentive and answered questions about the different rolls.

unagi.author: Frank N.
unagi.review:
haven't been here forever but i guess it changed hands many times.

service was terrible, asked for a unagi roll and asked what was in it, she went and asked the chef and came back saying it's unagi and avocado.  she then bring over a unagi roll with crab in it even though she told me it only have unagi and avocado.  i said you told me it's unagi and avocado and she looked like that conversation never took place.  we also asked for the unagi sauce to be on the side and it showed up with unagi sauce all over the roll, soaked.  when i asked her, she was like, it's not me, it's the guy making the sushi.  see, i wrote here, sauce on the side.  he didn't do it, it's his fault.  i was like wtf.  who cares who fucked up, someone fucked up.  fix it!  but no, that offer was never made.

the food is horrible too.  i'll upload a picture of the lettuce that came with my soup later.

excerpts: After they took my order of 4 dishes - Post Roll, Washington Roll, Unagi Lover, and Ahi Tuna - we waited about 5 minutes for the miso soup which was not an issue.
However, after 30 minutes, the same waitress comes up to ask if we have ordered yet - she was ruffling through her pad to look for my order.
unagi.author: Ben L.
unagi.review:
This is the restaurant that made me decide to start a Yelp account.  My goal of this review is for anyone that works there to never provide this kind of experience to other customers.

1. Took close to 20 minutes to get any attention from the two waitresses to take our order. Obviously, this is not the first time anyone has experienced this, but for a restaurant that is less than 300 sq ft it was not acceptable.  I was also ignored twice with clear visual eye contact.  Two other parties had their order taken before mine was; I had a party of 2, the others were of 2 and 4.  

2. After they took my order of 4 dishes - Post Roll, Washington Roll, Unagi Lover, and Ahi Tuna - we waited about 5 minutes for the miso soup which was not an issue.  However, after 30 minutes, the same waitress comes up to ask if we have ordered yet - she was ruffling through her pad to look for my order.  She ends up going back to the cashier to find my order which at that point she tells me it will take 5 minutes to come out.  

3. She tried to compensate by providing edamame which was a nice gesture, however, the edamame was clearly old and had been sitting out in the open for a while.  It was sour (which it should never be), and much too soft like an old banana.  There was no way this can be OK to serve.  

4. The orders started to come in about 5-10 more minutes, all of which was significantly smaller than the picture.  Yes, it will never look identical to the picture, but it just looked like they didn't have enough ingredients to even complete the dish - even the rice on the rolls looked barren.  

I ended up paying about 65 dollars for this meal and it will be the last that I will ever spend there.  My girlfriend and I left hungry and totally dissatisfied with the food and service.  I've had bad restaurant experiences before and I do not have exuberant expectations, but from a customer service / technical support managerial background, this was unacceptable and needs to be improved on all ends.  Even if the quality of the food does not improve, I would continue to visit only if the service was there.  

If you get the chance to visit this restaurant, I recommend that you think twice about it before spending your hard earned cash.

excerpts: We ended up getting 3 rolls (The Lion King, The American, and a basic unagi roll) and the chef's choice nigiri and everything was pretty good.
I would give the food 3 1/2 stars, but the service bumped my review up to 4!
unagi.author: Angelique D.
unagi.review: My fam and I found ourselves in Japantown looking for a non-touristy, yummy sushi spot. We tried a well-reviewed-on-Yelp spot inside Peace Plaza but they had a minimum of $20 a person and we just didn't think we could pull that off (plus, I don't like being told what to spend). So we tried Kippu, even though the reviews were mixed on Yelp. For starters, the restaurant was pretty empty except for table right next to us that looked like it was the owner or something. Our waiter greeted us and promptly spilled water right next to me. No harm done and we weren't bothered by the spill at all. Next thing we know, the owner makes sure we ok and a few minutes later, brings us this fancy dish, "The Flaming Dragon." He tries to tell us what we're supposed it to with it...something about smelling and waiting a minute after the flames die out before we open it...but then just tells us he'll be back to help us. IT was this cool looking thing--something long wrapped in foil with flames literally coming from the bottom. So after it's not on fire he comes over and opens it up...it was a super yummy roll with a bunch of fish I can't remember and some of that delicious crab filling. It was delicious and really cool of him to bring it out to us juts because of a little spill. We ended up getting 3 rolls (The Lion King, The American, and a basic unagi roll) and the chef's choice nigiri and everything was pretty good. I would give the food 3 1/2 stars, but the service bumped my review up to 4! My fam got the green tea ice cream and they enjoyed that as well. Overall, it was great start to our SF dining experiences!

excerpts: We got a couple basic rolls, some baked rolls, unagi, and the miso ramen (huge bowl!).
Overall, it was alright.
I've had better sushi.
The restaurant itself was nicely decorated though.
unagi.author: Elle D.
unagi.review: I stumbled upon this place while on family trip. My parents were craving sushi, so we decided to try it. The service was ok, but the food took longer than I'd prefer. We got a couple basic rolls, some baked rolls, unagi, and the miso ramen (huge bowl!). Overall, it was alright. I've had better sushi. The restaurant itself was nicely decorated though.

excerpts: We ordered tamago as appetizer and it was the best I've ever had.
Lol.
Their sushi tastes so fresh and good.
Our waiter was really polite and he was also funny.
Thank you Brian for your customer service .
We will definitely be going there again.
tamago.author: Veronica G.
tamago.review: We went there for late dinner. And our server Brian was awesome. He took good care of us. The food was delicious. We ordered tamago as appetizer and it was the best I've ever had. Lol. Their sushi tastes so fresh and good. Our waiter was really polite and he was also funny. Thank you Brian for your customer service . We will definitely be going there again.

excerpts: The Dragon Roll and Tamago are great!
tamago.author: Anthony N.
tamago.review:
The Dragon Roll and Tamago are great! I have yet to try more things on the menu, but so far it has all been very good.

Side note: It was interesting to hear K-Pop circa 1998-2002 being played during lunch.

excerpts:
To start: 

- Agedashi tofu (fried tofu)
- Inari (sticky rice wrapped in sweet tofu) 

The agedashi tofu had the right batter which absorbed the sauce really well. 

The inari was delicious and pretty standard... hard to mess it up.
inari.author: Michael T.
inari.review:
I am so confused as to why there are so many negative reviews! 

Came here for a quick lunch with a friend, and I was thoroughly impressed. 

Upon sitting, we were asked what we wanted to drink (I think the waitress could see all the sweat dripping from my face, as we conquered a few hills to reach Kippu). We were served water promptly.

To start: 

- Agedashi tofu (fried tofu)
- Inari (sticky rice wrapped in sweet tofu) 

Both were fantastic. The agedashi tofu had the right batter which absorbed the sauce really well. 

The inari was delicious and pretty standard... hard to mess it up. 

My friend got a bento box with chicken teriyaki and tempura. I got the bento with chicken teriyaki and gyoza. 

Was it good? 

Well, with little talking in between, at the end I looked at our bento boxes. Every section of each of our bentos was cleaned out. 

It was good. 

A huge bonus and very much appreciated was the service. EFFICIENT and FRIENDLY! 

Seriously, as soon as we finished our appetizers, the empty/dirty dishes were immediately removed or replaced. Water was constantly filled up. When we finished one dish, the waitress would remind us that our next dishes were still on the way.

5/5 Stars. See you again, Kippu.

excerpts: My food was okay; I ordered the vegetarian bento box, which came with inari, vegetable tempura, miso soup, salad, and karrokes.
The quantity of food I received for the price (around $13) was pretty good, and overall I enjoyed my dinner, with the exception of the inari tofu.
It was soggy, hardly breaded and fried at all, and just tasted bad.
inari.author: Molly I.
inari.review:
My boyfriend and I had dinner here last week. While the food was acceptable, the service was not. Our waitress was not very friendly, and seemed as if she wanted to be anywhere but there. We had to ask her for water, which is understandable given California's drought. However, what was not understandable or acceptable was why she gave us half-full glasses of tap water, while the tables near us had full glasses of water with ice cubes. The waitress did not offer to refill our glasses once we finished the half-full water glasses, so we kept having to repeatedly ask her for more water (which we received in a slow manner). My food was okay; I ordered the vegetarian bento box, which came with inari, vegetable tempura, miso soup, salad, and karrokes. The quantity of food I received for the price (around $13) was pretty good, and overall I enjoyed my dinner, with the exception of the inari tofu. It was soggy, hardly breaded and fried at all, and just tasted bad. My boyfriend ordered the dinner bento box special, and the California roll portion of his meal literally came with two pieces. Finally, after sitting and waiting for our check for about 10 minutes after our plates had been cleared, we had to ask the waitress to please bring us our check, which took several more minutes. When she finally arrived at our table, she brought us someone else's check, so we had to go up to the front counter and ask for our proper check. 
We wanted to try a new restaurant in Japantown that we hadn't been to yet, so we chose this one. Next time, we'll be going somewhere where we know we will receive good food AND good service.

excerpts: Food was meh, worse Inari I've ever had...super bland.
Between food n service def won't go back.
inari.author: Michael S.
inari.review:
Came in during the Cherry Blossom Fest

Didn't acknowledge us when we came in, then saw the hostess/waitress standing by s table toward the back "waiting" for us. Forgot about giving us menus, had to go to counter for them. Aside from taking and bringing out our order, we were never checked on. No hello, no goodbye. Food was meh, worse Inari I've ever had...super bland. Between food n service def won't go back.

We weren't expecting much from a Japanese restaurant right on the tourist strip, but Kippu's fish was really good.
Nice temperature, good texture and larger pieces than I would've expected.
